title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to establish, document, and disseminate the organization's access control policy and procedures. This is important for security and compliance as it ensures that only authorized individuals have access to the organization's information systems and data.
description: This control requires the organization to develop and implement a formal, documented access control policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and management commitment. It also requires the organization to establish procedures to facilitate the implementation of the access control policy and associated access controls.
implementation_guidance: Develop an access control policy that includes the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and management commitment. The policy should align with the organization's mission, goals, and objectives
Document the policy and ensure it is approved by the management
Develop procedures to facilitate the implementation of the access control policy and associated access controls. These procedures should detail the steps necessary to execute the policy
Disseminate the policy and procedures to all relevant personnel and stakeholders
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures to ensure they remain relevant and effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for a documented and approved access control policy and procedures. They will evaluate whether the policy and procedures are disseminated to relevant personnel, and whether they are reviewed and updated regularly.

title: Account Management
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that access to system components is granted based on a valid need and is managed effectively throughout the lifecycle of user accounts. This is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access and potential misuse of system resources.
description: This control requires organizations to identify and select the following types of information system accounts: individual, group, system, guest/anonymous, emergency, and temporary. It also requires organizations to manage these accounts, including authorizing, establishing, activating, modifying, disabling, and removing them.
implementation_guidance: Identify the different types of system accounts that are necessary for your organization
Establish a process for authorizing and setting up these accounts. This process should include verifying the identity of the individual or group before granting access
Implement procedures for managing these accounts throughout their lifecycle. This includes regular reviews and updates to ensure that access privileges are still appropriate
Set up a process for disabling or removing accounts that are no longer needed or when users leave the organization
Document all processes and maintain records of account management activities
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified necessary system accounts, established processes for authorizing and managing these accounts, and is effectively implementing these processes. They will also look for documentation and records of account management activities.

title: Supervision and Review — Access Control
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization regularly supervises and reviews/analyzes information system access, thereby preventing unauthorized access and maintaining the integrity and confidentiality of the system.
description: This control requires organizations to supervise and review/analyze the activities of users with significant roles and responsibilities (like system administrators, security officers, etc.) on the information system. The frequency of review is determined by the organization based on risk assessment.
implementation_guidance: Identify Significant Roles:** Start by identifying users with significant roles and responsibilities that have the potential to impact system security
Define Review Frequency:** Based on the risk assessment, define the frequency of supervision and review/analysis of these users' activities
Implement Monitoring Tools:** Use system monitoring tools to track and log user activities
Conduct Reviews:** Regularly review and analyze the logged activities. Look for any unusual or unauthorized activities
Document Findings:** Document the findings of each review, including any actions taken in response to the findings
Update Access Controls:** Based on the findings, update access controls as necessary to prevent unauthorized activities
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified users with significant roles, defined the frequency of reviews, implemented monitoring tools, conducted regular reviews, documented findings, and updated access controls as necessary.

title: Access Enforcement
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization enforces approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies. This is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data and system resources.
description: This control requires the organization to enforce access control policies and associated access controls. It mandates that a system must prevent unauthorized access and provide authorized individuals with the appropriate access to perform their duties.
implementation_guidance: Identify and document the access control policies and procedures that are relevant to the system
Implement the identified access controls on the system, ensuring they align with the documented policies and procedures
Regularly review and update the access control policies and procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant
Train staff on the access control policies and procedures to ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in enforcing access controls
Monitor and review the enforcement of access controls to ensure they are effective and to identify any potential issues or areas for improvement
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented and is enforcing access control policies and procedures. They will also look for evidence that the organization is regularly reviewing and updating these policies and procedures, and that staff are trained on them.

title: Automated Marking
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that information systems automatically mark or label output from the system (e.g., emails, documents, data files) with appropriate security attributes. This helps in maintaining the confidentiality and integrity of the data, and aids in the enforcement of information flow control policies.
description: AC-15 requires that the information system marks or labels information system output with appropriate security attributes. These attributes could include classification level, dissemination controls, or other handling caveats.
implementation_guidance: Identify the types of output that the information system produces which require marking or labeling. This could include emails, documents, data files, etc
Define the appropriate security attributes for each type of output. This could be based on data classification, sensitivity, or other organizational policies

Implement mechanisms within the information system to automatically apply these security attributes to the identified outputs. This could involve configuring system settings, using third-party tools, or custom development
Test the implementation to ensure that the security attributes are correctly applied to the system output
Document the implementation in the System Security Plan (SSP), including the types of output marked, the security attributes used, and the mechanisms implemented
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the information system automatically marks or labels system output with the appropriate security attributes. They will also check that this is documented in the SSP.

title: Information Flow Enforcement
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized information transfer within the system. It is crucial for security and compliance as it helps protect sensitive information from being accessed or transferred by unauthorized individuals or processes.
description: This control requires the organization to enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between interconnected systems. It involves implementing security measures to restrict how information is input, processed, stored, and output.
implementation_guidance: Identify Information Flow:** Identify and document the flow of information within the system and between interconnected systems
Define Authorization Policies:** Develop and document policies that define approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information
Implement Enforcement Mechanisms:** Implement mechanisms that enforce the defined authorization policies. This may include access control lists, firewall rules, or data loss prevention technologies
Monitor and Review:** Regularly monitor and review the effectiveness of the enforcement mechanisms. Adjust as necessary to maintain effective control over information flow
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified information flows, defined authorization policies, implemented enforcement mechanisms, and regularly monitors and reviews the effectiveness of these mechanisms.

title: Separation of Duties
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent fraud, errors, and misuse of systems by dividing critical functions among different individuals or teams. This reduces the risk of a single individual having the ability to carry out and conceal malicious activities.
description: This control requires organizations to implement a separation of duties through assigned access authorizations. It ensures that no single individual has the ability to execute two conflicting duties, such as creating a user account and approving the same account.
implementation_guidance: Identify and document all roles and responsibilities within the organization that interact with the system
Determine and document conflicting roles that should not be assigned to the same individual
Implement mechanisms (like role-based access control) to enforce separation of duties
Regularly review and update roles, responsibilities, and access controls to ensure they still support effective separation of duties
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for documented roles and responsibilities, evidence of conflicting roles being separated, and mechanisms in place to enforce separation of duties. They will also check for regular reviews and updates to these roles and controls.

title: Least Privilege
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that users are granted the minimum levels of access – or permissions – necessary to complete their job functions. This reduces the potential for unauthorized access or damage to systems, data, or resources.
description: This control requires that the organization employs the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) which are necessary to accomplish assigned tasks in response to valid mission and business needs.
implementation_guidance: Identify all system users and their job functions
Determine the minimum set of privileges required for each user role
Configure user accounts to grant only the necessary privileges for each role
Regularly review and update user privileges to ensure they remain appropriate
Implement controls to prevent privilege escalation and enforce separation of duties
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has implemented the principle of least privilege, ensuring that users have only the access necessary to perform their job functions. They will also check that the organization regularly reviews and updates user privileges.

title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
purpose: The purpose of this control is to limit the risk of unauthorized access to an information system by limiting the number of unsuccessful logon attempts by a user. This helps to prevent cyber attacks such as brute force attacks, where an attacker tries to gain access by guessing passwords.
description: This control requires the system to enforce a limit on the number of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user. After reaching the limit, the system must automatically lock the account for a defined period of time or until the user's identity is manually verified.
implementation_guidance: Define a policy that specifies the maximum number of unsuccessful logon attempts allowed before the account is locked. The policy should also define the lockout duration
Configure the information system to enforce the defined policy. This can typically be done through the system's security settings
Implement a process for users to regain access to their accounts after a lockout. This could involve manual verification of the user's identity by an administrator
Regularly review and update the policy as necessary, considering factors such as the sensitivity of the information system and the potential impact of a lockout on user productivity
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has a policy for unsuccessful logon attempts and that the policy is being enforced by the information system. They will also check that there is a process for users to regain access after a lockout.

title: System Use Notification
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that users are aware of the information system usage policies and consent to them before gaining access. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to establish user accountability for their actions while using the system.
description: This control requires that the organization displays an approved system use notification message or banner before granting system access. The message should state the usage restrictions, legal agreements, and any monitoring policies.
implementation_guidance: Develop an approved system use notification message or banner. This should include information about usage restrictions, legal agreements, and any monitoring policies

Implement a mechanism to display the system use notification message or banner before granting system access. This could be at the login screen or as a pop-up message after login but before access is granted
Ensure that the system use notification message or banner cannot be bypassed or ignored by the user. The user should be required to acknowledge the message before gaining access to the system
Document the implementation of the system use notification in the System Security Plan (SSP)
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a system use notification message or banner is displayed before system access is granted. They will also verify that the message includes the required information and that users are required to acknowledge the message before gaining access.

title: Previous Logon Notification
purpose: The purpose of this control is to inform users of their last successful and unsuccessful logon attempts. This is important for security and compliance because it helps users identify any unauthorized access attempts on their accounts, which could indicate a potential security breach.
description: This control requires the system to notify the user, upon successful logon, of the date and time of the last logon and any unsuccessful logon attempts since the last logon.
implementation_guidance: Configure the system to record the date and time of each user's successful and unsuccessful logon attempts
Implement a mechanism that retrieves this information and displays it to the user upon successful logon
Ensure that the system also informs the user of any unsuccessful logon attempts since their last successful logon
Regularly review and update the system's logon notification settings to ensure they remain effective and compliant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the system notifies users of their last successful logon and any unsuccessful logon attempts. They will also check that the system records the date and time of each logon attempt.

title: Concurrent Session Control
purpose: The purpose of this control is to limit the number of concurrent sessions for a user, reducing the risk of unauthorized access and potential misuse of system resources. This is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent potential security breaches that could occur if a user's session is hijacked or if a user leaves a session open on an unattended machine.
description: This control requires the organization to limit the number of concurrent sessions for each system user. The limit can be set by the organization based on user/role, system, network, and other relevant factors.
implementation_guidance: Define a policy that outlines the maximum number of concurrent sessions allowed per user. This policy should consider the user's role, the system's sensitivity, and the network's security level
Implement system configurations or use a session management tool to enforce the defined concurrent session limit
Regularly review and update the policy as necessary, considering changes in user roles, system sensitivity, and network security
Train users on the policy and the importance of logging out when sessions are no longer needed
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a defined policy for concurrent session control and that this policy is being enforced. They will also check if the policy is reviewed and updated regularly, and if users are aware of and understand the policy.

title: Device Lock
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized access to an organization's information system due to unattended devices. It helps to maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the system and its data.
description: This control requires that the organization implement mechanisms that lock a user session after a defined period of inactivity. The lock remains until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.
implementation_guidance: Define a policy that specifies a maximum period of inactivity for different types of devices used in the organization
Implement technical solutions that automatically lock devices after the defined period of inactivity. This could be through native operating system settings or third-party software
Ensure that the device lock requires the user to re-authenticate using their credentials to regain access
Train users on the importance of not leaving their devices unattended and the risks associated with it
Regularly review and update the device lock policy and its implementation as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has a policy for device lock due to inactivity, that the policy is implemented, and that users are required to re-authenticate to regain access. They will also check that the organization has trained its users on the policy and the associated risks.

title: Session Termination
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized access to an information system by automatically terminating user sessions after a defined condition or period of inactivity. This is important for security and compliance as it reduces the risk of unauthorized access or data leakage due to unattended sessions.
description: This control requires the organization to implement a mechanism that automatically terminates a user session after a defined condition or period of inactivity.
implementation_guidance: Define a policy for session termination that includes a specific period of inactivity after which a session will be terminated
Implement a session management mechanism that can track user activity and automatically terminate sessions after the defined period of inactivity
Configure the session management mechanism to enforce the session termination policy
Train users on the importance of logging out when they have finished using the system and the risks associated with leaving sessions unattended
Regularly review and update the session termination policy and mechanism as necessary to ensure they remain effective and aligned with the organization's risk tolerance and operational requirements
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a defined policy for session termination, a mechanism in place to enforce this policy, and that users are aware of the importance of logging out when they have finished using the system.

title: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
purpose: This control is designed to limit and control the actions that can be performed on a system without identification or authentication. This is important for security and compliance as it reduces the potential for unauthorized access or actions within a system.
description: AC-14 requires organizations to identify and document specific user actions that can be performed on the system without identification or authentication. The organization must also ensure that these actions do not negatively impact the security or integrity of the system.
implementation_guidance: Identify and document all user actions that can be performed without identification or authentication
Evaluate the potential security risks associated with each action
Implement controls to mitigate identified risks, such as limiting the scope of actions or adding additional security measures
Regularly review and update the list of permitted actions, especially after system updates or changes
Train staff to understand the importance of these controls and how to adhere to them
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for a documented list of actions that can be performed without identification or authentication. They will also evaluate whether the organization has assessed the potential security risks of these actions and implemented appropriate controls to mitigate these risks.

title: Security and Privacy Attributes
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization associates security and privacy attributes with individuals and/or devices as part of the identification and authentication process. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to prevent unauthorized access to systems and data, and ensures that only authorized individuals/devices can perform specific actions.
description: This control requires the organization to associate security and privacy attributes with individuals and/or devices during the identification and authentication process. These attributes are used to enforce access control policies and to make decisions about the types of transactions that individuals and devices are permitted to perform.
implementation_guidance: Identify the security and privacy attributes that are relevant to your organization's access control policies
Develop a process for associating these attributes with individuals and devices during the identification and authentication process
Implement this process across all systems and devices that require identification and authentication
Regularly review and update the security and privacy attributes as necessary to reflect changes in access control policies or the threat environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified relevant security and privacy attributes, and that these attributes are being associated with individuals and devices during the identification and authentication process. They will also look for evidence that the organization is using these attributes to enforce access control policies and to make decisions about the types of transactions that individuals and devices are permitted to perform.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. For example, assessors might examine system documentation to verify that the organization has identified relevant security and privacy attributes, interview personnel to confirm that these attributes are being used to enforce access control policies, and test systems to verify that the attributes are being properly associated with individuals and devices during the identification and authentication process.

title: Remote Access
purpose: The purpose of this control is to manage and control remote access to the system to prevent unauthorized access, data breaches, and other security incidents. It is crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the system and its data.
description: This control requires organizations to document, manage, and control all types of remote access to the system. It includes requirements for authorizing, monitoring, and controlling remote access, as well as for protecting the confidentiality and integrity of the data transmitted during remote access sessions.
implementation_guidance: Identify all types of remote access:** Start by identifying all the ways in which remote access to the system can be gained, such as through VPNs, remote desktop connections, or web-based interfaces
Establish remote access policies and procedures:** Develop and document policies and procedures for authorizing, managing, and controlling remote access to the system

Implement remote access controls:** Implement technical controls to enforce your remote access policies. This may include using secure protocols for remote access, requiring multi-factor authentication, and limiting remote access to authorized users
Monitor remote access:** Regularly monitor remote access sessions to detect and respond to any unauthorized or suspicious activity
Train users:** Provide training to all users with remote access privileges on the appropriate use of remote access and the security risks associated with it
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all types of remote access, established and implemented remote access policies and controls, and is actively monitoring remote access. They will also check that users have been trained on the use of remote access.

title: Wireless Access
purpose: The purpose of this control is to limit and control the access to and from wireless networks, in order to protect the organization's information systems from unauthorized access and potential harm. This is important for security and compliance as wireless networks can be more vulnerable to attacks.
description: This control requires organizations to establish usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for wireless access. It also mandates the authorization of wireless access prior to allowing such connections.
implementation_guidance: Establish Usage Restrictions:** Define and document the restrictions for using wireless access. This could include limiting the types of activities allowed over wireless connections or specifying approved locations for wireless access

Define Configuration/Connection Requirements:** Set requirements for connecting to the wireless network. This could include using specific types of encryption, implementing strong authentication methods, or requiring certain security settings on devices that will connect to the network

Develop Implementation Guidance:** Create guidance for implementing the wireless access policy. This should include steps for configuring devices to meet the connection requirements, as well as procedures for obtaining authorization for wireless access

Authorize Wireless Access:** Establish a process for authorizing wireless access. This should include verifying that the device and user meet the established requirements and restrictions before granting access
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has established usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for wireless access. They will also verify that wireless access is only granted after proper authorization.

title: Access Control for Mobile Devices
purpose: The purpose of this control is to establish and enforce access control policies for mobile devices to prevent unauthorized access to the organization's information systems. This is crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the system and its data.
description: AC-19 requires organizations to establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for mobile devices. It also mandates the authorization of the use of mobile devices and the monitoring of their usage.
implementation_guidance: Develop and document a policy that outlines the acceptable use of mobile devices within the organization
Define configuration requirements for mobile devices that align with the organization's security policies
Establish connection requirements that dictate how mobile devices connect to the organization's network
Implement a process for authorizing the use of mobile devices within the organization
Monitor and control the use of mobile devices to ensure compliance with the organization's policies
Regularly review and update the mobile device policy and its associated controls to address changes in technology and threats
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has a documented policy for mobile device usage, that configuration and connection requirements are defined and enforced, and that the use of mobile devices is authorized and monitored.

title: Use of External Systems
purpose: The purpose of this control is to regulate the interaction between the organization's information system and external systems. This is crucial to prevent unauthorized access, protect the integrity of data, and maintain the confidentiality of information.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and implement measures that restrict and monitor the use of external systems. It ensures that the organization's information system remains secure when accessing, processing, storing, or transmitting information using external systems.
implementation_guidance: Policy Development:** Develop and document policies that define acceptable use of external systems. The policy should clearly state the conditions under which information can be processed, stored, or transmitted on external systems
Access Control:** Implement controls to restrict and monitor the use of external systems. This could include technical measures like firewalls, VPNs, and intrusion detection systems

User Training:** Train all users on the acceptable use of external systems. This should include awareness of the risks associated with the use of external systems and the consequences of non-compliance
Monitoring and Review:** Regularly monitor and review the use of external systems to ensure compliance with the policy. Any deviations from the policy should be promptly addressed
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a policy in place that defines the acceptable use of external systems. They will also look for evidence that the policy is being implemented effectively, such as technical controls and user training.

title: Information Sharing
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization facilitates information sharing by enabling authorized users to access information as necessary, while also protecting the information from unauthorized access. This balance is crucial for maintaining operational efficiency and security.
description: This control requires the organization to implement mechanisms that facilitate information sharing and collaboration among authorized users. These mechanisms must also prevent unauthorized users from accessing or altering the information.
implementation_guidance: Identify the types of information that need to be shared and the authorized users who need access to this information
Determine the appropriate levels of access for each user or user group based on their roles and responsibilities
Implement mechanisms that facilitate information sharing among authorized users. This could include shared drives, collaboration platforms, or secure messaging systems
Implement mechanisms that prevent unauthorized access to the shared information. This could include access controls, encryption, or user authentication methods
Regularly review and update the list of authorized users and their access levels to ensure that they still require access to the shared information
Train users on the proper use of the information sharing mechanisms and the importance of protecting the shared information
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented mechanisms for information sharing and that these mechanisms prevent unauthorized access. They will also look for evidence that the organization regularly reviews and updates the list of authorized users and their access levels.

title: Publicly Accessible Content
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized individuals from accessing, modifying, or disseminating sensitive information that is publicly accessible. It helps to ensure that the information system protects the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of publicly accessible information.
description: This control requires the organization to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain nonpublic information. The organization must review and approve the information before it is made publicly accessible, and must protect the information from unauthorized access or modification.
implementation_guidance: Identify all information that is intended to be made publicly accessible
Establish a review and approval process for all publicly accessible content. This process should involve checking the content for any nonpublic information
Implement mechanisms to protect publicly accessible information from unauthorized access or modification. This could involve using access controls, encryption, or other security measures
Regularly review and update the publicly accessible content and the security measures protecting it
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all publicly accessible information, established a review and approval process for this information, and implemented security measures to protect the information. They will also check that the organization regularly reviews and updates the information and the security measures.

title: Data Mining Protection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized and unintended information gathering through data mining processes. It is important for security and compliance because it helps protect sensitive information from being exploited by unauthorized individuals or entities.
description: This control requires organizations to implement measures that protect against unauthorized data mining activities. It involves the use of software, hardware, or procedural methods to protect data from unauthorized or unintended extraction.
implementation_guidance: Identify and classify data that could be targeted for data mining
Develop and implement policies and procedures to protect identified data from unauthorized data mining activities
Implement data mining protection measures such as data anonymization, encryption, and access controls
Regularly review and update data mining protection measures to ensure their effectiveness
Train staff on the risks of data mining and the policies and procedures in place to prevent it
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified potential data mining targets, implemented appropriate protection measures, and regularly reviews and updates these measures. They will also look for evidence of staff training on data mining risks and prevention.

title: Access Control Decisions
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that access control decisions for information systems are enforced in accordance with applicable access control policies. This is crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of system resources and data.
description: This control requires that the information system enforces access control policies (i.e., rules that determine who can access the system and what they can do) and associated access controls. It also requires the system to make access control decisions based on a variety of factors, including the identity of the user or device, the context of the request, and the information being accessed.
implementation_guidance: Define and document the access control policy for the information system. This policy should specify who can access the system, what they can do, and under what conditions
Implement mechanisms in the information system that enforce the access control policy. This could include user authentication, role-based access control, and context-aware access control
Regularly review and update the access control policy and enforcement mechanisms to ensure they remain effective and relevant
Train staff on the access control policy and procedures, and ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in enforcing access control
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the information system enforces the access control policy and associated access controls. They will also look for evidence that access control decisions are made based on the identity of the user or device, the context of the request, and the information being accessed.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. For example, assessors might examine system configurations and access logs, interview system administrators and users, and conduct tests to verify that access control decisions are being enforced as intended.

title: Reference Monitor
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that access to system resources is mediated by a reference monitor that enforces the organization's security policy. This is important for security and compliance as it ensures that all access to system resources is controlled and monitored, preventing unauthorized access and potential data breaches.
description: This control requires the organization to implement a reference monitor for mediating access to system resources. The reference monitor must be provably secure and tamperproof, and must enforce the most restrictive set of rights or privileges for each user's interaction with system resources.
implementation_guidance: Identify the system resources that require access control
Define the security policy that the reference monitor will enforce, including the rights and privileges for each user's interaction with system resources
Select a reference monitor that is provably secure and tamperproof. This could be a software or hardware component, or a combination of both
Implement the reference monitor and configure it to enforce the defined security policy
Test the reference monitor to ensure it is functioning correctly and is effectively mediating access to system resources
Regularly review and update the security policy and the configuration of the reference monitor as needed
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a reference monitor has been implemented and is effectively mediating access to system resources. They will also look for documentation of the security policy that the reference monitor is enforcing, and evidence that this policy is being regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance will be verified through a combination of examine, interview, and test methods. Assessors will examine the configuration of the reference monitor and the documentation of the security policy. They will interview personnel responsible for implementing and maintaining the reference monitor. They will also test the reference monitor to verify that it is effectively mediating access to system resources and enforcing the security policy.

title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish and maintain policies and procedures for security awareness and training. This is critical for ensuring that all users understand their roles and responsibilities in maintaining system security, and are adequately trained to perform their duties securely.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, document, and disseminate to all personnel: (i) a security awareness and training policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance; and (ii) procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security awareness and training policy and associated security awareness and training controls.
implementation_guidance: Develop a security awareness and training policy. This policy should clearly define the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance requirements

Develop procedures to implement the security awareness and training policy. These procedures should outline the steps necessary to ensure that all personnel receive appropriate security awareness and training
Disseminate the policy and procedures to all personnel. This could be done through email, internal websites, or other communication channels
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures to ensure they remain relevant and effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a documented security awareness and training policy and procedures, and that these have been disseminated to all personnel. They will also look for evidence that the policy and procedures are regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Literacy Training and Awareness
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that all organizational users are aware of the security risks associated with their activities and the applicable policies, standards, and procedures related to the security of the organization's systems.
description: This control requires organizations to provide ongoing awareness and training to all users to ensure they understand the security risks associated with their activities and the security policies, standards, and procedures in place.
implementation_guidance: Identify the necessary security awareness topics that are relevant to the organization. This could include password management, phishing awareness, and secure data handling
Develop or procure a security awareness and training program that covers the identified topics
Implement the program across the organization, ensuring all users receive the training
Regularly update and refresh the training program to ensure it remains relevant and up-to-date
Monitor and record user completion of the training to ensure all users are trained and aware
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has an ongoing security awareness and training program in place, that all users have received the training, and that the training is regularly updated.

title: Role-based Training
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that individuals are provided with security awareness training that is tailored to their specific roles and responsibilities within the organization. This helps to ensure that all personnel are equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to perform their duties in a secure manner.
description: This control requires organizations to provide role-based security-related training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities. The training should be tailored to the individual's role and responsibilities within the organization and should be updated as necessary.
implementation_guidance: Identify all personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities within the organization
Develop a role-based training program that covers all relevant security topics for each identified role
Deliver the training to the identified personnel. This could be through in-person sessions, online modules, or other appropriate methods

Regularly review and update the training program to ensure it remains relevant and effective. This should be done at least annually, or whenever significant changes occur within the organization or its security environment
Document all training activities, including who was trained, when the training occurred, and what topics were covered
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that role-based security training is being provided to all relevant personnel, that the training is appropriate for each role, and that the training program is regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods. The "examine" method could involve reviewing training records and materials to ensure they cover all necessary topics and are being kept up to date. The "interview" method could involve speaking with personnel to confirm they have received the training and understand their security responsibilities. The "test" method could involve observing personnel performing their duties to ensure they are applying the knowledge gained from the training.

title: Training Records
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization maintains records of security awareness and training activities. This is important for security and compliance as it provides evidence that the organization is actively working to educate its personnel on security risks and procedures, which is a key factor in preventing security incidents.
description: This control requires the organization to document and monitor individual participation in security training and awareness programs. The records should include the type of training, the date of training, and the individuals who received the training.
implementation_guidance: Develop a system or process for tracking and documenting security training and awareness activities. This could be a simple spreadsheet or a more complex Learning Management System (LMS)

Ensure that all security training and awareness activities are recorded in this system. The records should include the type of training, the date of training, and the individuals who received the training
Regularly review and update these records to ensure they are accurate and up-to-date
Establish a process for verifying the accuracy of these records, such as periodic audits or spot checks
Ensure that these records are securely stored and protected from unauthorized access or alteration
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization is maintaining accurate and up-to-date records of security training and awareness activities. They will also look for evidence that these records are being regularly reviewed and verified for accuracy.

title: Contacts with Security Groups and Associations
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization maintains contact with relevant security groups and associations to stay updated on the latest security-related information, trends, and advisories. This helps in enhancing the organization's security posture and in making informed decisions regarding security controls and risk management.
description: This control requires the organization to establish and maintain contact with security groups and associations, both internal and external, to stay informed about the latest security threats, vulnerabilities, and mitigation strategies.
implementation_guidance: Identify relevant security groups and associations: These could be industry-specific security forums, local or national cybersecurity organizations, or internal security groups within the organization
Establish contact: Reach out to these groups and associations and establish a line of communication. This could involve subscribing to newsletters, joining forums, or attending meetings
Maintain contact: Regularly interact with these groups and associations. Attend meetings, participate in discussions, and stay updated on the latest security information

Disseminate information: Share relevant security information obtained from these groups with the appropriate personnel within the organization. This could involve sending out regular updates, conducting training sessions, or updating security policies and procedures
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has established and is maintaining contact with relevant security groups and associations. They will also look for evidence that the organization is using the information obtained from these groups to enhance its security posture.

title: Training Feedback
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization is continually improving its security awareness and training program. It helps to identify areas of weakness, gaps in knowledge, or ineffective training methods, and provides a mechanism for making necessary improvements.
description: This control requires the organization to obtain feedback on its security awareness and training program from organizational personnel. The feedback should be analyzed and used to make necessary adjustments to the training program.
implementation_guidance: Develop a Feedback Mechanism:** Create a system or process for collecting feedback from employees who participate in the security awareness and training program. This could be a survey, a feedback form, or an open forum for discussion
Communicate the Feedback Mechanism:** Make sure all employees are aware of how and when to provide feedback on the training program
Collect and Analyze Feedback:** Regularly collect feedback and analyze it to identify trends, common issues, or areas of concern

Implement Changes Based on Feedback:** Use the feedback to make necessary changes to the training program. This could involve updating content, changing the format or delivery method, or addressing specific areas of concern
Monitor and Review:** Continually monitor the effectiveness of the changes and review the feedback mechanism to ensure it is still fit for purpose
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a process in place for collecting feedback on its security awareness and training program, that it regularly analyzes this feedback, and that it uses the feedback to make improvements to the program.

title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization has established and documented audit and accountability policies and procedures. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to detect, prevent, and mitigate potential security incidents by tracking and analyzing system activities.
description: This control requires the organization to develop, disseminate, and periodically review/update formal, documented procedures that facilitate the implementation of the audit and accountability policy and associated audit and accountability controls.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive audit and accountability policy that outlines the organization's approach to auditing system activities and holding individuals accountable for their actions
Develop procedures that facilitate the implementation of the audit and accountability policy. These procedures should detail how audit logs are created, protected, retained, and reviewed
Disseminate the policy and procedures to all relevant personnel and stakeholders. This can be done through training sessions, email communications, or posting on the organization's intranet

Regularly review and update the policy and procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant. This should be done at least annually or whenever significant changes occur in the organization or its systems
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a formal, documented audit and accountability policy and procedures. They will also check that these documents have been disseminated to relevant personnel and are reviewed and updated regularly.

title: Event Logging
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization is able to track and document user activities that have an impact on the security of the system. This is important for security and compliance as it allows for the detection of unauthorized access or activities, supports incident response, and aids in accountability.
description: This control requires the organization to implement event logging mechanisms that record user activities, exceptions, faults, and information security events. The logs must be protected from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
implementation_guidance: Identify and define the events that need to be logged. These should include user activities, exceptions, faults, and information security events
Implement logging mechanisms that can capture and record the defined events. This could be system logs, application logs, or security logs
Ensure that the logs are timestamped and include sufficient information such as user IDs, event types, and source IP addresses
Protect the logs from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion. This could be achieved through access controls, encryption, and regular backups
Regularly review and analyze the logs for any unusual or suspicious activities
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented event logging mechanisms, defined the events to be logged, and is protecting the logs from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion. They will also look for evidence of regular log review and analysis.

title: Alternate Audit Logging Capability
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization has a backup or alternate audit logging capability in place in case the primary system fails. This is crucial for maintaining continuous monitoring and accountability of system activities, even during system outages or failures.
description: This control requires the organization to provide an alternate audit record generation capability when the primary audit capability is unavailable. The alternate capability should be able to record, at a minimum, the same information as the primary capability.
implementation_guidance: Identify the critical information that the primary audit logging system records
Determine an alternate system or method that can capture the same information when the primary system is unavailable
Implement the alternate system and ensure it is properly configured to capture the required information
Test the alternate system to ensure it activates and functions correctly when the primary system is unavailable
Document the alternate audit logging capability in the System Security Plan
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that an alternate audit logging capability is in place and that it can capture the same information as the primary system. They will also check that the alternate system activates correctly when the primary system is unavailable.

title: Content of Audit Records
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that audit records contain sufficient information to establish what events occurred, the sources of the events, and the outcomes of the events. This is important for security and compliance as it helps in detecting and investigating potential security incidents, identifying patterns and trends, and holding individuals accountable for their actions.
description: This control requires organizations to determine the information to be included in audit records, which should be enough to establish the who, what, when, where, and how of the events being logged.
implementation_guidance: Identify the necessary information to be included in the audit records. This should be based on the organization's risk assessment and the system's security requirements
Develop and implement procedures to generate audit records that include the identified information
Regularly review and update the information to be included in the audit records to ensure it remains relevant and adequate
Train relevant personnel on the procedures for generating and maintaining audit records
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified the necessary information to be included in audit records, developed and implemented procedures for generating such records, and trained personnel on these procedures. They will also check that the audit records contain the required information and that the organization regularly reviews and updates this information.

title: Audit Log Storage Capacity
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization has sufficient storage capacity to retain audit logs, which are crucial for detecting, investigating, and responding to security incidents. Without adequate storage, important audit records could be lost, hampering incident response and forensic efforts.
description: This control requires the organization to allocate sufficient audit log storage capacity and configure auditing systems to avoid loss of logging data.
implementation_guidance: Identify Audit Requirements:** Determine the types of data and events that need to be audited based on your organization's risk assessment and regulatory requirements
Estimate Storage Needs:** Based on the identified audit requirements, estimate the volume of audit data that will be generated and the period for which it needs to be retained
Allocate Storage:** Allocate sufficient storage capacity to store the audit logs for the required retention period

Configure Auditing Systems:** Configure your auditing systems to use the allocated storage and to manage the storage effectively. This could include setting up alerts for when storage is nearing capacity and implementing a process for archiving or deleting old logs in a secure manner
Monitor and Adjust:** Regularly monitor your audit log storage usage and adjust the allocated storage as needed
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has allocated sufficient storage for audit logs, that the auditing systems are configured to use this storage, and that there are processes in place to manage the storage effectively.

title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization has a defined and implemented process to handle audit logging failures. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to prevent loss of audit data and ensures continuous monitoring and accountability.
description: This control requires the organization to alert designated organizational officials in the event of an audit logging process failure and take necessary actions to address the failure.
implementation_guidance: Identify Key Personnel:** Determine who in the organization will be responsible for receiving alerts about audit logging process failures

Define Response Procedures:** Establish procedures for responding to audit logging process failures. This should include steps to identify the cause of the failure, correct the issue, and restore the audit logging process

Implement Alert Mechanisms:** Set up mechanisms to alert the identified personnel in the event of an audit logging process failure. This could be through email notifications, SMS alerts, or other suitable methods
Test the Process:** Regularly test the response procedures to ensure they are effective and that alerts are being properly sent and received
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a defined process for responding to audit logging process failures, that designated personnel are alerted in the event of a failure, and that appropriate actions are taken to address the failure.

title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations regularly review and analyze information system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity, and report findings to designated officials. This is crucial for identifying potential security incidents, policy violations, or fraudulent activity, and for ensuring accountability within the system.
description: This control requires organizations to review and analyze the audit records of their information systems on an ongoing basis. The findings from these reviews should be reported to the designated officials. The frequency of reviews should be defined by the organization based on their risk assessment.
implementation_guidance: Define the frequency of audit record reviews based on the risk assessment of the organization
Establish a process for reviewing and analyzing audit records. This could involve automated tools or manual procedures
Identify the designated officials who will receive the reports of the audit record reviews
Train the personnel responsible for reviewing and analyzing the audit records
Implement the process and conduct the audit record reviews as per the defined frequency
Document and report the findings from the audit record reviews to the designated officials
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has a process in place for reviewing and analyzing audit records, and that this process is being followed. They will also check that the findings from these reviews are being reported to the designated officials.

title: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization has the capability to process and analyze audit records to support incident response, investigations, and reporting. It helps in identifying, investigating, and responding to security incidents, and in maintaining accountability.
description: This control requires the organization to provide a system that can process audit records into a format suitable for analysis, and generate reports to support on-demand analysis and reporting.
implementation_guidance: Identify the audit records that need to be processed and analyzed. This could include records related to system access, changes to system configuration, or user activities

Implement a system or tool that can process these audit records into a format that is suitable for analysis. This could involve aggregating records, filtering records, or converting records into a different format
Ensure that the system or tool can generate reports based on the processed audit records. These reports should support on-demand analysis and reporting
Regularly test the system or tool to ensure it is functioning as expected. This could involve generating sample reports and verifying that they contain the expected information
Document the system or tool, including how it processes audit records and generates reports. This documentation should be included in the System Security Plan (SSP)
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a system or tool in place that can process audit records and generate reports. They will also look for evidence that this system or tool is regularly tested and documented.

title: Time Stamps
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that all audit records can be accurately correlated and analyzed by providing a reliable time source. This is crucial for security and compliance as it allows for accurate tracking and reconstruction of events, detection of incidents, and identification of patterns or trends.
description: This control requires that the information system generates a time stamp for audit records. The time stamp must include both the date and time, and should be generated using a system clock that has been synchronized with an authoritative time source.
implementation_guidance: Identify and define the authoritative time source for your organization. This could be a local server or an external time service
Configure all system clocks to synchronize with the identified authoritative time source
Ensure that the information system is configured to generate time stamps for all audit records. The time stamps should include both the date and time
Regularly review and verify the accuracy of system clocks and time stamps in audit records
Document the procedures and configurations in your System Security Plan (SSP)
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the information system generates time stamps for audit records, and that these time stamps are generated using a system clock synchronized with an authoritative time source. They will also check that the time stamps include both the date and time.

title: Protection of Audit Information
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure the integrity of audit information and audit tools. It is crucial for security and compliance because it prevents unauthorized access, modification, and deletion of audit information, thereby ensuring the reliability and accuracy of audit records.
description: This control requires organizations to protect audit information and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion. It also requires organizations to ensure that only authorized individuals have access to audit tools.
implementation_guidance: Identify all audit information and audit tools within the organization
Implement access controls to restrict unauthorized access to audit information and tools. This could include password protection, encryption, and physical security measures
Regularly review and update access controls to ensure they are still effective and relevant
Implement measures to protect audit information and tools from modification and deletion. This could include backup and recovery procedures, version control, and checksum validation
Train staff on the importance of protecting audit information and tools, and their role in maintaining security
Regularly audit the security of audit information and tools, and take corrective action if any vulnerabilities are identified
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that audit information and tools are protected from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion. They will also look for evidence that access controls are regularly reviewed and updated, and that staff are trained in the importance of protecting audit information and tools.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. For example, assessors might examine access control policies and procedures, interview staff to determine their understanding of the importance of protecting audit information and tools, and test access controls to ensure they are effective.

title: Non-repudiation
purpose: The purpose of this control is to provide assurance that a party involved in a given process or communication cannot deny the authenticity of their signature or the sending of a message that they originated. This is crucial for maintaining accountability and integrity in system operations.
description: This control requires the system to protect against an individual falsely denying they performed a particular action. This is achieved by providing proof of origin or delivery to protect against repudiation.
implementation_guidance: Identify system processes and communications that require non-repudiation
Implement mechanisms that provide proof of origin or delivery for these identified processes and communications. This could include digital signatures, timestamps, and logging of actions
Ensure that these mechanisms are consistently applied and cannot be bypassed or deactivated by system users
Regularly review and update these mechanisms as necessary to maintain their effectiveness
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that non-repudiation mechanisms are in place and are consistently applied. They will also evaluate whether these mechanisms are effective in providing proof of origin or delivery.

title: Audit Record Retention
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that audit records are retained for an adequate period to support after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.
description: This control requires organizations to retain audit records for a defined period to allow for the adequate investigation of future security incidents and to comply with all relevant regulatory and organizational retention requirements.
implementation_guidance: Define Retention Period:** The organization should first define the period for which audit records need to be retained. This period should be long enough to support the investigation of future security incidents and meet all regulatory and organizational retention requirements

Establish Retention Procedures:** The organization should establish procedures for retaining audit records. These procedures should detail how audit records are stored, protected, and disposed of after the retention period

Implement Retention Procedures:** The organization should implement the established retention procedures. This includes storing audit records in a secure and protected manner and disposing of them appropriately after the retention period
Monitor Compliance:** The organization should regularly monitor compliance with the retention procedures to ensure audit records are being retained as required
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has defined a retention period for audit records, established and implemented retention procedures, and is monitoring compliance with these procedures.

title: Audit Record Generation
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the system is capable of creating adequate audit records for events that have been identified as significant and relevant to the security of the system. This is important for security and compliance as it allows for the detection, investigation, and reporting of security incidents.
description: This control requires the system to generate audit records containing sufficient information to establish what events occurred, the sources of the events, and the outcomes of the events.
implementation_guidance: Identify the significant and relevant events that need to be audited within the system. This could include system start-up and shut-down, system access and authentication, and system configuration changes

Determine the necessary information that needs to be included in the audit records for these events. This should include information to establish what events occurred, the sources of the events, and the outcomes of the events
Configure the system to automatically generate audit records for these events with the necessary information
Regularly review and update the list of events that need to be audited and the information included in the audit records
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the system is configured to generate audit records for significant and relevant events. They will also look for evidence that these audit records contain sufficient information to establish what events occurred, the sources of the events, and the outcomes of the events.
assessment_methods: Compliance with this control can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. This could include examining system configurations and audit records, interviewing personnel responsible for configuring the system and reviewing audit records, and testing the system to ensure it generates audit records as expected.

title: Monitoring for Information Disclosure
purpose: The purpose of this control is to detect and respond to unauthorized disclosure of information. It is crucial for security and compliance as it helps to prevent data breaches and protect sensitive information from being exposed to unauthorized individuals or systems.
description: This control requires the organization to monitor information systems for indications of unauthorized disclosure of information. It involves the use of automated mechanisms to alert security personnel in case of potential unauthorized information disclosure.
implementation_guidance: Identify the types of information that are considered sensitive and should not be disclosed without proper authorization
Implement monitoring tools that can detect and alert about potential unauthorized information disclosure. These tools should be capable of monitoring both network traffic and system activities
Define the criteria that will trigger an alert. This could be certain keywords, data patterns, or activities that indicate potential unauthorized disclosure
Establish a process for responding to alerts. This should include investigating the potential breach, containing it, and reporting it to the appropriate parties
Regularly review and update the monitoring criteria and response process to ensure they remain effective against evolving threats
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented mechanisms to monitor for unauthorized information disclosure, and that these mechanisms are capable of alerting security personnel. They will also check that there is a defined process for responding to these alerts.

title: Session Audit
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization is able to capture, record, and monitor the actions of users during a session. This is important for security and compliance as it allows for the detection and investigation of unauthorized activities or security incidents.
description: This control requires the organization to audit user sessions for suspicious activity. It involves capturing and storing information about the user's activities during a session, such as the commands issued by the user, the files accessed, and the operations performed.
implementation_guidance: Define the scope of the session audit, including the systems and users to be audited
Determine the types of user activities that will be audited, such as login and logout events, file access, and command execution
Implement a session audit tool or feature that can capture and record the defined user activities
Configure the session audit tool to automatically start auditing when a user session begins and stop when it ends
Store the audit records in a secure and tamper-proof location
Regularly review and analyze the audit records for signs of suspicious or unauthorized activity
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization is auditing user sessions, that the audit records capture the required information, and that the records are securely stored and regularly reviewed.

title: Cross-organizational Audit Logging
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that audit information from multiple organizations is consolidated into a centralized system. This is important for security and compliance as it allows for a comprehensive view of system activity across organizations, aiding in the detection, investigation, and reporting of potential security incidents.
description: This control requires organizations to provide a central repository for audit logs from multiple organizations. It also requires organizations to correlate and analyze audit log data from different sources to identify potential security incidents.
implementation_guidance: Identify all organizations that will be contributing audit log data
Establish a centralized system or repository for collecting and storing audit log data from all contributing organizations
Define the format and frequency of audit log data submissions from each organization
Implement procedures for correlating and analyzing audit log data from different sources
Regularly review and update the centralized system to ensure it continues to meet the needs of the organization
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a centralized system for audit log data exists, that it receives data from all identified organizations, and that procedures are in place for correlating and analyzing this data. They will also look for evidence that the system is regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization has established and adequately documented the policies and procedures for assessment, authorization, and monitoring. This is important for security and compliance as it sets the foundation for the organization's security posture and provides a clear roadmap for maintaining and improving security controls.
description: This control requires the organization to develop, document, and disseminate policies and procedures that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance for assessment, authorization, and monitoring.
implementation_guidance: Develop a policy that outlines the organization's commitment to assessment, authorization, and monitoring. This policy should include the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and how the organization will ensure compliance
Develop procedures that detail how the policy will be implemented. This should include step-by-step processes for conducting assessments, authorizing systems, and monitoring security controls
Disseminate the policy and procedures to all relevant parties within the organization. This could be done through email, internal websites, or staff meetings
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures to ensure they remain relevant and effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a documented policy and procedures for assessment, authorization, and monitoring. They will also evaluate whether these documents are disseminated to relevant parties and are regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through the examine method by reviewing the policy and procedures documents. The interview method can be used to confirm that relevant parties are aware of these documents and understand their roles and responsibilities. The test method can be used to verify that the procedures are being followed in practice.

title: Control Assessments
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's security controls are effective and operating as intended. This is crucial for maintaining the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of the system and its data, and for ensuring ongoing compliance with security requirements.
description: This control requires the organization to assess the security controls in its information systems and environments of operation at least annually, or whenever significant changes occur. The assessments should be based on pre-established assessment procedures and include a determination of the effectiveness of the controls.
implementation_guidance: Develop and document a control assessment plan that includes the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and methodology for the assessment
Identify the security controls to be assessed and the assessment methods to be used
