assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a formal, documented incident response policy and procedures. They will also check whether these documents have been disseminated to relevant personnel and whether they are reviewed and updated regularly.

title: Incident Response Training
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization provides adequate training to its personnel to handle and respond to information system incidents effectively. This is crucial to minimize the impact of security incidents on the organization's operations and assets.
description: This control requires the organization to provide incident response training to its personnel at least annually. The training should cover organizational procedures for responding to incidents and should be updated to reflect changes in the threat landscape, technology, and organizational processes.
implementation_guidance: Identify the personnel who will be involved in incident response. This typically includes IT staff, security personnel, and other relevant stakeholders

Develop a comprehensive incident response training program. This should cover the organization's incident response procedures, roles and responsibilities, and tools and techniques for incident detection, analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery
Deliver the training to the identified personnel. This could be through in-person sessions, online courses, or a combination of both
Update the training program at least annually or whenever there are significant changes in the threat landscape, technology, or organizational processes
Document the training program and maintain records of personnel who have completed the training
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a comprehensive incident response training program in place and that the identified personnel have completed the training. They will also check if the training program is updated regularly to reflect changes in the threat landscape, technology, and organizational processes.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through the following methods:

title: Incident Response Testing
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization's incident response capability is effective and can be executed as planned during a security incident. It is crucial for security and compliance as it helps to minimize the impact of an incident on the organization's operations and security posture.
description: This control requires organizations to test their incident response capability periodically. The testing should include a diverse range of scenarios that the organization might encounter, including insider threats, malware, and denial of service attacks.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive incident response plan that includes procedures for detecting, responding to, and recovering from security incidents
Identify a diverse range of potential security incidents that the organization could face
Develop and document test scenarios based on these potential incidents
Conduct the tests periodically, involving all relevant personnel
Document the results of each test, including any issues identified and actions taken to address them
Review and update the incident response plan based on the results of the tests
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a documented incident response plan, that it has conducted tests of the plan, and that it has taken action to address any issues identified during the tests.

title: Incident Handling
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization has a systematic, repeatable, and measured response to any security incidents that may occur. This is crucial for minimizing the potential damage of an incident, recovering operations, and preventing future incidents.
description: This control requires organizations to implement an incident handling capability that includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery. It also requires organizations to track, document, and report incidents to appropriate officials.
implementation_guidance: Preparation:** Develop an incident response policy and plan. Train personnel and acquire necessary tools and resources

Detection and Analysis:** Establish mechanisms for incident detection and analysis. This can include intrusion detection systems, log analysis, or security information and event management (SIEM) systems

Containment, Eradication, and Recovery:** Develop strategies for containing an incident, eradicating the threat, and recovering systems and data. This could involve isolating affected systems, removing malware, and restoring systems to a known good state

Post-Incident Activity:** Conduct a post-incident review to learn from the incident and improve future response efforts. Document all activities related to the incident and report to appropriate officials
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a formal incident response plan, that the plan is regularly tested and updated, and that all incidents are properly documented and reported. They will also look for evidence of post-incident reviews and continuous improvement efforts.

title: Incident Monitoring
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a systematic process in place to track, document, and report incidents. This is crucial for security and compliance as it aids in understanding the nature of security incidents, their frequency, and their impact, which in turn helps in improving the organization's incident response capabilities.
description: This control requires organizations to monitor and track information system security incidents on an ongoing basis. It also requires organizations to document and report the incidents, their status, and other related information.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive incident monitoring policy that outlines the procedures for tracking, documenting, and reporting security incidents

Implement an incident tracking system that can effectively monitor and document security incidents. This could be a security information and event management (SIEM) system or a dedicated incident management system
Train staff on how to use the incident tracking system and how to report incidents
Regularly review and update the incident monitoring policy and the incident tracking system to ensure they remain effective and up-to-date
Document all incidents, their status, and other related information for future reference and for improving the incident response process
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a comprehensive incident monitoring policy in place, that an effective incident tracking system is being used, and that incidents are being properly documented and reported. They will also look for evidence that the incident monitoring process is being regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods. The "Examine" method can be used to review the incident monitoring policy and the documentation of incidents. The "Interview" method can be used to question staff about the incident monitoring process and their understanding of it. The "Test" method can be used to evaluate the effectiveness of the incident tracking system and the accuracy of the incident documentation.

title: Incident Reporting
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a formal process in place for reporting information security incidents in a timely manner. This is crucial for minimizing damage, preserving evidence, and enabling effective response and recovery.
description: This control requires organizations to implement a process that facilitates the reporting of information security incidents. The process should enable personnel to report different types of incidents in a timely manner and should include reporting to appropriate authorities.
implementation_guidance: Develop a formal incident reporting policy and procedure. This should define what constitutes an incident, who should report, when, and how

Ensure that the reporting process is easy to understand and use. It should cover various types of incidents, including but not limited to, unauthorized access, data breaches, malware infections, and denial of service attacks
Train all personnel on the incident reporting process. This should include awareness of the types of incidents, how to report them, and the importance of timely reporting
Establish a dedicated team or point of contact for receiving and managing incident reports
Regularly review and update the incident reporting process to ensure its effectiveness
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for a formal, documented incident reporting process. They will also check if all personnel are aware of the process and if there is a dedicated team or point of contact for managing incident reports. Evidence of regular reviews and updates to the process will also be sought.

title: Incident Response Assistance
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization provides appropriate assistance to users regarding incident response. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to ensure that incidents are handled promptly and effectively, minimizing potential damage and downtime.
description: This control requires the organization to provide incident response support and advice to users, helping them to respond effectively to information system incidents. The organization should also assist users in handling and reporting incidents in accordance with established incident response procedures.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive incident response plan that includes procedures for providing assistance to users
Establish a dedicated incident response team or designate specific individuals to provide incident response assistance
Train the incident response team or designated individuals in incident response procedures and in providing assistance to users
Communicate the availability of incident response assistance to all users
Regularly review and update the incident response plan and procedures to ensure they remain effective and up-to-date
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a comprehensive incident response plan in place, that a dedicated team or individuals are assigned to provide incident response assistance, and that users are aware of the availability of this assistance. They will also check that the incident response plan and procedures are regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods. The "examine" method can be used to review the incident response plan and procedures, and to check records of incident response training. The "interview" method can be used to confirm that users are aware of the availability of incident response assistance. The "test" method can be used to evaluate the effectiveness of the incident response team or designated individuals in providing assistance.

title: Incident Response Plan
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization has a structured and organized approach to address and manage the aftermath of a security breach or attack (incident). The plan is crucial to prevent any further damage, recover operations, and reduce recovery time and costs.
description: This control requires the organization to develop and implement an incident response plan that includes a mission, strategies, objectives, and a program plan. The plan should be reviewed and updated regularly to address evolving threats and changes in the organization.
implementation_guidance: Develop an incident response policy that defines the organization's approach to incident response
Establish an incident response team with clear roles and responsibilities
Define the incident response process, including identification, containment, eradication, recovery, and lessons learned
Develop procedures for communication during and after an incident, including internal communication and external communication with stakeholders, law enforcement, and media
Train all relevant personnel on the incident response plan and procedures
Test the incident response plan regularly to ensure its effectiveness and make necessary adjustments
Review and update the incident response plan at least annually or whenever there are significant changes in the organization, the IT environment, or the threat landscape
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that an incident response plan exists, is regularly reviewed and updated, and is communicated to all relevant personnel. They will also check that the plan includes a clear process for responding to incidents and that this process is followed in practice.

title: Information Spillage Response
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a structured and effective response to incidents where classified, sensitive, or proprietary information is transmitted, processed, or stored on an information system not authorized for such information (information spillage). This is crucial for maintaining the confidentiality and integrity of sensitive information and for preventing unauthorized access.
description: This control requires organizations to establish procedures for responding to information spillage incidents. These procedures should include training personnel, reporting the spillage, sanitizing the system, and conducting a post-incident review.
implementation_guidance: Develop and document procedures for responding to information spillage incidents. These procedures should include steps for identifying and reporting the spillage, sanitizing the affected system, and conducting a post-incident review
Train personnel on the procedures. Ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in the event of an information spillage incident

Implement the procedures in the event of an information spillage incident. This includes reporting the incident to appropriate authorities, sanitizing the affected system, and conducting a post-incident review to identify lessons learned and improvements to be made
Regularly review and update the procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for documented procedures for responding to information spillage incidents. They will also look for evidence that personnel have been trained on these procedures and that the procedures have been implemented in the event of an information spillage incident.

title: Integrated Information Security Analysis Team
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization has a dedicated team in place to analyze and respond to information security incidents in a coordinated and effective manner. This is crucial for minimizing the impact of security incidents and ensuring a swift recovery.
description: This control requires the organization to establish and maintain an integrated information security analysis team that coordinates, communicates, and collaborates with organizational elements to respond to information security incidents effectively.
implementation_guidance: Establish a Team:** Form an integrated information security analysis team. This team should consist of individuals with diverse skills, including IT, cybersecurity, legal, public relations, and human resources
Define Roles and Responsibilities:** Clearly define the roles and responsibilities of each team member. This should include incident detection, analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery

Develop Procedures:** Develop and document procedures for the team to follow when responding to information security incidents. This should include procedures for communication and collaboration among team members and with other organizational elements
Training:** Provide regular training to team members to ensure they are up-to-date with the latest threats and response strategies
Test and Update:** Regularly test the team's effectiveness in responding to simulated incidents and update procedures as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that an integrated information security analysis team exists, that roles and responsibilities are clearly defined, that procedures for responding to incidents are documented and followed, and that the team's effectiveness is regularly tested and procedures updated as necessary.

title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: This control is designed to ensure that organizations establish and maintain formal, documented procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system maintenance policy and associated system maintenance controls. It is crucial for security and compliance as it helps to prevent unauthorized and potentially harmful changes to systems.
description: MA-1 requires organizations to develop, document, and disseminate a system maintenance policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance. It also requires procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system maintenance policy and associated system maintenance controls.
implementation_guidance: Develop a system maintenance policy that includes the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance
Document the policy and ensure it is approved by the management
Disseminate the policy to all relevant parties within the organization
Develop procedures that facilitate the implementation of the system maintenance policy and associated system maintenance controls
Document these procedures and ensure they are approved by the management
Train relevant personnel on these procedures and ensure they are followed
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a system maintenance policy and procedures have been developed, documented, approved, and disseminated. They will also look for evidence that these procedures are being followed and that the policy and procedures are regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Controlled Maintenance
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that maintenance of organizational systems and components is conducted in a controlled manner, reducing the risk of unauthorized access, misuse, or information leakage during maintenance activities.
description: This control requires organizations to maintain their systems and components in a controlled manner, with maintenance personnel being supervised and having appropriate access. It also requires organizations to document and approve maintenance activities, and to sanitize equipment before returning it to service.
implementation_guidance: Develop and implement a policy that outlines how maintenance activities should be conducted in a controlled manner
Ensure that all maintenance personnel, whether internal or external, are appropriately supervised during maintenance activities
Implement controls to ensure that maintenance personnel have only the necessary access to perform their duties
Document all maintenance activities, including what was done, when, and by whom
Implement a process for approving maintenance activities before they are carried out
Ensure that all equipment is sanitized before it is returned to service, to prevent any potential information leakage
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a policy for controlled maintenance, that maintenance activities are supervised and approved, and that equipment is sanitized before being returned to service. They will also look for documentation of maintenance activities.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Maintenance Tools
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that maintenance tools are securely managed to prevent unauthorized access and potential system vulnerabilities. It is crucial for security and compliance as it minimizes the risk of system compromise during maintenance activities.
description: This control requires organizations to approve, control, and monitor the use of maintenance tools and equipment. The organization must also sanitize or destroy maintenance tools and equipment before disposal or release for reuse.
implementation_guidance: Identify and Inventory Maintenance Tools:** Start by identifying all maintenance tools used within the organization. This includes both software and hardware tools
Approve Tools:** Ensure that all maintenance tools are approved for use by appropriate personnel
Control Access:** Implement controls to limit access to these tools to authorized personnel only. This could include physical controls for hardware tools and access controls for software tools
Monitor Use:** Regularly monitor the use of these tools to detect any unauthorized or inappropriate use
Sanitize or Destroy Tools:** Before disposing of or reusing maintenance tools, ensure they are properly sanitized or destroyed to prevent any potential data leakage
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a process in place for approving, controlling, and monitoring the use of maintenance tools. They will also look for evidence that the organization properly sanitizes or destroys tools before disposal or reuse.

title: Nonlocal Maintenance
purpose: This control is designed to ensure that nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities are conducted in a secure manner to prevent unauthorized access and potential compromise of the system. It is important for security and compliance as it helps to protect the system from vulnerabilities that could be introduced during nonlocal maintenance activities.
description: The control requires organizations to authorize, monitor, and control nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities. It also requires organizations to maintain records of these activities and to use strong methods of authentication to verify the identity of the individuals conducting the maintenance.
implementation_guidance: Develop Policies and Procedures:** Establish policies and procedures for conducting nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities. This should include the process for authorizing and monitoring these activities

Implement Strong Authentication:** Use strong methods of authentication to verify the identity of individuals conducting nonlocal maintenance. This could include multi-factor authentication or digital certificates

Monitor and Control Activities:** Monitor and control nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities to ensure they are conducted in a secure manner. This could include using secure remote access tools and logging all activities

Maintain Records:** Maintain records of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities. This should include the date and time of the activity, the individual who conducted it, and a description of the work performed
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has policies and procedures in place for nonlocal maintenance, that they use strong methods of authentication, and that they monitor and control these activities. They will also look for records of nonlocal maintenance activities.

title: Maintenance Personnel
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the personnel performing maintenance on the organization's systems are adequately vetted and trustworthy. This is important for security and compliance as it minimizes the risk of unauthorized access, misuse, or damage to the systems during maintenance activities.
description: This control requires organizations to establish process and procedures for maintenance personnel that includes security safeguards. It mandates that maintenance personnel have necessary access authorizations, are appropriately supervised, and do not have non-escorted access to the system unless explicitly authorized.
implementation_guidance: Develop and document policies and procedures for maintenance activities, including the vetting of maintenance personnel
Ensure that maintenance personnel have the appropriate access authorizations before they perform maintenance activities
Implement supervision measures for maintenance personnel, especially if they are third-party or external to the organization
Establish a process for granting non-escorted access to maintenance personnel, if necessary. This should be an exception, not the norm, and must be explicitly authorized
Regularly review and update the policies and procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for documented policies and procedures for maintenance activities, evidence of access authorizations for maintenance personnel, and records of supervision. They will also review any instances of non-escorted access granted to maintenance personnel.

title: Timely Maintenance
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization conducts timely maintenance of its information systems. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to prevent system failures, security vulnerabilities, and ensures the system continues to operate effectively and securely.
description: This control requires the organization to schedule, perform, document, and review maintenance on information systems in a timely manner. It also requires the organization to approve, log, and monitor all maintenance activities, whether they are performed on-site or remotely.
implementation_guidance: Develop a maintenance policy that outlines how and when maintenance should be performed on information systems
Schedule regular maintenance activities based on the policy. This could be weekly, monthly, or quarterly depending on the system's requirements
Document all maintenance activities, including what was done, who performed it, and when it was completed
Review and approve all maintenance activities before they are performed to ensure they are necessary and will not negatively impact the system's security
Monitor maintenance activities to ensure they are performed as scheduled and according to the policy
Review the maintenance logs regularly to identify any potential issues or areas for improvement
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a maintenance policy in place, that maintenance activities are scheduled and performed in a timely manner, and that all maintenance activities are documented, approved, and monitored.

title: Field Maintenance
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that maintenance and repairs of organizational systems and components are performed in a controlled and secure manner. This is important to prevent unauthorized access, tampering, or introduction of malicious software during the maintenance process.
description: This control requires organizations to sanitize equipment to remove all information from associated media prior to equipment leaving the facility for off-site maintenance or repairs. It also requires organizations to check all potentially impacted security controls to verify they are still functioning correctly after maintenance is performed.
implementation_guidance: Develop and implement a policy that requires all equipment to be sanitized before it leaves the facility for off-site maintenance. This policy should include procedures for sanitizing different types of media
Train all relevant personnel on the policy and procedures

Establish a process for checking all potentially impacted security controls after maintenance is performed to ensure they are still functioning correctly. This process should include a checklist of controls to check and a method for documenting the results
Regularly review and update the policy, procedures, and checklist as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a policy and procedures for sanitizing equipment before it leaves the facility for off-site maintenance. They will also look for evidence that the organization checks all potentially impacted security controls after maintenance is performed.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish and maintain policies and procedures for the effective implementation of selected security controls and control enhancements in the Media Protection family. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to prevent unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction of information during storage, transmission, or transport.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, document, and disseminate a media protection policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance. It also requires procedures to facilitate the implementation of the media protection policy and associated media protection controls.
implementation_guidance: Develop a media protection policy that includes the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance
Document the media protection policy and make it accessible to all relevant personnel
Develop procedures that facilitate the implementation of the media protection policy and associated media protection controls
Document these procedures and make them accessible to all relevant personnel
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence of a well-documented and disseminated media protection policy. They will also look for procedures that facilitate the implementation of the media protection policy and associated media protection controls.
assessment_methods: Compliance will be verified using the following methods:

title: Media Access
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized access to digital media, which includes both physical and electronic media. This is crucial for maintaining the confidentiality and integrity of sensitive information stored on such media.
description: The control requires organizations to restrict access to information system media to authorized individuals. This includes both physical access to media in facilities and electronic access to media in information systems.
implementation_guidance: Identify all types of media used within the organization that store sensitive information
Develop and implement policies and procedures that restrict access to these media to only authorized individuals
Implement physical controls, such as locked storage rooms or cabinets, to restrict physical access to media
Implement technical controls, such as access control lists or encryption, to restrict electronic access to media
Regularly review and update access controls to ensure they remain effective as personnel and system changes occur
Train staff on the importance of media access controls and their role in maintaining them
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all media storing sensitive information, implemented appropriate access controls, and regularly reviews and updates these controls. They will also look for evidence of staff training on media access controls.

title: Media Marking
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that information system media, both digital and non-digital, are appropriately marked so that personnel can make informed decisions regarding the distribution, handling, and disposal of the media. This is crucial for maintaining the confidentiality and integrity of the information contained within the media.
description: The control requires organizations to mark information system media indicating the distribution limitations, handling caveats, and applicable security markings (classification level). This includes both digital and non-digital media.
implementation_guidance: Develop and implement a policy that requires all information system media to be marked with appropriate security labels
Ensure that the policy includes guidelines for marking both digital and non-digital media
Train personnel on the policy and the importance of media marking for information security
Regularly review and update the policy as necessary, and retrain personnel as needed
Monitor compliance with the media marking policy and take corrective action when necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a media marking policy in place, that the policy is being followed, and that personnel are aware of and understand the policy.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Media Storage
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information stored on digital media. It is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access, alteration, or destruction of data.
description: The control requires organizations to physically and logically protect information system media, both paper and digital, in storage. This includes ensuring that the media is stored in a manner that protects it from physical and environmental damage, as well as unauthorized access.
implementation_guidance: Identify all types of information system media used within the organization
Develop and implement policies and procedures for securely storing these media types. This should include measures for both physical and logical protection
Physically secure media in storage by using locked storage containers or rooms, and control access to these areas
Logically secure media by using encryption or other access control mechanisms
Protect media from environmental threats such as heat, humidity, and magnetic fields
Regularly review and update the media storage policies and procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all types of media, developed and implemented secure storage policies and procedures, physically and logically secured the media, and protected it from environmental threats.

title: Media Transport
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information during the physical transport of media containing sensitive data. This control is crucial to prevent unauthorized access, alteration, or destruction of the data during transit.
description: This control requires organizations to protect and control media during transport outside of controlled areas, using cryptography and physical safeguards. It applies to both digital and non-digital media.
implementation_guidance: Identify Media Types:** Identify all types of media that store sensitive information and may require transport
Establish Policies and Procedures:** Develop and document policies and procedures for the secure transport of media. This should include the use of secure containers and tamper-evident packaging
Use Cryptography:** Encrypt sensitive data before transport to protect the confidentiality and integrity of the information
Train Personnel:** Train personnel responsible for media transport on the policies and procedures. This should include how to handle incidents or security breaches during transport
Monitor Compliance:** Regularly review and audit the transport process to ensure compliance with the policies and procedures
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has implemented policies and procedures for secure media transport, that encryption is used where appropriate, and that personnel are trained on these procedures. They will also check for evidence of regular reviews and audits.

title: Media Sanitization
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that information is irretrievably removed from digital media before the media is disposed of or repurposed. This is important for security and compliance as it prevents unauthorized individuals from gaining access to sensitive information.
description: This control requires organizations to sanitize digital media using approved techniques before disposal or reuse. The sanitization process must be documented and verified to ensure that no recoverable information remains on the media.
implementation_guidance: Develop and document a media sanitization policy that outlines the approved techniques for different types of media and information sensitivity levels
Train personnel on the media sanitization policy and procedures
Prior to disposal or reuse, sanitize media using the approved techniques. This may include physical destruction, degaussing, or overwriting
Verify the sanitization process to ensure no recoverable information remains on the media. This may involve using specialized software to scan for residual data
Document the sanitization process, including the date, method used, and personnel involved. Maintain these records for audit purposes
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for a documented media sanitization policy, evidence of training, records of sanitization processes, and verification of successful sanitization. They will also evaluate whether the organization's sanitization techniques are appropriate for the types of media and sensitivity of information involved.

title: Media Use
purpose: The purpose of this control is to restrict the use of information system media to authorized users and specific types of transactions. It helps prevent unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction of information.
description: This control requires organizations to control the use of removable media on information systems, prohibit unauthorized media, and restrict media use to authorized personnel only. It also requires the sanitization or destruction of media before disposal or reuse.
implementation_guidance: Develop and implement a policy that restricts the use of removable media on information systems
Define and document the types of transactions that are allowed to use removable media
Implement technical controls to enforce the policy, such as disabling USB ports or other media drives on certain systems
Train personnel on the policy and the risks associated with unauthorized media use
Establish procedures for sanitizing or destroying media before disposal or reuse
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has a policy in place that restricts the use of removable media, that the policy is being enforced, and that personnel are aware of and understand the policy. They will also check that procedures for sanitizing or destroying media are being followed.

title: Media Downgrading
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that information is properly protected when media is downgraded or declassified. This is important for security and compliance because it helps prevent unauthorized access to sensitive information.
description: This control requires organizations to sanitize, destroy, or otherwise render inaccessible the information on digital media when it is downgraded or declassified.
implementation_guidance: Develop a policy for media downgrading that includes procedures for sanitizing, destroying, or otherwise rendering inaccessible the information on digital media
Train personnel on the media downgrading policy and procedures
Implement the media downgrading policy and procedures when media is downgraded or declassified
Document the actions taken to sanitize, destroy, or otherwise render inaccessible the information on the media
Review and update the media downgrading policy and procedures as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a media downgrading policy and procedures in place, that personnel are trained on these procedures, and that the procedures are followed when media is downgraded or declassified.
assessment_methods: Compliance will be verified using the following methods:

title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization has established and effectively implemented policies and procedures for physical and environmental protection. This is important for security and compliance as it helps protect an organization's information systems and resources from physical and environmental threats.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, document, and disseminate a physical and environmental protection policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance. It also requires procedures to facilitate the implementation of the physical and environmental protection policy and associated controls.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive policy that outlines the organization's approach to physical and environmental protection. This policy should include the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance
Document the policy and ensure it is easily accessible to all relevant personnel
Develop procedures that facilitate the implementation of the physical and environmental protection policy and associated controls. These procedures should be clear, concise, and actionable
Disseminate the policy and procedures to all relevant personnel and ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a documented policy and procedures for physical and environmental protection. They will also look for evidence that these have been disseminated to relevant personnel and that they are being effectively implemented.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and test methods. The examination method involves reviewing the documented policy and procedures. The interview method involves talking to relevant personnel to verify their understanding and implementation of the policy and procedures. The test method involves observing the physical and environmental protection measures in place to verify they align with the documented policy and procedures.

title: Physical Access Authorizations
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that only authorized individuals have physical access to the information system or the facility where it is housed. This is important for security and compliance as it prevents unauthorized access, manipulation, or damage to the system or its components.
description: This control requires the organization to develop, disseminate, and periodically review/update a list of personnel with authorized access to the facility where the information system resides. It also requires the organization to issue authorization credentials and review these credentials regularly.
implementation_guidance: Develop a formal process for authorizing physical access to the facility where the information system is housed. This process should include criteria for granting access, such as role, responsibility, and clearance level
Create and maintain a list of personnel who are authorized to access the facility. This list should be updated regularly and whenever there are changes in personnel or their roles
Issue authorization credentials (e.g., badges, access cards) to authorized personnel. These credentials should be uniquely identifiable and non-transferable
Implement a process for reviewing and updating authorization credentials at regular intervals or whenever there are changes in personnel or their roles

Ensure that the physical access authorization process is integrated with the organization's personnel termination and transfer processes to promptly remove access for individuals no longer requiring it
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a formal process for authorizing physical access, maintains an updated list of authorized personnel, issues unique authorization credentials, and regularly reviews and updates these credentials. They will also check that the process is integrated with personnel termination and transfer processes.

title: Physical Access Control
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized physical access to information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments. This is crucial for security and compliance as it helps protect sensitive data and system resources from physical threats such as theft, damage, or unauthorized access.
description: This control requires organizations to implement physical access controls to limit access to information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments. It involves the use of physical barriers, guards, access control systems, surveillance, and procedures to control and monitor access to facilities.
implementation_guidance: Identify Critical Areas:** Identify and document areas where sensitive data and information systems are stored or accessed
Implement Physical Barriers:** Install physical barriers such as doors, locks, and gates to prevent unauthorized access
Deploy Access Control Systems:** Implement access control systems like card readers, biometric systems, or keypads to control and monitor access
Establish Access Procedures:** Develop and document procedures for granting, revoking, and reviewing access rights
Train Staff:** Train staff on the procedures and importance of physical security
Monitor and Review:** Regularly monitor and review access logs and security incidents to identify and address potential security issues
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that physical access controls are in place and effective. They will review the procedures for granting, revoking, and reviewing access rights, and they will check that staff are trained on these procedures.

title: Access Control for Transmission
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that physical access to information systems transmitting sensitive data is adequately protected. This is crucial to prevent unauthorized access, tampering, or interception of data during transmission.
description: This control requires organizations to implement physical safeguards for areas housing information system transmission devices and associated cabling. This includes controlling physical access to prevent unauthorized individuals from tampering with or intercepting data during transmission.
implementation_guidance: Identify all areas housing information system transmission devices and associated cabling
Develop and implement a physical access control policy that includes procedures for granting, revoking, and reviewing physical access rights
Install physical barriers (e.g., locked doors, secure cabinets) to protect transmission devices and cabling from unauthorized access
Implement monitoring mechanisms (e.g., CCTV cameras, intrusion detection systems) to detect and respond to unauthorized access attempts
Regularly review and update the physical access control policy and procedures to ensure their effectiveness
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has identified all areas housing transmission devices and cabling, implemented appropriate physical access controls, and regularly reviews and updates its access control policy and procedures.

title: Access Control for Output Devices
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized individuals from gaining access to information via output devices. This is important for security and compliance as it helps protect sensitive information from being disclosed or manipulated.
description: This control requires organizations to restrict physical access to information system output devices to prevent unauthorized individuals from obtaining output data. It also requires the organization to monitor the use of these output devices to detect and respond to unauthorized access.
implementation_guidance: Identify all output devices connected to the information system, such as printers, monitors, and audio devices

Develop and implement policies and procedures to restrict physical access to these devices. This could include measures such as placing devices in secure areas, using locks, or requiring authentication for use
Establish a process for monitoring the use of output devices. This could involve maintaining logs of device usage, conducting regular audits, or using security cameras
Train staff on the importance of securing output devices and how to follow the established policies and procedures
Regularly review and update the access control measures as needed to address changes in the information system or threat environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all output devices, implemented appropriate access control measures, established a monitoring process, and trained staff on these measures. They will also check that the organization regularly reviews and updates these measures.

title: Monitoring Physical Access
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that physical access to information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments is monitored to detect and respond to physical security incidents. This is crucial for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access, theft, damage, or interference with critical information systems.
description: This control requires organizations to monitor physical access to their information systems and facilities, document and manage physical access authorizations, and review and update the access list regularly. It also requires organizations to escort visitors and monitor visitor activity.
implementation_guidance: Develop and implement a policy for monitoring physical access to information systems and facilities
Install physical access control systems (PACS) such as CCTV cameras, biometric systems, card readers, etc., at all entry and exit points
Document and manage physical access authorizations, including visitor control and access removal processes
Regularly review and update the access list, removing individuals who no longer require access
Implement a process for escorting visitors and monitoring their activities within the facility
Ensure all physical access and visitor activity are logged and reviewed regularly for any anomalies or unauthorized access attempts
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a policy for monitoring physical access, has implemented appropriate PACS, maintains an updated access list, escorts and monitors visitors, and reviews access logs regularly.

title: Visitor Access Records
purpose: The purpose of this control is to maintain a record of visitor access to the facility where the information system resides. This is important for security and compliance as it helps in tracking unauthorized access and potential threats to the system.
description: This control requires the organization to document and manage records of visitor access to the facility. It includes the visitor's name, organization, and the individual visited. The records should be kept for an agreed-upon time period.
implementation_guidance: Develop a policy for visitor access that includes the requirement for maintaining visitor logs
Implement a visitor log system, either manually or electronically, to record visitor information such as name, organization, purpose of visit, date, time in, time out, and the individual visited
Train staff on the importance of the visitor log and how to properly record visitor information
Regularly review and update the visitor log to ensure it is being properly maintained
Retain visitor logs for an agreed-upon time period, in accordance with organizational policy and any applicable regulations
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a visitor log system is in place and being properly maintained. They will also check that visitor logs are being retained for the required time period.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through examination of the visitor log system and related policies, interviews with staff to confirm their understanding and adherence to the visitor log policy, and testing of the visitor log system to ensure it is functioning as intended.

title: Power Equipment and Cabling
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the organization's information system from power disruptions and potential physical damage due to improper power equipment and cabling. It ensures the continuity of operations and the integrity of the system.
description: This control requires the organization to protect power equipment and power cabling for the information system from damage and destruction. This includes protection from physical tampering, environmental hazards, and electrical supply interruptions.
implementation_guidance: Identify all power equipment and cabling associated with the information system

Develop and implement a plan to protect power equipment and cabling from physical and environmental threats. This could include physical enclosures, surge protectors, uninterruptible power supplies (UPS), and redundant power sources
Regularly inspect power equipment and cabling for signs of wear, damage, or tampering
Establish procedures for the safe and proper handling, installation, and maintenance of power equipment and cabling
Train personnel on these procedures and the importance of power equipment and cabling protection
Document all measures taken to protect power equipment and cabling in the System Security Plan (SSP)
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that power equipment and cabling are adequately protected from physical and environmental threats. They will also look for documentation of these protective measures in the SSP and evidence of regular inspections and maintenance.

title: Emergency Shutoff
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization has the ability to immediately shut down the information system or individual system components in emergency situations. This is crucial to prevent further damage to the system, protect sensitive data, and ensure the safety of personnel.
description: This control requires organizations to provide emergency shutoff capability for the information system or individual system components in order to prevent harm to individuals or damage to the system in the event of an emergency.
implementation_guidance: Identify all system components that could potentially cause harm to individuals or the system in the event of an emergency
Install emergency shutoff mechanisms for each of these components
Ensure that the shutoff mechanisms are easily accessible and can be operated quickly and safely in an emergency
Develop and implement procedures for using the emergency shutoff mechanisms
Train all relevant personnel on the procedures for using the emergency shutoff mechanisms
Regularly test the emergency shutoff mechanisms to ensure they are functioning correctly
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that emergency shutoff mechanisms have been installed for all relevant system components, that procedures for using these mechanisms have been developed and implemented, and that relevant personnel have been trained on these procedures.

title: Emergency Power
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's information system continues to operate and maintain its security posture during power disruptions. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to prevent data loss, system downtime, and potential breaches that could occur during power outages.
description: This control requires the organization to provide a short-term and long-term alternate power supply for the information system to sustain its operation in the event of an electrical power outage.
implementation_guidance: Identify critical systems that require continuous power supply for their operation
Determine the power requirements of these systems
Procure and install appropriate short-term power solutions (e.g., Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) systems) for immediate power outage situations
Procure and install appropriate long-term power solutions (e.g., generators) for prolonged power outage situations
Test the functionality and effectiveness of the power solutions regularly
Develop and implement procedures for switching to alternate power sources during power disruptions
Train personnel on the procedures and the use of alternate power sources
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified critical systems, determined their power requirements, and provided appropriate short-term and long-term power solutions. They will also look for procedures for switching to alternate power sources and evidence that these procedures are known and followed by personnel.

title: Emergency Lighting
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that in the event of a power failure or other emergency, critical operations can continue without interruption. This is important for security and compliance as it ensures that security systems remain operational and that personnel can safely evacuate if necessary.
description: This control requires the organization to employ and maintain emergency lighting systems that automatically activate in the event of a power outage or disruption, illuminating emergency exits and paths of egress.
implementation_guidance: Identify areas within the facility that require emergency lighting, such as emergency exits, paths of egress, and areas housing critical systems
Install emergency lighting systems in these identified areas. These systems should automatically activate in the event of a power outage
Regularly test the emergency lighting systems to ensure they function correctly. This should include both scheduled tests and random checks
Maintain a log of these tests, noting any issues and the steps taken to resolve them
Regularly maintain and replace components of the emergency lighting system as needed to ensure its continued functionality
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that emergency lighting systems are in place, that they activate automatically in the event of a power outage, and that they are regularly tested and maintained. They will also look for documentation of these tests and any maintenance activities.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Fire Protection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization has adequate fire protection measures in place to prevent, detect, and suppress fires in information system facilities. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to protect the physical infrastructure that supports information systems from fire damage, thus ensuring the continuity of operations and the integrity of data.
description: This control requires the organization to employ and maintain fire protection mechanisms to control the spread of fire in information system facilities. It also requires the organization to perform periodic maintenance on these mechanisms.
implementation_guidance: Identify and document all information system facilities that require fire protection
Determine the appropriate fire protection mechanisms for each facility, considering factors such as the size of the facility, the materials present, and the potential sources of fire
Install the chosen fire protection mechanisms. This could include fire extinguishers, fire alarms, smoke detectors, and automatic fire suppression systems
Develop and implement a maintenance schedule for each fire protection mechanism, ensuring that they are regularly tested and serviced
Train personnel on how to use the fire protection mechanisms and what to do in the event of a fire
Document all fire protection mechanisms and their maintenance schedules in the System Security Plan (SSP)
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that fire protection mechanisms are in place and maintained. They will also look for documentation of these mechanisms in the SSP, and evidence that personnel have been trained on their use.

title: Visitor Control
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that unauthorized physical access to the organization's facilities is prevented. It helps in maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the organization's information systems by controlling and monitoring visitor access to the facilities.
description: This control requires the organization to document and enforce procedures for allowing visitor access to the facilities. It includes escorting and monitoring visitors, maintaining visitor logs, and securing physical access points.
implementation_guidance: Develop and document procedures for visitor control. This should include steps for visitor identification, authorization, escorting, and monitoring
Implement the visitor control procedures. This may involve training staff on the procedures, posting signage, and setting up systems for visitor logging and badge issuance
Regularly review and update the visitor control procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant
Maintain a record of visitor logs and any incidents related to visitor access
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for documented visitor control procedures, evidence of their implementation (such as visitor logs or badges), and evidence of regular review and updates to the procedures. They will also look for any incidents related to visitor access and how they were handled.

title: Environmental Controls
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the organization's information systems from environmental threats and hazards, such as fire, temperature, humidity, water, dust, vibrations, and power failures. This is important for security and compliance as it ensures the continuity of operations and the integrity of the systems.
description: This control requires organizations to establish, document, and maintain an environmental control strategy that includes appropriate safeguards to protect information systems from environmental threats and hazards.
implementation_guidance: Identify potential environmental threats and hazards to your information systems
Develop an environmental control strategy that includes safeguards to protect against identified threats and hazards
Document the environmental control strategy and ensure it is communicated to all relevant personnel
Implement the environmental control strategy, including the installation of necessary equipment and systems
Regularly review and update the environmental control strategy to ensure it remains effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified potential environmental threats and hazards, developed and documented an environmental control strategy, and implemented the strategy effectively. They will also check that the strategy is regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods. The "examine" method may involve reviewing the documented environmental control strategy and any records of its implementation and updates. The "interview" method may involve discussions with relevant personnel to understand their awareness and involvement in the strategy. The "test" method may involve checks of the environmental control equipment and systems to ensure they are functioning correctly and providing the intended protection.

title: Water Damage Protection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the organization's information system components from water damage that could disrupt system operations, cause data loss, or lead to physical harm. This is crucial for maintaining system availability, integrity, and safety.
description: This control requires the organization to implement safeguards to protect information system components at the facility where the system resides from damage resulting from water leakage, sprinkler systems, or other water sources.
implementation_guidance: Identify potential sources of water damage in the facility, such as plumbing, cooling systems, exterior walls, roofs, and fire suppression systems
Evaluate the risk of water damage to information system components from each identified source

Implement appropriate safeguards to protect against water damage. This could include water detection systems, water-resistant barriers, or strategic placement of critical components away from potential water sources
Regularly inspect and maintain these safeguards to ensure their effectiveness
Develop and implement a response plan for potential water damage incidents, including steps for system recovery and data backup
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified potential sources of water damage, evaluated the associated risks, implemented appropriate safeguards, and established a response plan.

title: Delivery and Removal
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization protects against unauthorized physical access, damage, and interference to the organization’s information system during delivery and removal activities. This is important for security and compliance as it prevents unauthorized individuals from gaining access to sensitive information during these processes.
description: This control requires the organization to supervise the delivery and removal of information system components, to maintain records of those activities, and to protect against unauthorized access or alteration during delivery and removal.
implementation_guidance: Develop and implement a policy that outlines the procedures for the delivery and removal of information system components
Ensure that all delivery and removal activities are supervised by authorized personnel
Maintain records of delivery and removal activities, including the date, time, nature of the component, and the individuals involved

Implement measures to protect against unauthorized physical access, damage, and interference during delivery and removal. This could include secure packaging, tamper-evident seals, and secure transportation methods
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a policy and procedures in place for the delivery and removal of information system components. They will also look for records of these activities and evidence that they were supervised by authorized personnel.

title: Alternate Work Site
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a secure alternate work site for their employees. This is important for security and compliance as it ensures continuity of operations in case of emergencies or other situations that may render the primary work site inaccessible or unusable.
description: This control requires organizations to establish, equip, and secure alternate work sites. These sites should be able to support the organization's operations and should meet the same security requirements as the primary work site.
implementation_guidance: Identify potential alternate work sites that can support the organization's operations
Evaluate the security measures at these sites and ensure they meet the organization's security requirements
Equip the alternate work sites with necessary resources and infrastructure to support the organization's operations
Establish procedures for activating and using the alternate work sites
Train employees on these procedures and conduct regular drills to ensure readiness
Regularly review and update the alternate work site plan as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified, equipped, and secured an alternate work site. They will also look for procedures for activating and using the alternate work site, as well as evidence of employee training and regular drills.

title: Location of System Components
purpose: The purpose of this control is to minimize potential damage to system components and reduce the risk of unauthorized access. By carefully considering the location of system components, organizations can protect their systems from environmental threats and hazards, and from opportunities for unauthorized access.
description: This control requires organizations to position system components within the facility to minimize potential damage from physical and environmental hazards and to prevent unauthorized access.
implementation_guidance: Identify System Components:** Begin by identifying all system components that need to be protected. This includes servers, workstations, network devices, and any other critical hardware

Assess Potential Hazards:** Evaluate the potential physical and environmental hazards in your facility. This could include things like flooding, fire, extreme temperatures, and unauthorized access points

Determine Optimal Locations:** Based on your assessment, determine the optimal locations for each system component. Consider factors such as proximity to fire suppression systems, access to cooling, and distance from potential water damage
Implement Changes:** If necessary, move system components to their new locations. Ensure that all changes are documented and communicated to relevant personnel
Review and Update:** Regularly review and update the location of system components as needed, especially when new components are added or when potential hazards change
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all system components, assessed potential hazards, determined optimal locations for each component, and implemented any necessary changes. They will also look for evidence that the organization regularly reviews and updates the location of system components.

title: Information Leakage
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent the unintentional leakage of information through electromagnetic, acoustic, thermal, or other means from system components. This is important for security and compliance as it helps protect sensitive information from being accessed by unauthorized individuals or entities.
description: This control requires organizations to implement measures to prevent information leakage from system components. This includes the use of shielding, filters, or other physical security measures to prevent the leakage of information.
implementation_guidance: Identify system components that may be susceptible to information leakage, such as servers, workstations, network devices, and other hardware
Evaluate the risk of information leakage from these components based on their location, usage, and the sensitivity of the information they process
Implement appropriate measures to prevent information leakage. This could include physical shielding, the use of filters, or other protective measures
Regularly review and update these measures to ensure they remain effective as technology and potential threats evolve
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified potential sources of information leakage and implemented appropriate measures to prevent it. They will also look for evidence that these measures are regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Asset Monitoring and Tracking
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization's physical assets are appropriately monitored and tracked to prevent unauthorized access, theft, or damage. This is crucial for maintaining the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of the information system.
description: This control requires organizations to implement a system for monitoring and tracking the location and movement of physical assets. It includes maintaining an inventory of all physical assets and ensuring that any changes in location or status are promptly recorded.
implementation_guidance: Identify Physical Assets:** Start by identifying all physical assets that are part of your information system. This could include servers, workstations, laptops, networking equipment, and any other hardware
Create an Asset Inventory:** Develop a comprehensive inventory of these assets. Include details such as asset type, location, owner, and status

Implement Monitoring Mechanisms:** Establish mechanisms to monitor the location and movement of these assets. This could involve physical security measures like CCTV cameras, or asset tracking technologies like RFID tags
Update Inventory Regularly:** Ensure that the asset inventory is updated regularly and whenever there are changes in the location or status of an asset

Develop Policies and Procedures:** Develop and implement policies and procedures for asset monitoring and tracking. This should include procedures for reporting and investigating any anomalies or incidents
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a comprehensive and up-to-date asset inventory, effective mechanisms for monitoring and tracking assets, and robust policies and procedures for managing this process.

title: Electromagnetic Pulse Protection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the organization's information systems from the potential damage caused by electromagnetic pulses (EMPs). EMPs can disrupt, damage, or destroy electronic devices and systems, which can lead to loss of data, system downtime, and potential breaches of security.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and implement measures to protect against the harmful effects of electromagnetic pulses. This includes both naturally occurring EMPs (e.g., from solar flares) and man-made EMPs (e.g., from nuclear explosions or specialized EMP weapons).
implementation_guidance: Risk Assessment:** Conduct a risk assessment to understand the potential impact of an EMP on your organization's information systems

Protection Measures:** Based on the risk assessment, determine the appropriate EMP protection measures. This could include shielding for electronic equipment, surge protectors, or even specialized EMP-resistant hardware
Implementation:** Implement the chosen protection measures. This may involve physical modifications to your facilities or changes to your IT infrastructure
Testing:** Regularly test your EMP protection measures to ensure they are effective and functioning as intended
Maintenance:** Maintain and update your EMP protection measures as needed, based on changes to your risk profile or advancements in EMP protection technology
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has conducted a risk assessment, implemented appropriate EMP protection measures, and is maintaining and testing these measures regularly.

title: Component Marking
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that physical components of the information system are properly marked so that they can be correctly identified and managed. This is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction of these components.
description: This control requires the organization to mark information system components in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and operational requirements. The marking must be done in a way that is unambiguous and readily identifiable.
implementation_guidance: Identify all physical components of the information system that need to be marked. This could include servers, routers, switches, workstations, storage devices, etc

Determine the appropriate marking for each component based on federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and operational requirements. This could include labels, barcodes, RFID tags, etc
Apply the marking to each component in a way that is unambiguous and readily identifiable. This could involve physically attaching labels, engraving or etching identifiers, etc
Maintain a record of all marked components and their associated identifiers for management and tracking purposes
Regularly review and update the markings as necessary, such as when components are added, removed, or replaced
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that all physical components of the information system are properly marked in accordance with applicable requirements. They will also look for evidence that the organization maintains a record of all marked components and their associated identifiers.

title: Facility Location
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the physical location of the facility housing the information system is chosen with consideration to minimize potential damage from physical and environmental threats. This includes natural disasters, man-made events, and proximity to hazardous materials or processes.
description: This control requires organizations to consider the physical and environmental risks associated with the location of the facility. The organization must take into account factors such as flood zones, seismic activity, proximity to hazardous materials, and other potential threats when choosing the location for their facility.
implementation_guidance: Conduct a comprehensive risk assessment of the proposed location, considering factors such as natural disasters, man-made events, and proximity to hazardous materials or processes
Document the findings of the risk assessment and use this information to inform the decision-making process for the facility location
If the facility is already located, evaluate the risks associated with the current location and consider relocation if the risks are deemed too high

Implement mitigation strategies for identified risks that cannot be avoided by location choice alone. This could include physical security measures, emergency response plans, and environmental controls
Regularly review and update the risk assessment and mitigation strategies to ensure they remain relevant and effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a risk assessment has been conducted for the facility location, that the findings of the risk assessment have been documented, and that these findings have informed the decision-making process for the facility location. They will also look for evidence of implemented mitigation strategies for identified risks.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. This could include reviewing the risk assessment documentation, interviewing personnel involved in the decision-making process for the facility location, and testing the effectiveness of implemented mitigation strategies.

title: Policy and Procedures
