purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization develops, disseminates, and periodically reviews/updates a formal, documented System Security Plan (SSP) that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and management commitment.
description: This control requires the organization to establish and make readily available to all personnel a set of policies and procedures that guide the implementation of the system security plan. It also mandates periodic review and updates to these policies and procedures.
implementation_guidance: Develop a formal, documented System Security Plan (SSP) that includes purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and management commitment
Disseminate the SSP to all relevant personnel and stakeholders
Establish a set of policies and procedures that guide the implementation of the SSP
Make the policies and procedures readily available to all personnel
Establish a schedule for periodic review and updates to the SSP and its associated policies and procedures
Document any changes made during the review and update process and communicate these changes to all relevant personnel
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence of a formal, documented SSP, policies and procedures that guide its implementation, and records of periodic review and updates. They will also check that these documents are readily available to all personnel.

title: System Security and Privacy Plans
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a formal, documented plan that provides an overview of the security requirements for the system and describes the security controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements. This helps in maintaining the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of information systems.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, document, periodically update, and implement system security plans that describe system boundaries, system environments of operation, how security requirements are implemented, and the relationships with or connections to other systems.
implementation_guidance: Develop a system security plan that includes an overview of the system requirements, a description of the system environment, and a brief explanation of the system's security controls
Document the plan and ensure it is accessible to relevant personnel
Regularly review and update the plan to reflect changes to the system or environment, and to ensure it continues to meet security requirements
Implement the system security plan and ensure all personnel are aware of their roles and responsibilities in maintaining system security
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for a documented system security plan that is regularly updated and implemented. They will also look for evidence that the plan is communicated to all relevant personnel and that it accurately reflects the system's security requirements and controls.

title: System Security Plan Update
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the System Security Plan (SSP) remains effective and relevant in the face of evolving threats, changes in the system, and changes in the operational environment. Regular updates to the SSP are crucial for maintaining a strong security posture.
description: This control requires organizations to review and update the SSP periodically and whenever significant changes occur to the system or its environment. The SSP should reflect the current system environment and security requirements.
implementation_guidance: Establish a schedule for regular SSP reviews. The frequency may depend on the system's complexity, sensitivity, and the organization's risk tolerance, but it should be at least annually
Define what constitutes a significant change to the system or its environment. This could include changes in hardware, software, interfaces, or threats
Develop a process for identifying and documenting such changes when they occur

When a review is due or a significant change occurs, update the SSP to reflect the current system environment and security requirements. This may involve updating the system description, security controls, risk assessment, or other elements of the SSP
Document the date of each review and update, and the reasons for any changes made
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has a process for regularly reviewing and updating the SSP, and that this process is being followed. They will also check that the SSP accurately reflects the current system environment and security requirements.

title: Rules of Behavior
purpose: The purpose of this control is to establish and make known the rules of behavior for individuals accessing the information system. This is important for security and compliance as it sets clear expectations for user conduct, reducing the risk of misuse or unauthorized access.
description: This control requires the organization to establish and document rules of behavior for individuals accessing the information system. The rules should describe responsibilities and expected behavior regarding information system usage.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive set of rules of behavior that covers all aspects of information system usage. This should include, but not be limited to, rules regarding access control, data protection, incident reporting, and software installation
Document the rules of behavior in a clear and understandable manner. The document should be easily accessible to all individuals who have access to the information system
Ensure that the rules of behavior are communicated to all individuals with access to the information system. This could be done through training sessions, emails, or during the onboarding process
Require individuals to acknowledge (electronically or in writing) that they have read, understood, and agreed to abide by the rules of behavior
Regularly review and update the rules of behavior to ensure they remain relevant and effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has established and documented rules of behavior, communicated these rules to all individuals with access to the information system, and obtained acknowledgement from these individuals. They will also check that the rules of behavior are regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Privacy Impact Assessment
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations identify and address potential privacy risks in their systems, thereby protecting individuals' privacy rights and interests. It is crucial for security and compliance as it helps organizations to comply with privacy laws and regulations, and to build trust with stakeholders.
description: This control requires organizations to conduct a Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) for systems, technologies, programs, or practices that involve personally identifiable information (PII). The PIA should analyze how PII is collected, stored, protected, shared, and managed, and identify potential privacy risks and mitigation strategies.
implementation_guidance: Identify systems, technologies, programs, or practices that involve PII
Conduct a PIA for each identified item. The PIA should include the following:
Description of the system, technology, program, or practice
Explanation of its information flow
Identification of potential privacy risks
Proposed strategies to mitigate identified risks
Document the PIA results and mitigation strategies in the System Security Plan (SSP)
Review and update the PIA regularly, or whenever significant changes are made to the system, technology, program, or practice
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a PIA has been conducted for each system, technology, program, or practice that involves PII. They will also check whether the PIA results and mitigation strategies have been documented in the SSP, and whether the PIA is reviewed and updated regularly.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through the following methods:

title: Security-related Activity Planning
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization plans and coordinates security-related activities affecting the system before conducting such activities in order to reduce the impact on the organization, the system, and individuals.
description: This control requires the organization to plan and coordinate security-related activities before conducting them. The organization must also provide advance notice to appropriate organizational entities before conducting these activities.
implementation_guidance: Identify all security-related activities that could affect the system. This could include system upgrades, patches, changes in security policies, etc
Develop a plan for each identified activity. The plan should detail the steps to be taken, the resources required, and the potential impact on the system and the organization
Coordinate the planned activities with relevant stakeholders. This could include system owners, users, IT staff, and other affected parties
Provide advance notice to appropriate entities before conducting the activities. This could be done through emails, meetings, or other communication channels
Document all the planning and coordination activities for audit and review purposes
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all security-related activities, developed detailed plans for each activity, coordinated the activities with relevant stakeholders, and provided advance notice before conducting the activities.

title: Concept of Operations
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a clear, comprehensive, and well-documented understanding of how their systems operate. This includes understanding the system's mission, operational characteristics, and interactions with other systems. This is important for security and compliance as it helps identify potential vulnerabilities and risks.
description: This control requires organizations to develop a Concept of Operations (CONOPS) for the system that describes the characteristics of the system from an operational perspective. The CONOPS should include details about how the system will be used, who will use it, and how it interacts with other systems.
implementation_guidance: Identify the system's mission and operational characteristics
Identify the users of the system and their roles
Identify other systems that interact with the system and describe the nature of these interactions
Document all this information in a Concept of Operations (CONOPS) document
Review and update the CONOPS document regularly, especially when there are changes to the system or its operational environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for a comprehensive and up-to-date CONOPS document. They will check if the document includes all the required information, such as the system's mission, operational characteristics, users, and interactions with other systems.
assessment_methods: Assessors will use the examine method to review the CONOPS document. They may also use the interview method to verify the information in the document with system users and other stakeholders. The test method may be used to verify the operational characteristics and interactions of the system as described in the CONOPS document.

title: Security and Privacy Architectures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization develops, disseminates, and reviews/updates a formal, documented security and privacy architecture that accurately describes the current and planned security and privacy controls in the system. This is important for security and compliance as it helps in identifying and mitigating potential security and privacy risks.
description: This control requires the organization to create and maintain a comprehensive security and privacy architecture for its information system. The architecture should include a description of all security and privacy controls, their interrelationships, and how they integrate with other system components.
implementation_guidance: Identify System Components:** Start by identifying all components of your information system, including hardware, software, and data
Define Security and Privacy Controls:** Identify all security and privacy controls that are currently in place or planned for the system
Develop Architecture:** Develop a formal, documented architecture that describes these controls, their interrelationships, and how they integrate with other system components
Disseminate Architecture:** Make the architecture available to all relevant stakeholders, including system owners, operators, and users

Review and Update:** Regularly review and update the architecture to reflect changes in the system or its environment, and to ensure that it continues to meet the organization's security and privacy requirements
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a formal, documented security and privacy architecture, that it accurately describes the current and planned controls in the system, and that it is regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Central Management
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's security controls are centrally managed. This is important for security and compliance as it allows for consistent application of security policies and procedures across the organization, reducing the risk of security breaches due to inconsistent practices.
description: This control requires the organization to centrally manage the security controls within the organization. This includes the development, implementation, assessment, and monitoring of these controls.
implementation_guidance: Identify Central Management Team:** Appoint a central management team responsible for the development, implementation, assessment, and monitoring of security controls
Develop Policies and Procedures:** The central management team should develop comprehensive security policies and procedures that align with the organization's security objectives
Implement Security Controls:** Implement the developed security controls across the organization, ensuring all systems and processes comply with these controls
Monitor and Assess:** Regularly monitor and assess the effectiveness of the security controls. Make necessary adjustments based on the results of these assessments
Training and Awareness:** Conduct regular training and awareness sessions to ensure all employees understand and adhere to the security controls
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence of a central management team responsible for security controls. They will also look for comprehensive security policies and procedures, evidence of their implementation across the organization, and regular monitoring and assessment of these controls.

title: Baseline Selection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations select and document appropriate security controls for their information systems. This is important for security and compliance as it provides a foundation for the organization's security posture and helps to ensure that all necessary protections are in place.
description: This control requires organizations to select a set of minimum security controls (baseline) for their information systems, based on risk assessments, system categorization, and local conditions. The selected baseline should be documented in the System Security Plan (SSP).
implementation_guidance: Categorize Information System:** Identify and categorize the information system in accordance with FIPS 199 standards
Conduct Risk Assessment:** Perform a risk assessment to understand the potential threats and vulnerabilities to the information system
Select Baseline Controls:** Based on the system categorization and risk assessment, select a set of minimum security controls from NIST SP
Tailor Baseline Controls:** Adjust the baseline controls to fit the specific needs of the organization, considering factors such as operational environment and legal requirements
Document in SSP:** Document the selected and tailored baseline controls in the System Security Plan
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has properly categorized its information system, conducted a risk assessment, selected and tailored baseline controls based on the risk assessment and system categorization, and documented these controls in the SSP.

title: Baseline Tailoring
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's security controls are tailored to the specific needs of the system, taking into account the system's unique risk profile, operational environment, and mission requirements. This helps to ensure that the security controls are not only effective but also efficient, avoiding unnecessary costs or operational burdens.
description: This control requires the organization to tailor the set of baseline security controls, so that the controls are aligned with the organization's risk management strategy and the specific circumstances of the system. This includes supplementing the baseline controls with additional controls if necessary, and documenting all changes to the baseline.
implementation_guidance: Identify the baseline security controls for the system, based on its categorization according to FIPS 199 standards

Review the baseline controls and determine whether any controls need to be modified, added, or removed, taking into account the system's risk profile, operational environment, and mission requirements
Document all changes to the baseline controls, including the rationale for each change
Implement the tailored set of security controls
Review and update the tailored controls regularly, or whenever there are significant changes to the system or its environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a process for tailoring the baseline security controls, and that this process is followed consistently. They will also look for documentation of the tailored controls and the rationale for any changes to the baseline.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Information Security Program Plan
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization has a comprehensive and structured approach to information security. It helps in establishing, implementing, operating, monitoring, reviewing, maintaining, and improving the Information Security Management System (ISMS).
description: This control requires the organization to develop, document, periodically update, and implement an Information Security Program Plan. The plan should include the necessary security controls and describe how they are managed, coordinated, and integrated.
implementation_guidance: Identify Key Stakeholders:** Identify the key stakeholders who will be involved in the development and implementation of the Information Security Program Plan
Define Scope:** Define the scope of the Information Security Program Plan, including the systems, processes, and data it will cover
Develop the Plan:** Develop the Information Security Program Plan, outlining the security controls to be implemented and how they will be managed, coordinated, and integrated
Document the Plan:** Document the Information Security Program Plan and ensure it is accessible to all relevant stakeholders
Implement the Plan:** Implement the security controls as outlined in the plan
Monitor and Review:** Regularly monitor and review the effectiveness of the Information Security Program Plan, making necessary updates as required
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that an Information Security Program Plan has been developed, documented, implemented, and is regularly reviewed and updated. They will also evaluate whether the plan includes all necessary security controls and whether these controls are effectively managed, coordinated, and integrated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Information Security Program Leadership Role
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization has a designated senior official who is responsible for the leadership and direction of the organization's information security program. This role is crucial in establishing, implementing, and maintaining a robust and effective information security program.
description: This control requires organizations to assign a senior official with the responsibility of leading and coordinating the entity's information security program. The designated official is responsible for the overall direction and implementation of the security program, ensuring it aligns with the organization's mission and strategic goals.
implementation_guidance: Identify a senior official within the organization who has the authority and capability to lead the information security program
Formally assign the role of leading and coordinating the information security program to the identified official
Document the responsibilities and expectations of the role, including the development, implementation, and maintenance of the information security program
Ensure the designated official has sufficient resources, including personnel and budget, to effectively manage the information security program
Regularly review and update the role and responsibilities as necessary to align with changes in the organization's mission, strategic goals, or risk environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a senior official has been formally assigned the role of leading the information security program. They will also evaluate whether the official has the necessary resources to effectively manage the program and whether the role and responsibilities are regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Information Security and Privacy Resources
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that sufficient resources are provided to adequately support the organization's information security and privacy program. This is important for security and compliance as it ensures that the organization has the necessary resources to protect its information systems and data.
description: This control requires organizations to establish, maintain, and resource a plan that manages information security and privacy within the organization. The plan should include budgeting, personnel, training, and the necessary tools and equipment.
implementation_guidance: Identify Needs:** Determine the resources needed to support the organization's information security and privacy program. This could include personnel, training, tools, and equipment
Develop a Plan:** Create a detailed plan that outlines how the organization will provide the necessary resources. This plan should include a budget and a timeline for resource allocation
Implement the Plan:** Allocate the resources as outlined in the plan. This could involve hiring personnel, purchasing equipment, or providing training

Monitor and Update the Plan:** Regularly review the plan to ensure it is still meeting the organization's needs. Update the plan as necessary to reflect changes in the organization's information security and privacy program
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a plan in place for managing information security and privacy resources. They will also look for evidence that the plan is being implemented and regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Plan of Action and Milestones Process
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a systematic process in place to identify, prioritize, and monitor the progress of resolving weaknesses or deficiencies in their information systems and security programs. This is crucial for maintaining a robust security posture and achieving compliance.
description: This control requires organizations to implement a process for ensuring the development, documentation, and updating of a Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M) for the information system to address any weaknesses or deficiencies noted during the assessment of security controls.
implementation_guidance: Develop a formal process for creating and managing the POA&M. This process should include identifying and documenting system vulnerabilities, deficiencies, or weaknesses
Prioritize the identified issues based on their potential impact on the system and the organization
Develop a plan to address each identified issue. This plan should include specific actions, resources required, and a timeline for completion
Document the POA&M and ensure it is accessible to relevant stakeholders
Regularly review and update the POA&M, tracking progress towards resolving identified issues and making adjustments as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will evaluate whether the organization has a formal POA&M process in place, whether this process is being followed, and whether the POA&M is regularly reviewed and updated. They will also look at how issues are prioritized and whether plans for addressing them are realistic and effective.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods. The "Examine" method can be used to review the documented POA&M process and the actual POA&M. The "Interview" method can be used to discuss the process with relevant personnel and understand how it is implemented in practice. The "Test" method can be used to evaluate the effectiveness of the process by looking at how well identified issues are being resolved.

title: System Inventory
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization develops and maintains an inventory of its information systems. This is important for security and compliance as it allows the organization to have a clear understanding of its assets, which is crucial for effective risk management and incident response.
description: This control requires the organization to develop and keep an updated inventory of its information systems. The inventory should include a description of the system, its interfaces, and its security impact level.
implementation_guidance: Identify all information systems within the organization. This includes both internal systems and those provided by external service providers
For each system, document its purpose, owner, operator, and location, as well as its environment of operation
Identify and document all interfaces between systems
Determine and document the security impact level of each system based on the potential impact of a security breach
Develop a process for regularly updating the system inventory as new systems are added, existing systems are modified, or systems are retired
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a complete and accurate inventory of its information systems. They will also check that the inventory includes all required information and that it is regularly updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through examination of the system inventory and related documentation. Interviews with relevant personnel can be used to confirm that the inventory is regularly updated and that it is used in the organization's risk management and incident response processes. Testing may involve a sample check of systems in the inventory to verify the accuracy of the recorded information.

title: Measures of Performance
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish and make use of performance measures to evaluate the effectiveness of their security controls and programs. This is crucial for maintaining a robust security posture and ensuring compliance with security requirements.
description: This control requires organizations to establish, monitor, and analyze performance measures on the effectiveness of the information security program, security controls, and information resources.
implementation_guidance: Identify Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):** Identify the KPIs that will be used to measure the effectiveness of the security program and controls. These may include metrics like the number of security incidents, response times, or patch management efficiency
Establish Baselines:** Establish baseline measurements for each KPI. This will provide a reference point for evaluating performance over time
Monitor Performance:** Regularly monitor and record performance data for each KPI
Analyze Performance:** Analyze the collected data to evaluate the effectiveness of the security program and controls. Look for trends, anomalies, or areas of concern
Review and Adjust:** Based on the analysis, review and adjust the security program and controls as necessary to improve performance
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has established performance measures, is regularly monitoring and recording performance data, and is using this data to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of the security program and controls.

title: Enterprise Architecture
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization develops and maintains an enterprise architecture that accurately reflects the operational environment, including the security components. This is important for security and compliance as it helps in identifying and managing risks, aligning IT with business objectives, and ensuring that security controls are effectively integrated into the system.
description: This control requires the organization to develop an enterprise architecture with consideration to information security and the resulting risk to organizational operations, organizational assets, individuals, and the Nation.
implementation_guidance: Identify and Document Current Architecture:** Start by identifying and documenting the current state of your organization's architecture. This includes all systems, applications, data, technologies, and infrastructure

Develop Future State Architecture:** Define the future state of the enterprise architecture that aligns with the organization's strategic goals and objectives. This should include the desired security posture and risk tolerance
Identify Gaps:** Compare the current and future state architectures to identify gaps. This includes missing or inadequate security controls

Develop Transition Plan:** Develop a plan to transition from the current to the future state architecture. This should include steps to address identified gaps and integrate necessary security controls
Implement Transition Plan:** Implement the transition plan, ensuring that all changes are properly managed and documented

Maintain and Update Architecture:** Regularly review and update the enterprise architecture to reflect changes in the operational environment, technology, business objectives, and security requirements
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a documented enterprise architecture, that it reflects the operational environment and includes security components, and that it is regularly reviewed and updated. They will also look for evidence that the organization has a plan for transitioning to the future state architecture and that this plan is being implemented.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Critical Infrastructure Plan
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization establishes and implements a plan for managing risks to critical infrastructure services. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to maintain the continuity of operations and services, even in the event of a security incident or disaster.
description: This control requires the organization to develop, document, periodically update, and implement a plan for managing risks to the achievement of objectives related to the use of critical infrastructure services.
implementation_guidance: Identify and document the critical infrastructure services that the organization relies on
Conduct a risk assessment to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities to these services

Develop a plan that outlines how the organization will manage these risks. This should include strategies for mitigating risks, as well as contingency plans for maintaining operations in the event of a disruption to these services
Implement the plan, ensuring that all relevant personnel are aware of their roles and responsibilities
Regularly review and update the plan to ensure it remains effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified its critical infrastructure services, conducted a risk assessment, developed and implemented a risk management plan, and regularly reviews and updates this plan.

title: Risk Management Strategy
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish and implement a risk management strategy that is consistent with their mission, objectives, and risk tolerance. This strategy is crucial in identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks that could potentially impact the organization's information systems and operations.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, implement, and periodically update a comprehensive risk management strategy. The strategy should include risk assessment, risk mitigation, and the roles and responsibilities of individuals involved in the risk management process.
implementation_guidance: Develop a risk management strategy that aligns with the organization's mission and objectives. The strategy should define the organization's risk tolerance and approach to risk management
Identify the roles and responsibilities of individuals involved in the risk management process. This includes risk assessors, risk managers, and decision-makers
Implement the risk management strategy across the organization. This involves conducting risk assessments, implementing risk mitigation measures, and monitoring the effectiveness of these measures

Review and update the risk management strategy periodically to ensure it remains effective and relevant. This should be done at least annually or whenever significant changes occur in the organization's environment or operations
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a comprehensive risk management strategy in place. They will also evaluate whether this strategy is implemented effectively across the organization and is reviewed and updated periodically.

title: Authorization Process
purpose: The purpose of this control is to establish and manage the authorization process for information systems, ensuring that they meet the necessary security requirements before they are approved for operation. This is crucial for maintaining the security and integrity of an organization's information systems.
description: This control requires organizations to develop and implement a process that authorizes the operation of information systems and system connections. This process should be consistent with the risk management strategy and should be approved by the organization's senior management.
implementation_guidance: Define the Authorization Process:** Develop a clear and comprehensive process for authorizing the operation of information systems. This process should include steps for risk assessment, security control selection, and security control implementation

Align with Risk Management Strategy:** Ensure that the authorization process aligns with the organization's risk management strategy. This includes considering the organization's risk tolerance and the potential impact of system operation on organizational operations and assets

Senior Management Approval:** The authorization process should be approved by the organization's senior management. This ensures that the process aligns with the organization's strategic objectives and has the necessary support for effective implementation

Implement the Authorization Process:** Apply the authorization process consistently across all information systems and system connections. This includes documenting the results of the authorization process and maintaining a record of all authorized systems
assessment_objectives: Assessors will evaluate whether the organization has a well-defined and implemented authorization process. They will also check if the process aligns with the organization's risk management strategy and has been approved by senior management.

title: Mission and Business Process Definition
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's mission, information types processed, stored, and transmitted by the system, and the business processes the system supports are clearly defined. This is important for security and compliance as it helps in understanding the system's context, which is crucial in identifying and implementing appropriate security controls.
description: This control requires the organization to define mission, information types, and business processes. It also requires the organization to determine system boundaries and document them in the System Security Plan (SSP).
implementation_guidance: Identify and document the organization's mission and the business processes that the system supports
Identify and document the types of information that the system processes, stores, and transmits
Determine and document the system boundaries, including all components and connections
Incorporate this information into the System Security Plan (SSP)
Review and update this information regularly, or whenever significant changes occur
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has clearly defined its mission, business processes, and information types. They will also verify that the system boundaries have been determined and documented in the SSP.

title: Insider Threat Program
purpose: The purpose of this control is to establish a program to detect, prevent, and mitigate the risks posed by insider threats. Insider threats can come from employees, contractors, or anyone else with inside access to the organization's systems and data, and can pose significant security risks.
description: This control requires the organization to implement a formal insider threat program. The program should include a cross-organizational team, a formal process for responding to insider threats, and training and awareness activities to educate employees about insider threats.
implementation_guidance: Establish a cross-organizational team responsible for the insider threat program. This team should include representatives from HR, IT, legal, and security departments

Develop a formal process for identifying and responding to potential insider threats. This process should include steps for reporting suspected insider threats, investigating potential threats, and taking appropriate action

Implement training and awareness activities to educate employees about insider threats. This should include information about what constitutes an insider threat, how to recognize potential threats, and how to report suspected threats
Regularly review and update the insider threat program to ensure it remains effective and up-to-date
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a formal insider threat program in place. They will also look for evidence that the program includes a cross-organizational team, a formal response process, and training and awareness activities.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. For example, assessors might examine documentation related to the insider threat program, interview members of the insider threat team, and test the organization's response process by simulating a potential insider threat.

title: Security and Privacy Workforce
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization maintains a workforce with the necessary knowledge, skills, and abilities to carry out its information security program effectively. This is crucial for security and compliance as it helps to prevent security breaches and ensures that the organization is prepared to respond effectively if a breach does occur.
description: This control requires the organization to establish, implement, and maintain an information security workforce development and improvement program. The program should include role-based security training and continuous learning activities.
implementation_guidance: Identify the roles within the organization that have significant security responsibilities
Define the knowledge, skills, and abilities required for each of these roles
Develop a training program that provides the necessary education and training for each role
Implement the training program, ensuring that all relevant staff members participate
Establish a process for continuous learning and improvement, including regular updates to the training program as necessary
Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of the training program and make improvements as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a well-defined and implemented information security workforce development and improvement program. They will also look for evidence that the organization is continuously improving its program and that all relevant staff members are participating in the program.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. For example, assessors might examine training records and program documentation, interview staff members and management, and test the knowledge and skills of staff members.

title: Testing, Training, and Monitoring
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a systematic approach to testing, training, and monitoring their security controls. This is crucial for maintaining a robust security posture and ensuring ongoing compliance with security requirements.
description: This control requires organizations to implement a program for testing, training, and monitoring the security controls in their information systems. The program should include regular assessments, training for personnel, and continuous monitoring to identify and address security vulnerabilities.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive program that outlines the procedures for testing, training, and monitoring security controls
Conduct regular security control assessments to identify vulnerabilities and ensure controls are functioning as intended
Implement a training program to ensure personnel are aware of security requirements and their roles in maintaining security
Establish a continuous monitoring program to track the effectiveness of security controls over time and identify any changes that could impact security
Document the testing, training, and monitoring program in the System Security Plan (SSP) and update it regularly to reflect changes in the security environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a systematic approach to testing, training, and monitoring security controls. They will evaluate the comprehensiveness of the program, the regularity of assessments, the effectiveness of training, and the robustness of the monitoring procedures.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Security and Privacy Groups and Associations
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations are actively participating in security and privacy groups and associations to stay informed about the latest trends, threats, and best practices in information security and privacy. This helps the organization to continually improve its security posture and compliance efforts.
description: This control requires organizations to actively participate in security and privacy groups and associations. The organization must also share information about effective security and privacy practices.
implementation_guidance: Identify relevant security and privacy groups and associations. These could be industry-specific or general information security and privacy groups
Assign a representative or team to participate in these groups and associations. This could be a security officer, privacy officer, or other appropriate personnel
Ensure the representative or team actively participates in meetings, discussions, and other activities of the groups and associations
Set up a process for the representative or team to share relevant information and insights gained from these groups with the rest of the organization
Document the organization's participation in these groups and associations, including the information shared and actions taken as a result
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization is actively participating in security and privacy groups and associations. They will also look for evidence that the organization is sharing information and insights gained from these groups with the rest of the organization.

title: Threat Awareness Program
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a systematic approach to make their personnel aware of threats to their information systems and the measures to counteract these threats. This is crucial for maintaining the security and integrity of the organization's information systems.
description: The control requires organizations to implement a threat awareness program that includes a cross-organization information sharing capability. This program should be designed to make personnel aware of the threats to the organization's information systems and the measures to counteract these threats.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive threat awareness program that includes information sharing capabilities across the organization
Identify key personnel who will be responsible for managing and implementing the threat awareness program
Provide regular training and updates to all personnel about the latest threats to the organization's information systems and the measures to counteract these threats
Establish a process for personnel to report potential threats and for these reports to be analyzed and addressed
Regularly review and update the threat awareness program to ensure it remains effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a comprehensive threat awareness program in place. They will also look for evidence that personnel are regularly trained and updated on threats and countermeasures, and that there is a process for reporting and addressing potential threats.

title: Protecting Controlled Unclassified Information on External Systems
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) is adequately protected when it is processed, stored, or transmitted on external systems. This is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction of sensitive information.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and implement procedures to protect CUI on external systems. It involves the identification of CUI, the application of appropriate safeguards, and the monitoring of these safeguards to ensure their effectiveness.
implementation_guidance: Identify CUI:** Determine what information qualifies as CUI within your organization. This could include proprietary information, personal data, or other sensitive information
Define Protection Measures:** Establish procedures for protecting CUI on external systems. This could involve encryption, access controls, or other security measures
Implement Safeguards:** Apply the defined protection measures to all identified CUI on external systems
Monitor Effectiveness:** Regularly monitor and review the effectiveness of the implemented safeguards. Adjust as necessary to maintain adequate protection
Train Staff:** Ensure all relevant staff members are trained on the procedures for protecting CUI on external systems
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified CUI, established procedures for its protection on external systems, implemented these procedures, and is monitoring their effectiveness. They will also look for evidence of staff training on these procedures.

title: Privacy Program Plan
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive privacy program that complies with all applicable laws, regulations, and policies. This is crucial for protecting individuals' privacy rights and interests, and for maintaining public trust.
description: This control requires organizations to develop and implement a privacy program plan. The plan should describe how the organization's privacy controls are implemented and how they comply with applicable laws, regulations, and policies.
implementation_guidance: Identify Privacy Requirements:** Identify all applicable privacy laws, regulations, and policies that your organization must comply with

Develop Privacy Program Plan:** Develop a comprehensive plan that describes how your organization implements its privacy controls. The plan should include details about the roles and responsibilities of personnel, training and awareness programs, risk management strategies, incident response procedures, and how privacy impact assessments are conducted

Implement Privacy Program Plan:** Implement the plan across your organization. This may involve training staff, updating policies and procedures, and integrating privacy controls into your organization's operations
Maintain and Update Plan:** Regularly review and update the plan to ensure it remains effective and compliant with any changes in laws, regulations, or policies
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a comprehensive privacy program plan in place. They will evaluate whether the plan is implemented effectively and whether it complies with all applicable laws, regulations, and policies.

title: Privacy Program Leadership Role
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization has a designated senior official who is responsible for the development, implementation, and oversight of privacy-related policies and procedures. This is important for security and compliance as it ensures accountability and effective management of privacy risks.
description: This control requires organizations to assign a senior official with the responsibility of leading the privacy program. This official is tasked with developing, implementing, and maintaining privacy policies and procedures.
implementation_guidance: Identify a senior official within the organization who will take on the role of privacy program leader
Clearly define the responsibilities of the privacy program leader. This should include the development, implementation, and maintenance of privacy policies and procedures

Provide the necessary resources and support to the privacy program leader to fulfill their role effectively. This may include training, access to relevant information, and a dedicated team if necessary
Document the appointment of the privacy program leader and their responsibilities. This documentation should be made available to all relevant personnel within the organization
Regularly review and update the role and responsibilities of the privacy program leader to ensure they remain relevant and effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a senior official has been designated as the privacy program leader and that they have been given the necessary resources to fulfill their role. They will also look for documentation of the privacy program leader's responsibilities and evidence that these responsibilities are being fulfilled.

title: Dissemination of Privacy Program Information
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations effectively communicate their privacy program information to all personnel and other relevant individuals. This is crucial for security and compliance as it helps to ensure that everyone understands their responsibilities regarding privacy and can act in accordance with the organization's policies and procedures.
description: This control requires organizations to disseminate privacy program information to all personnel and other relevant individuals. The information should include privacy responsibilities, procedures, measures, and compliance requirements.
implementation_guidance: Identify all relevant individuals who need to be aware of the privacy program information. This typically includes all personnel and may also include contractors, partners, and customers
Develop clear and concise privacy program information that includes privacy responsibilities, procedures, measures, and compliance requirements
Establish a method for disseminating this information. This could be through email, internal websites, training sessions, or other communication channels
Regularly update and disseminate the privacy program information, especially when there are changes to privacy policies, procedures, or compliance requirements
Monitor and verify that the information has been received and understood by all relevant individuals
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that privacy program information has been developed and disseminated to all relevant individuals. They will also look for evidence that the information is regularly updated and that its receipt and understanding are monitored and verified.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Accounting of Disclosures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations maintain a comprehensive record of all disclosures of information, including the reasons for such disclosures. This is important for security and compliance as it helps organizations track and manage the flow of sensitive information, thereby reducing the risk of unauthorized access or data breaches.
description: This control requires organizations to keep an accurate account of all instances where information is disclosed outside of the organization. This includes the date, nature, and purpose of each disclosure, as well as the identity of the recipient.
implementation_guidance: Develop and implement a policy that requires the recording of all disclosures of information
Establish a system or process for recording the details of each disclosure, including the date, nature, purpose, and recipient
Train all staff on the policy and the process for recording disclosures
Regularly review and update the record of disclosures to ensure its accuracy and completeness
Implement controls to protect the record of disclosures from unauthorized access or alteration
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a policy and a system in place for recording disclosures, that staff are trained on these, and that the record of disclosures is regularly reviewed and protected.

title: Personally Identifiable Information Quality Management
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure the accuracy, relevance, timeliness, and completeness of personally identifiable information (PII) to prevent misuse, unauthorized access, and data breaches. It is crucial for maintaining privacy, trust, and compliance with laws and regulations.
description: This control requires organizations to implement policies and procedures that manage the quality of PII throughout its life cycle. It includes the collection, use, retention, and disposal of PII, ensuring it is accurate, relevant, timely, and complete.
implementation_guidance: Develop and implement a PII quality management policy that outlines the organization's commitment to maintaining the quality of PII
Establish procedures to ensure the accuracy, relevance, timeliness, and completeness of PII at the point of collection and throughout its life cycle
Implement mechanisms to validate and update PII regularly
Train staff on the importance of PII quality management and the procedures to follow
Regularly review and update the PII quality management policy and procedures to ensure they remain effective and compliant with any changes in laws and regulations
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence of a PII quality management policy, procedures for maintaining PII quality, mechanisms for validating and updating PII, and training records. They will also check that the policy and procedures are reviewed and updated regularly.

title: Data Governance Body
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization has a formal body in place to oversee the management, use, protection, and dissemination of data across the organization. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to ensure that data is handled in a consistent and secure manner, reducing the risk of data breaches and non-compliance with data protection regulations.
description: This control requires the organization to establish a data governance body that is responsible for the development and implementation of policies and procedures related to data management. This body should also oversee the organization's data-related activities to ensure compliance with these policies and procedures.
implementation_guidance: Establish a data governance body: This body should include representatives from various departments within the organization, such as IT, legal, and business operations

Define the roles and responsibilities of the data governance body: This should include the development and implementation of data management policies and procedures, as well as oversight of data-related activities
Develop data management policies and procedures: These should cover all aspects of data management, including data collection, storage, use, sharing, and disposal
Implement the data management policies and procedures: Ensure that these policies and procedures are followed across the organization
Monitor compliance: The data governance body should regularly review data-related activities to ensure compliance with the data management policies and procedures
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a data governance body has been established, that it has clearly defined roles and responsibilities, and that it is actively overseeing data-related activities. They will also look for evidence that data management policies and procedures have been developed and implemented, and that compliance with these policies and procedures is being monitored.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and test methods. For example, assessors might examine the organization's documentation of the data governance body and its activities, interview members of the data governance body, and test the organization's compliance with its data management policies and procedures.

title: Data Integrity Board
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization maintains a high level of integrity in its data management practices. It is important for security and compliance because it helps prevent unauthorized data modification, deletion, or fabrication, which could lead to inaccurate decision-making, financial loss, or damage to the organization's reputation.
description: This control requires the organization to establish and maintain a Data Integrity Board. The board is responsible for reviewing and approving data integrity and data sharing practices within the organization, ensuring compliance with federal regulations and organizational policies.
implementation_guidance: Establish a Data Integrity Board comprising members with knowledge in data management, security, and compliance
Define the roles and responsibilities of the board, including reviewing and approving data integrity practices and data sharing agreements
Develop and implement a process for the board to regularly review data integrity practices and data sharing agreements
Ensure the board is aware of and complies with all relevant federal regulations and organizational policies
Document all board activities, decisions, and approvals for audit and review purposes
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a Data Integrity Board has been established, that it has clearly defined roles and responsibilities, and that it regularly reviews and approves data integrity practices and data sharing agreements. They will also check that the board's activities are documented and that it complies with relevant regulations and policies.

title: Minimization of Personally Identifiable Information Used in Testing, Training, and Research
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization minimizes the use of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) for testing, training, and research purposes. This is important for security and compliance as it reduces the risk of unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive personal data.
description: This control requires organizations to implement measures that limit the use of PII in testing, training, and research environments. It mandates that organizations should only use PII when there are no viable alternatives and that the data should be anonymized or de-identified wherever possible.
implementation_guidance: Identify and Classify PII:** Identify all PII used in testing, training, and research. Classify the data based on sensitivity and necessity for the task
Evaluate Alternatives:** Evaluate if there are any alternatives to using PII. If alternatives exist, use them instead of PII
Anonymize or De-identify PII:** If PII must be used, ensure that it is anonymized or de-identified to the maximum extent possible
Implement Access Controls:** Implement strict access controls to limit who can access the PII. This should include both physical and digital access controls
Monitor and Audit:** Regularly monitor and audit the use of PII in testing, training, and research to ensure compliance with this control
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented measures to minimize the use of PII in testing, training, and research. They will also evaluate the effectiveness of these measures.

title: Complaint Management
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization has a formal process in place to handle complaints regarding its information security practices. This is important for security and compliance because it helps identify potential weaknesses in the system, promotes transparency, and fosters trust among stakeholders.
description: This control requires the organization to establish and implement a process for receiving, tracking, and resolving complaints about the organization's information security practices.
implementation_guidance: Establish a Complaint Management Process:** Develop a formal process for receiving, tracking, and resolving complaints about the organization's information security practices. This process should be clear, accessible, and easy to use

Communicate the Process:** Make sure all stakeholders, including employees, customers, and partners, are aware of the complaint management process. This could be done through training sessions, newsletters, or a dedicated section on the organization's website
Track Complaints:** Implement a system for tracking all received complaints, their status, and resolution. This could be a simple spreadsheet or a dedicated complaint management software
Resolve Complaints:** Assign responsibility to specific individuals or teams for resolving complaints. Ensure they have the necessary authority and resources to address the issues raised
Review and Improve:** Regularly review the complaint management process and make necessary improvements based on feedback and lessons learned from resolved complaints
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a formal complaint management process is in place and is being followed. They will also check that complaints are being tracked and resolved in a timely manner, and that the process is regularly reviewed and improved.

title: Privacy Reporting
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a systematic approach to reporting privacy-related incidents. This is important for security and compliance as it helps organizations to identify, respond to, and mitigate potential risks to personal privacy.
description: PM-27 requires organizations to develop and implement procedures for reporting privacy-related incidents. This includes the identification, documentation, and reporting of such incidents to appropriate internal and external entities.
implementation_guidance: Develop a privacy incident response plan that includes procedures for identifying, documenting, and reporting privacy-related incidents
Ensure that all employees are aware of and understand these procedures. This may involve training or awareness programs
Establish a system for tracking and documenting privacy-related incidents. This could be a database or a dedicated incident management system

Define the roles and responsibilities of individuals involved in the incident response process. This includes who is responsible for reporting incidents, who they should be reported to, and who is responsible for responding to incidents
Regularly review and update the incident response plan and procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a well-defined process for reporting privacy-related incidents. They will also look for evidence that this process is being followed, such as records of reported incidents and actions taken in response.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Risk Framing
purpose: The purpose of this control is to establish the context for risk-based decisions within the organization and to ensure that the organization's risk tolerance is clearly defined and communicated. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to guide the organization's risk management strategy and decision-making processes.
description: This control requires the organization to establish and implement a risk frame. The risk frame provides the context for making risk-based decisions, including the identification of assumptions, constraints, risk tolerances, and priorities.
implementation_guidance: Identify and document the organization's risk tolerance, including any assumptions and constraints
Establish a risk frame that includes the organization's risk tolerance, priorities, and the context for making risk-based decisions
Communicate the risk frame to all relevant stakeholders within the organization
Implement the risk frame into the organization's risk management strategy and decision-making processes
Regularly review and update the risk frame to ensure it remains relevant and effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has established a risk frame and that this frame is being used to guide risk-based decisions. They will also look for evidence that the risk frame has been communicated to relevant stakeholders and is regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. For example, assessors might examine the organization's documentation of its risk frame, interview key stakeholders about the risk frame and its use in decision-making, and test the effectiveness of the risk frame by reviewing specific risk-based decisions made by the organization.

title: Risk Management Program Leadership Roles
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's risk management program is led by competent individuals who can effectively manage and mitigate security risks. This is crucial for maintaining the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of the organization's information systems and data.
description: This control requires the organization to assign risk management program leadership roles to individuals who are responsible for implementing and managing the risk management program. These individuals should have the necessary authority, knowledge, skills, and experience to perform their duties effectively.
implementation_guidance: Identify key roles and responsibilities related to the risk management program
Assign these roles to individuals who have the necessary qualifications and experience
Provide these individuals with the necessary authority to implement, manage, and oversee the risk management program
Ensure that these individuals receive appropriate training and support to perform their duties effectively
Regularly review and update the risk management program and the roles and responsibilities of its leaders
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has assigned risk management program leadership roles to qualified individuals, and that these individuals have the necessary authority to perform their duties. They will also look for evidence that the organization provides ongoing training and support to these individuals.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examine, interview, and test methods. For example, assessors may examine documentation outlining the risk management program and the roles and responsibilities of its leaders, interview these leaders to assess their understanding of their roles and responsibilities, and test the effectiveness of the risk management program.

title: Supply Chain Risk Management Strategy
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization has a strategy in place to manage the risks associated with its supply chain. This is crucial for security and compliance as vulnerabilities in the supply chain can lead to security breaches, data loss, and non-compliance with regulations.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, document, and implement a supply chain risk management strategy. The strategy should be aligned with the organization's risk management strategy and should include identification, assessment, and mitigation of supply chain risks.
implementation_guidance: Identify Supply Chain Risks:** Identify all potential risks in your supply chain, including risks associated with suppliers, products, services, and delivery mechanisms
Assess Risks:** Assess the identified risks based on their potential impact on your organization's operations and security posture
Develop a Strategy:** Based on the risk assessment, develop a supply chain risk management strategy. This strategy should outline how you plan to mitigate, transfer, accept, or avoid these risks
Document the Strategy:** Document your supply chain risk management strategy in a formal, written document
Implement the Strategy:** Implement the strategy across your organization. This may involve training staff, implementing new processes, or changing suppliers
Monitor and Update the Strategy:** Regularly monitor the effectiveness of your strategy and update it as necessary to respond to changes in your supply chain or risk environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a documented supply chain risk management strategy, that the strategy is aligned with the organization's risk management strategy, and that the strategy is being effectively implemented and monitored.

title: Continuous Monitoring Strategy
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish and implement a continuous monitoring strategy to track and maintain the security posture of their information systems. This is crucial for security and compliance as it allows for timely detection and response to potential security threats and vulnerabilities.
description: This control requires organizations to develop a continuous monitoring strategy that includes a configuration management process for the information system and its hosted components. The strategy should also include ongoing security control assessments and status reporting.
implementation_guidance: Develop a Continuous Monitoring Strategy:** The organization should first establish a strategy that outlines the frequency and nature of system monitoring, including what will be monitored, how often, and by whom

Establish Configuration Management Process:** The strategy should include a process for managing the configuration of the information system and its components. This includes tracking changes, assessing the impact of changes, and approving or disapproving changes based on their potential impact on security

Conduct Ongoing Security Control Assessments:** The strategy should also include regular assessments of security controls to ensure they are functioning as intended and to identify any potential vulnerabilities or weaknesses
Implement Status Reporting:** The organization should establish a process for reporting the status of the security controls and any identified vulnerabilities to appropriate personnel
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a continuous monitoring strategy in place, that it includes a configuration management process, ongoing security control assessments, and status reporting. They will also evaluate the effectiveness of these processes in maintaining the security of the information system.

title: Purposing
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization defines and documents the purpose for all systems, components, or services before they are deployed. This is important for security and compliance because it helps to ensure that each system or component is used as intended, reducing the risk of misuse or exploitation.
description: This control requires the organization to define and document the purpose of all systems, components, or services before they are deployed. The documentation should include a clear description of the intended use and the security requirements for each system or component.
implementation_guidance: Identify all systems, components, or services that are to be deployed
Define the purpose of each system, component, or service. This should include a description of the intended use and the security requirements
Document the purpose of each system, component, or service. This documentation should be maintained and updated as necessary
Ensure that all relevant personnel are aware of the purpose of each system, component, or service and understand the associated security requirements
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has defined and documented the purpose of all systems, components, or services before they are deployed. They will also look for evidence that this documentation is maintained and updated as necessary, and that all relevant personnel are aware of the purpose of each system, component, or service and understand the associated security requirements.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and test methods. For example, assessors might examine the documentation to verify that the purpose of each system, component, or service has been defined and documented. They might also interview relevant personnel to verify that they are aware of the purpose of each system, component, or service and understand the associated security requirements. Finally, they might test the system, component, or service to verify that it is being used as intended.

title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish, document, and disseminate policies and procedures that outline security requirements for personnel during all phases of their employment lifecycle. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to mitigate risks associated with insider threats, unauthorized access, and data breaches.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive set of personnel security policies and procedures. These documents should cover all aspects of personnel security, including hiring, training, access control, and termination procedures.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive set of personnel security policies and procedures. These should cover all phases of the employment lifecycle, from hiring and onboarding to termination and offboarding
Ensure that these policies and procedures are consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and standards
Disseminate these policies and procedures to all personnel. This could be done through training sessions, email communications, or an internal website
Regularly review and update these policies and procedures to ensure they remain relevant and effective
Monitor compliance with these policies and procedures and take corrective action when necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has developed and implemented personnel security policies and procedures. They will also look for evidence that these policies and procedures are being followed and that they are regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance with this control can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. For example, assessors might examine the organization's personnel security policies and procedures, interview personnel to determine their awareness and understanding of these policies and procedures, and test the organization's compliance monitoring and enforcement mechanisms.

title: Position Risk Designation
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations assign a risk designation to all positions and establish screening criteria for individuals filling those positions. This helps to mitigate the risk of unauthorized access, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction of the organization's information systems.
description: This control requires organizations to designate a risk level for all positions within the organization that have access to the information system. The risk designation should be consistent with the potential impact and harm that could be caused by the individual in that position.
implementation_guidance: Identify all positions within the organization that have access to the information system
For each position, determine the potential impact and harm that could be caused by the individual in that position
Assign a risk designation (e.g., low, moderate, high) to each position based on the potential impact and harm
Establish screening criteria for each position based on its risk designation. This could include background checks, security clearances, etc
Document the risk designation and screening criteria for each position
Regularly review and update the risk designations and screening criteria as necessary
