assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all positions with access to the information system, assigned a risk designation to each position, and established appropriate screening criteria. They will also check that the risk designations and screening criteria are documented and regularly reviewed.

title: Personnel Screening
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that individuals who are granted access to organizational systems and data are trustworthy and meet established security criteria. This is important to prevent unauthorized access, data breaches, and potential damage to the organization's reputation.
description: This control requires organizations to conduct appropriate screening of individuals prior to authorizing access to the system and its data. The level of screening should be in line with the risk to operations, assets, or individuals.
implementation_guidance: Define Screening Criteria:** Establish criteria for personnel screening that aligns with the risk associated with the roles and responsibilities of the individuals

Conduct Background Checks:** Perform background checks on individuals before granting them access to the system. This may include criminal history checks, verification of previous employment, and reference checks
Implement Screening Procedures:** Develop and implement procedures to ensure that screening is carried out consistently and effectively
Document Screening Results:** Maintain records of the screening process and results for each individual
Review and Update Screening Procedures:** Regularly review and update the screening procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has established and implemented effective personnel screening procedures. They will also verify that the organization maintains records of the screening process and results.

title: Personnel Termination
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that an organization's information and systems remain secure when an employee leaves the organization. It helps to prevent unauthorized access and potential misuse of information by former employees.
description: This control requires the organization to implement formal termination procedures when an employee leaves the organization. These procedures include the return of organizational property and the termination of access rights.
implementation_guidance: Develop a formal personnel termination policy that outlines the steps to be taken when an employee leaves the organization
Ensure that the policy includes provisions for the return of all organizational property and the termination of all access rights
Implement a process for notifying the appropriate personnel (e.g., IT department, security team) when an employee is leaving the organization
Regularly review and update the termination policy to ensure it remains effective and relevant
Train all employees on the termination policy so they understand their responsibilities when they leave the organization
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a formal termination policy in place and that it is being effectively implemented. They will also look for evidence that the organization is effectively terminating access rights and retrieving organizational property when an employee leaves.

title: Personnel Transfer
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's information system security risks are managed effectively when personnel are transferred or terminated. It is important for security and compliance because it helps prevent unauthorized access to sensitive information by individuals who no longer require access due to a change in job role or employment status.
description: This control requires organizations to review and revise system access permissions when an individual is transferred or terminated. It ensures that the organization promptly removes or alters access rights to prevent potential security breaches.
implementation_guidance: Develop and implement a formal process for managing personnel transfers and terminations. This process should include steps for reviewing and revising system access permissions
When an individual is transferred or terminated, promptly review their access permissions. Determine whether they should retain, lose, or have their access permissions altered
If necessary, revise the individual's access permissions. This could involve removing their access, reducing their access, or granting them additional access, depending on their new role

Document all changes made to access permissions as a result of personnel transfers or terminations. This documentation should include the date of the change, the individual involved, and the reason for the change
Regularly review and update the personnel transfer and termination process to ensure it remains effective and compliant with current security standards
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a formal process for managing personnel transfers and terminations, and that this process includes steps for reviewing and revising system access permissions. They will also look for documentation showing that this process has been followed when individuals have been transferred or terminated.

title: Access Agreements
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that all individuals with access to the system understand their roles and responsibilities, and are aware of the rules regarding appropriate use and protection of the information within the system. This is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access, misuse of information, and potential breaches.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and maintain access agreements for organizational information systems. These agreements should be signed by the individuals granted access to the system, acknowledging their understanding of the security rules, responsibilities, and expected behavior.
implementation_guidance: Develop a standard access agreement that outlines the rules of behavior, responsibilities, and expected use of the system. This should include details on data protection, privacy, and consequences of misuse
Ensure the access agreement is reviewed and updated regularly to reflect changes in policies, regulations, or system operations

Establish a process for individuals to review and sign the access agreement before they are granted access to the system. This could be part of the onboarding process for new employees or a prerequisite for system access for existing employees
Maintain records of all signed access agreements and ensure they are readily available for review and audit purposes
Regularly remind individuals of their responsibilities and the rules outlined in the access agreement, especially when there are updates or changes
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that access agreements are in place, regularly reviewed and updated, and signed by all individuals with access to the system. They will also check that the organization has a process for managing these agreements and that records are properly maintained.

title: External Personnel Security
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations apply the same personnel security policies and procedures to external personnel (contractors, vendors, etc.) as they do to their own employees. This is important to maintain a consistent level of security across all personnel and prevent potential vulnerabilities that could be exploited by malicious actors.
description: This control requires organizations to implement personnel security requirements for external personnel who have access to the organization's systems and data. This includes validating security clearances, conducting background checks, and ensuring that external personnel understand their security responsibilities.
implementation_guidance: Develop and document a policy that outlines the security requirements for external personnel
Ensure that the policy includes procedures for validating security clearances and conducting background checks
Create a process for informing external personnel of their security responsibilities and the consequences of non-compliance
Implement a system for tracking and managing the security status of external personnel
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a documented policy for external personnel security, that the policy is being effectively implemented, and that external personnel are aware of their security responsibilities.

title: Personnel Sanctions
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that appropriate sanctions are applied to personnel failing to comply with established information security policies and procedures. This is important for security and compliance as it discourages negligent or malicious activities and promotes a culture of security awareness within the organization.
description: This control requires organizations to employ a formal sanctions process for personnel who have violated information security policies and procedures. The process should be consistent and fair, ensuring that all personnel are held accountable for their actions.
implementation_guidance: Develop a formal sanctions policy that clearly outlines the consequences of violating information security policies and procedures. This policy should be proportionate, consistent, and fair
Communicate the sanctions policy to all personnel. This could be done through training, newsletters, or staff meetings
Establish a process for identifying and reporting security violations. This could involve regular audits, incident reporting systems, or whistleblower programs
Implement a process for investigating reported violations. This should be impartial and thorough, ensuring that all relevant facts are considered
Apply sanctions in accordance with the policy when a violation is confirmed. This could range from verbal warnings to termination, depending on the severity of the violation
Document all violations and sanctions. This record can be used to demonstrate compliance and to identify patterns or trends that may indicate a need for further training or policy adjustments
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a formal sanctions policy, that this policy has been communicated to all personnel, and that the policy is being consistently applied. They will also look for documentation of violations and sanctions.

title: Position Descriptions
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization defines and documents the roles, responsibilities, and competencies required for each position that affects the security of the system. This is important for security and compliance as it helps in identifying the necessary security controls and training required for each position.
description: This control requires the organization to document the roles, responsibilities, and competencies for each position affecting the system's security. It also requires the organization to assign the security roles and responsibilities to individuals or groups.
implementation_guidance: Identify all positions within the organization that have a role in the security of the system
For each identified position, define and document the roles, responsibilities, and competencies required
Assign the defined roles and responsibilities to individuals or groups
Regularly review and update the position descriptions as necessary, especially when there are changes in the system or its security requirements
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for documented position descriptions that clearly define roles, responsibilities, and competencies for each position affecting the system's security. They will also check if these roles and responsibilities have been assigned to appropriate individuals or groups.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through the following methods:

title: Policy and Procedures
family: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have established and implemented policies and procedures to protect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) during its processing, storage, transmission, and disposal. This is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, or destruction of PII.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, document, and disseminate policies and procedures that address the processing and transparency of PII. It also requires organizations to review and update these policies and procedures at least annually or whenever significant changes occur.
implementation_guidance: Develop and document policies and procedures that address the processing and transparency of PII. These should cover all stages of PII lifecycle, including collection, use, retention, disclosure, and disposal
Disseminate the policies and procedures to all relevant personnel and stakeholders. This could be done through training sessions, email notifications, or posting on the organization's intranet

Review and update the policies and procedures at least annually or whenever significant changes occur. This could be triggered by changes in legal requirements, technology, business operations, or risk levels
Maintain records of the policies and procedures, including their development, dissemination, review, and update
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has developed, documented, disseminated, reviewed, and updated policies and procedures for the processing and transparency of PII. They will also check that these policies and procedures cover all stages of the PII lifecycle and are communicated to all relevant personnel and stakeholders.

title: Authority to Process Personally Identifiable Information
family: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have the necessary authority to process personally identifiable information (PII). This is crucial for maintaining privacy, complying with legal and regulatory requirements, and preventing unauthorized access or misuse of PII.
description: This control requires organizations to obtain the necessary authority before processing PII. It also requires them to document the authority and make it available to individuals whose PII is being processed.
implementation_guidance: Identify all systems and processes that handle PII
Determine the legal or regulatory authority that permits the processing of PII for each system or process
Document the authority for each system or process in a manner that is easily accessible and understandable
Make the documented authority available to individuals whose PII is being processed
Regularly review and update the authority documentation as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all systems and processes that handle PII, determined and documented the necessary authority, and made this information available to individuals. They will also check that the authority documentation is regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Personally Identifiable Information Processing Purposes
family: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization processes personally identifiable information (PII) for the purpose that is specified in the public notice or consent. This is important for security and compliance as it helps protect the privacy of individuals and prevents unauthorized use of PII.
description: This control requires the organization to process PII only for the purpose identified in the public notice or consent. The organization must also ensure that the PII is not processed for any other purposes unless a change in purpose is publicly announced or consent is obtained from the individual.
implementation_guidance: Identify all PII that the organization processes and the purposes for which it is processed
Ensure that all processing of PII aligns with the purposes specified in the public notice or consent
Implement procedures to prevent the processing of PII for purposes other than those specified in the public notice or consent
If a change in purpose is necessary, publicly announce the change and/or obtain consent from the individual before processing the PII for the new purpose
Regularly review and update the public notice or consent to ensure it accurately reflects the purposes for which PII is processed
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization processes PII only for the purposes specified in the public notice or consent. They will also check that the organization has procedures in place to prevent unauthorized processing of PII and to handle changes in processing purposes.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Consent
family: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations obtain the consent of individuals before collecting, sharing, and using their personally identifiable information (PII). This is crucial for maintaining privacy, trust, and compliance with data protection laws and regulations.
description: This control requires organizations to obtain and document the consent of individuals prior to processing their PII. The organization must also provide mechanisms for individuals to grant, withhold, or withdraw their consent at any time.
implementation_guidance: Develop a clear and concise privacy notice that explains what PII is collected, how it is used, who it is shared with, and how long it is retained
Implement mechanisms (such as checkboxes or digital signatures) to obtain explicit consent from individuals before collecting their PII
Document the obtained consents and store them securely
Provide mechanisms for individuals to review, modify, or withdraw their consent at any time
Regularly review and update the consent process to ensure it remains compliant with current laws and regulations
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a clear privacy notice, obtains explicit consent before collecting PII, documents the obtained consents, and allows individuals to modify or withdraw their consent.

title: Privacy Notice
family: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations provide clear, understandable, and easily accessible privacy notices to individuals regarding the collection, use, dissemination, and maintenance of personally identifiable information (PII). This is crucial for maintaining transparency, trust, and compliance with privacy laws and regulations.
description: This control requires organizations to provide privacy notices to individuals at the point of PII collection or as soon as practicable thereafter. The notice should include the purpose of the PII collection, how it will be used, who it will be shared with, and how it will be protected.
implementation_guidance: Develop a clear and concise privacy notice that includes all necessary information about the collection, use, dissemination, and maintenance of PII
Ensure that the privacy notice is easily accessible and provided to individuals at the point of PII collection or as soon as practicable thereafter
Regularly review and update the privacy notice to reflect any changes in the organization's privacy practices
Train staff to understand the importance of the privacy notice and how to provide it to individuals
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a privacy notice, that it is provided to individuals at the point of PII collection or as soon as practicable thereafter, and that it includes all necessary information. They will also look for evidence that the privacy notice is regularly reviewed and updated, and that staff are trained on its importance and use.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: System of Records Notice
family: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations provide adequate notice to individuals regarding the personally identifiable information (PII) that is collected, how it is used, who it is shared with, and how it is protected. This is important for security and compliance as it promotes transparency and trust, and is a requirement under various privacy laws and regulations.
description: This control requires organizations to issue a public notice about their systems of records that contain PII. The notice should detail the type of data collected, the purpose of the collection, the individuals or entities with whom the data is shared, and the safeguards in place to protect the data.
implementation_guidance: Identify all systems of records that contain PII within your organization

For each system of records, determine the type of PII collected, the purpose of the collection, the individuals or entities with whom the data is shared, and the safeguards in place to protect the data
Draft a System of Records Notice (SORN) for each system of records, incorporating all the information determined in the previous step
Publish the SORNs in a manner that is easily accessible to the public, such as on your organization's website
Regularly review and update the SORNs as necessary, such as when there are changes to the system of records or the way PII is handled
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all systems of records containing PII, has drafted and published SORNs for each system, and regularly reviews and updates the SORNs. They will also evaluate the content of the SORNs to ensure they include all required information.

title: Specific Categories of Personally Identifiable Information
family: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations are aware of and properly manage the specific categories of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) they handle. This is crucial for maintaining privacy, preventing unauthorized access, and complying with legal and regulatory requirements.
description: This control requires organizations to identify and document the specific categories of PII they process, including the purpose of processing, the individuals to whom the PII belongs, and the methods used for processing.
implementation_guidance: Identify all types of PII processed by the organization
Document the purpose for which each category of PII is processed
Identify the individuals or groups to whom the PII belongs
Document the methods used for processing each category of PII
Implement appropriate security measures to protect each category of PII based on its sensitivity and the potential impact of unauthorized access
Regularly review and update the documentation to reflect changes in the types of PII processed, the purposes of processing, and the processing methods
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has identified and documented all categories of PII it processes, the purposes of processing, the individuals to whom the PII belongs, and the processing methods. They will also check that appropriate security measures have been implemented to protect each category of PII.

title: Computer Matching Requirements
family: Personally Identifiable Information Processing and Transparency
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish and implement procedures to comply with the Computer Matching and Privacy Protection Act. This is important for security and compliance as it helps protect individuals' privacy rights when their personally identifiable information (PII) is used in computer matching programs.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and implement procedures to comply with the Computer Matching and Privacy Protection Act. This includes ensuring that records used in computer matching programs are accurate, timely, and complete.
implementation_guidance: Understand the requirements of the Computer Matching and Privacy Protection Act and how it applies to your organization
Develop and implement procedures to ensure that records used in computer matching programs are accurate, timely, and complete
Train relevant staff on these procedures and the importance of complying with the Act
Regularly review and update these procedures as necessary to ensure ongoing compliance
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has established and implemented procedures to comply with the Computer Matching and Privacy Protection Act. They will also check that records used in computer matching programs are accurate, timely, and complete.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods. Assessors may examine the organization's procedures and records, interview relevant staff to determine their understanding and application of the procedures, and test the accuracy, timeliness, and completeness of records used in computer matching programs.

title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish and implement a formal, documented risk assessment policy that includes procedures to facilitate the execution of the risk assessment process. This is crucial for security and compliance as it helps organizations identify, evaluate, and mitigate potential risks that could compromise the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of their information systems.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, disseminate, and periodically review/update a formal, documented risk assessment policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance. It also requires procedures to facilitate the implementation of the risk assessment policy and associated risk assessment controls.
implementation_guidance: Develop a formal, documented risk assessment policy that includes the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance
Disseminate the risk assessment policy to all relevant personnel and stakeholders
Develop procedures to facilitate the implementation of the risk assessment policy and associated risk assessment controls
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures to ensure they remain relevant and effective in the face of evolving risks and organizational changes
Train personnel on the risk assessment policy and procedures to ensure they understand and can effectively execute their roles and responsibilities
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for a formal, documented risk assessment policy and procedures. They will evaluate whether the policy addresses the required elements (purpose, scope, roles, etc.) and whether procedures are in place to facilitate the implementation of the policy and associated controls. They will also check whether the policy and procedures are disseminated to relevant personnel and whether they are reviewed and updated periodically.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through the following methods:

title: Security Categorization
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that information systems are categorized based on the level of impact that a potential breach of security would have on the organization. This categorization helps in determining the appropriate level of security controls to be applied.
description: This control requires organizations to categorize their information systems in accordance with applicable federal laws, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance. The categorization should be reviewed and updated as necessary.
implementation_guidance: Identify the information types processed, stored, or transmitted by the information system
Categorize the information system in accordance with FIPS 199, Standards for Security Categorization of Federal Information and Information Systems
Document the security categorization results (including supporting rationale) in the system security plan
Review and approve the security categorization decision by the authorizing official or designated representative
Review and update the security categorization as part of the system development life cycle and risk management framework
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has correctly categorized its information systems according to FIPS 199 standards. They will also check if the categorization has been documented in the system security plan and if it is reviewed and updated as necessary.

title: Risk Assessment
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations systematically identify, evaluate, and manage the risks to their information systems. By conducting regular risk assessments, organizations can understand their vulnerabilities, the potential impact of threats, and take appropriate measures to mitigate those risks.
description: This control requires organizations to conduct risk assessments that include risk identification, risk analysis, and risk mitigation actions. The risk assessment should be updated periodically and whenever significant changes occur to the system, environment, or operational conditions.
implementation_guidance: Identify Risks:** Begin by identifying potential risks to your information systems. This could include anything from cyber threats to natural disasters
Analyze Risks:** Evaluate each risk based on its potential impact and the likelihood of it occurring. Use this analysis to prioritize risks

Mitigate Risks:** Develop strategies to mitigate the highest priority risks. This could include implementing additional security controls, developing contingency plans, or accepting the risk if it is low enough
Document Risks:** Document all identified risks, your analysis, and your mitigation strategies in a Risk Assessment Report
Update Regularly:** Regularly update your risk assessment to account for new risks and changes to your information systems
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a systematic process for identifying, analyzing, and mitigating risks. They will also look for a Risk Assessment Report that documents this process and is regularly updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Risk Assessment Update
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's risk assessment is updated periodically to reflect changes in the system, environment, or operational aspects that may introduce new risks or change the impact of existing risks.
description: This control requires organizations to update their risk assessments at least every three years, or whenever significant changes occur to the system, environment, or operational aspects. The updated risk assessment should reflect the current state of the system and its environment.
implementation_guidance: Establish a schedule for regular risk assessment updates. This should be at least every three years, but may be more frequent depending on the system's sensitivity and the rate of change in the environment
Identify triggers for unscheduled risk assessment updates. These could include significant system changes, new threat information, or changes in the operational environment

When an update is triggered, conduct a new risk assessment following the same process as the initial risk assessment. This should include identifying and evaluating risks, assessing their impact, and determining appropriate mitigation strategies

Document the updated risk assessment, including any changes in identified risks, their impact, and mitigation strategies. This documentation should be stored securely and made accessible to relevant personnel
Review and update the system's security plan based on the updated risk assessment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a process in place for regular risk assessment updates, and that this process is followed. They will also look for documentation of updated risk assessments and changes to the security plan based on these updates.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods. The "examine" method can be used to review the process for risk assessment updates and the documentation of updated risk assessments. The "interview" method can be used to confirm that relevant personnel understand and follow this process. The "test" method can be used to verify that the process is effective in identifying and addressing new or changed risks.

title: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning
purpose: The purpose of this control is to identify, analyze, and manage vulnerabilities in the organization's information systems. This is crucial for security and compliance as it helps to prevent unauthorized access, data breaches, and other security incidents.
description: This control requires organizations to regularly scan their information systems for vulnerabilities, analyze the results, and take appropriate actions to address the identified vulnerabilities. The frequency of scanning should be in accordance with the organization's risk management strategy.
implementation_guidance: Identify Information Systems:** Identify all the information systems that need to be scanned for vulnerabilities
Select Scanning Tools:** Choose appropriate vulnerability scanning tools that are capable of identifying the vulnerabilities in your systems
Define Scanning Frequency:** Determine the frequency of vulnerability scanning based on your risk management strategy
Perform Scanning:** Conduct vulnerability scanning as per the defined frequency
Analyze Results:** Analyze the results of the vulnerability scans to identify potential vulnerabilities
Take Action:** Take appropriate actions to address the identified vulnerabilities. This could include patching, configuration changes, or other remediation activities
Document:** Document the process, results, and actions taken for audit and compliance purposes
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization is regularly scanning its information systems for vulnerabilities, analyzing the results, and taking appropriate actions to address the identified vulnerabilities. They will also look for documentation of the process, results, and actions taken.

title: Technical Surveillance Countermeasures Survey
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect an organization's information system from technical surveillance threats. It is important for security and compliance as it helps to identify and mitigate risks associated with unauthorized surveillance, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the system.
description: This control requires organizations to periodically conduct and review technical surveillance countermeasures surveys in accordance with federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance. The surveys are intended to detect and neutralize surveillance threats to the information system.
implementation_guidance: Identify Potential Threats:** Identify potential technical surveillance threats to your information system. This could include eavesdropping, interception of data, or unauthorized access to sensitive information

Develop a Survey Plan:** Develop a plan for conducting technical surveillance countermeasures surveys. This should include the frequency of surveys, the areas to be surveyed, and the methods to be used
Conduct Surveys:** Conduct the surveys as per the plan. Use appropriate tools and techniques to detect potential surveillance threats
Review and Analyze Results:** Review and analyze the results of the surveys. Identify any potential vulnerabilities or threats
Implement Countermeasures:** Based on the results of the surveys, implement appropriate countermeasures to neutralize the identified threats
Document and Review:** Document the process, results, and countermeasures taken. Review this documentation periodically and update as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a plan for conducting technical surveillance countermeasures surveys, that these surveys are being conducted as per the plan, and that appropriate countermeasures are being implemented based on the results of the surveys.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Risk Response
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations have a structured and systematic process for responding to identified risks. This is crucial for maintaining the security and integrity of the organization's information systems and data.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and implement risk response measures. These measures should include risk mitigation, risk acceptance, risk avoidance, risk sharing, or a combination of these strategies.
implementation_guidance: Identify Risks:** Begin by identifying potential risks to your organization's information systems and data
Evaluate Risks:** Evaluate the identified risks based on their potential impact and likelihood of occurrence

Develop Risk Response Strategies:** Develop strategies to respond to each identified risk. These strategies could include risk mitigation (reducing the impact or likelihood of the risk), risk acceptance (accepting the consequences of the risk), risk avoidance (eliminating the risk entirely), or risk sharing (transferring the risk to another party)
Implement Risk Response Measures:** Implement the chosen risk response measures. This could involve making changes to your organization's processes, systems, or resources
Monitor and Review:** Regularly monitor and review the effectiveness of your risk response measures. Make adjustments as necessary to ensure that the measures continue to effectively manage risk
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a structured process for responding to identified risks. They will also look for evidence that the organization has implemented its chosen risk response measures and is regularly monitoring and reviewing their effectiveness.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. For example, assessors might examine documentation of the organization's risk response process, interview staff members about the implementation of risk response measures, and test the effectiveness of these measures.

title: Privacy Impact Assessments
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization conducts assessments of the privacy impacts that could result from the collection, storage, processing, transmission, and disposal of personally identifiable information (PII). This is important for security and compliance as it helps to identify and mitigate potential privacy risks, thereby protecting individuals' privacy rights and interests.
description: This control requires organizations to conduct privacy impact assessments (PIAs) prior to deploying systems that process, store, or transmit PII. The PIA should be updated as necessary in response to changes to the system, environment, or operational context.
implementation_guidance: Identify systems that process, store, or transmit PII
Develop a process for conducting PIAs, including defining the scope, methodology, and frequency of assessments
Conduct a PIA prior to deploying any new system that will process, store, or transmit PII
Document the results of the PIA, including any identified privacy risks and their mitigation strategies
Update the PIA as necessary, such as when changes are made to the system, environment, or operational context
Ensure that the PIA process is integrated into the organization's overall risk management process
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a process in place for conducting PIAs, that PIAs are conducted prior to the deployment of new systems, and that they are updated as necessary. They will also look for documentation of the PIA results, including identified privacy risks and their mitigation strategies.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Criticality Analysis
purpose: The purpose of this control is to identify and prioritize the criticality of information systems, components, and functions. This helps organizations to focus their resources and security measures on the most critical areas, thereby reducing the potential impact of security incidents.
description: This control requires organizations to conduct a criticality analysis for their information systems, components, and functions. The analysis should consider the potential impact of loss, interruption, or degradation of these systems and components on the organization's mission, functions, image, reputation, assets, or individuals.
implementation_guidance: Identify all information systems, components, and functions within the organization

Determine the potential impact of loss, interruption, or degradation of each system, component, or function. Consider factors such as the importance to the organization's mission, the sensitivity of the information, the potential financial impact, and the potential impact on the organization's reputation
Prioritize the systems, components, and functions based on their criticality. The most critical ones should receive the highest priority for security measures and resources
Document the results of the criticality analysis in the System Security Plan (SSP)
Review and update the criticality analysis regularly, or whenever significant changes occur in the organization's information systems or environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has conducted a criticality analysis, that the analysis considers the appropriate factors, and that the results are documented in the SSP. They will also check that the analysis is reviewed and updated regularly.

title: Threat Hunting
purpose: The purpose of this control is to proactively and iteratively search through networks to detect and isolate advanced threats that evade existing security solutions. It is crucial for security and compliance as it helps organizations identify potential threats before they can cause significant damage.
description: This control requires organizations to conduct threat hunting activities to identify adversaries that may be lurking in their networks undetected. It involves the use of manual or machine-assisted techniques to detect threats that traditional security measures may have missed.
implementation_guidance: Establish a Threat Hunting Team:** Assemble a team of security professionals with the necessary skills and knowledge to conduct threat hunting activities

Define Threat Hunting Goals:** Identify what you hope to achieve with your threat hunting activities. This could be detecting specific types of threats, improving response times, or enhancing overall security posture

Develop a Threat Hunting Plan:** Create a plan detailing how threat hunting activities will be conducted. This should include the tools and techniques to be used, the frequency of hunts, and the systems to be targeted
Conduct Threat Hunting Activities:** Execute the threat hunting plan, using the defined tools and techniques to search for potential threats

Analyze and Document Findings:** Analyze the results of the threat hunting activities and document any findings. This should include any threats detected, their potential impact, and recommended mitigation strategies

Implement Mitigation Strategies:** Take action to address any threats detected during the threat hunting activities. This could involve patching vulnerabilities, updating security controls, or improving security policies and procedures
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that threat hunting activities are being conducted regularly and effectively. They will also look for documentation of these activities, including the threat hunting plan, the findings from each hunt, and the actions taken in response to these findings.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish and implement policies and procedures for system and services acquisition. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to manage and control the acquisition process, ensuring that all acquired systems and services meet the organization's security requirements.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, document, and disseminate a system and services acquisition policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance. It also requires organizations to establish procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system and services acquisition policy and associated system and services acquisition controls.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive system and services acquisition policy that includes the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance
Document the policy and ensure it is easily accessible to all relevant personnel
Disseminate the policy to all organizational entities involved in system and services acquisition
Develop procedures that facilitate the implementation of the system and services acquisition policy and associated controls
Regularly review and update the policy and procedures to ensure they remain relevant and effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a documented and disseminated system and services acquisition policy and procedures. They will also check that the policy addresses all required elements and that procedures are in place to facilitate the implementation of the policy and associated controls.

title: Allocation of Resources
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization allocates sufficient resources for the management, operation, and maintenance of the security controls implemented within their information systems. This is crucial for maintaining the ongoing effectiveness of these controls and ensuring the security of the organization's information.
description: This control requires the organization to determine, document, and allocate the necessary resources required to protect its information systems and data. This includes personnel, hardware, software, and other elements needed to manage, operate, and maintain the implemented security controls.
implementation_guidance: Identify and document the resources needed to implement, manage, and maintain the security controls for each information system
Estimate the costs associated with these resources, including personnel, hardware, software, and other necessary elements
Secure approval for the allocation of these resources from the appropriate management personnel
Allocate the approved resources to the respective security controls and tasks
Regularly review and adjust resource allocations as necessary to ensure the ongoing effectiveness of the security controls
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified the necessary resources, estimated the associated costs, secured approval for their allocation, and allocated them appropriately. They will also look for evidence of regular reviews and adjustments to these allocations.

title: System Development Life Cycle
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that information systems are developed and managed in a secure manner throughout their entire life cycle. This helps to identify and mitigate potential security risks at every stage of the system's life, from initial concept to decommissioning.
description: This control requires organizations to manage the information system using a system development life cycle methodology that includes information security considerations. It also requires organizations to define and document the system development life cycle.
implementation_guidance: Define and document the system development life cycle (SDLC) methodology that will be used within the organization
Ensure that the SDLC includes stages for initial concept, design, development, testing, implementation, operation/maintenance, and decommissioning

Incorporate information security considerations into each stage of the SDLC. This could include risk assessments, security requirements definition, security design, security testing, and continuous monitoring
Train relevant personnel on the SDLC methodology and the importance of security considerations
Regularly review and update the SDLC methodology to ensure it remains effective and up-to-date with current security best practices
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a defined and documented SDLC methodology, that this methodology includes security considerations at each stage, and that the methodology is being effectively implemented and followed.

title: Acquisition Process
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's acquisition process effectively addresses security requirements, specifications, and standards. This is crucial for maintaining the security posture of the organization and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.
description: This control requires organizations to implement a process for acquiring systems, components, or services. The process should include explicit security requirements, specifications, and standards that are consistent with the organization's security architecture.
implementation_guidance: Develop a structured acquisition process that includes security requirements, specifications, and standards
Ensure that the acquisition process is aligned with the organization's security architecture
Incorporate the acquisition process into the organization's overall risk management strategy
Document the acquisition process and ensure that it is communicated and understood across the organization
Regularly review and update the acquisition process to ensure that it remains effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a structured acquisition process in place. They will also evaluate whether the process includes explicit security requirements, specifications, and standards, and whether it is aligned with the organization's security architecture.

title: Supply Chain Protection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the organization's operations from potential threats that may arise from the supply chain. This includes risks associated with the development, delivery, and maintenance of system components.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and manage supply chain protection measures. It involves identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks throughout the system development life cycle, including acquisition, delivery, installation, operations, maintenance, and disposal of systems.
implementation_guidance: Identify and Document Supply Chain Elements:** Identify all elements of the supply chain, including suppliers, subcontractors, and third-party providers. Document their roles, responsibilities, and the products or services they provide
Conduct Risk Assessment:** Assess the risks associated with each element of the supply chain. This should include risks related to the integrity, security, and resilience of products and services

Develop Risk Mitigation Strategies:** Based on the risk assessment, develop strategies to mitigate identified risks. This could include strategies such as supplier diversification, increased scrutiny of high-risk suppliers, or the implementation of additional security controls

Implement and Monitor Controls:** Implement the risk mitigation strategies and establish a process for monitoring the effectiveness of these controls. This should include regular reviews and updates to the risk assessment and mitigation strategies
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all elements of the supply chain, conducted a thorough risk assessment, developed and implemented risk mitigation strategies, and established a process for monitoring the effectiveness of these controls.

title: System Documentation
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization obtains and maintains system, component, and service documentation. This is important for security and compliance as it provides a clear understanding of the system's design, operation, and maintenance, which is crucial for effective security management and incident response.
description: This control requires the organization to obtain, maintain, and make available to authorized personnel, system documentation including administrator and user guides, and technical specifications. The documentation should be updated and reviewed regularly to reflect the current system state.
implementation_guidance: Identify all systems, components, and services that require documentation

Obtain or create comprehensive documentation for each identified system, component, or service. This should include, but not limited to, system descriptions, architecture diagrams, user manuals, and technical specifications
Establish a secure, centralized repository to store and manage all system documentation
Implement a process to regularly review and update the system documentation to ensure it reflects the current state of the system
Ensure that the documentation is readily available to authorized personnel for reference and use
Train relevant personnel on how to access and use the system documentation
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has obtained, maintained, and made available comprehensive system documentation. They will also check that the documentation is regularly reviewed and updated, and that relevant personnel are trained on how to access and use it.

title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that security and privacy principles are integrated into the system development life cycle. This helps to protect the system from threats and vulnerabilities, and ensures that privacy requirements are met, thereby reducing the risk of data breaches and non-compliance with regulations.
description: This control requires organizations to identify, document, and apply security and privacy engineering principles throughout the system development life cycle. This includes the initial concept development, design, implementation, operation, and disposal stages.
implementation_guidance: Identify and document the security and privacy principles that are relevant to the system and the organization

Incorporate these principles into the system development life cycle. This should be done from the initial concept development stage, and continue through the design, implementation, operation, and disposal stages
Ensure that the principles are applied consistently across all stages of the system development life cycle
Regularly review and update the principles as necessary, to reflect changes in the system, the organization, or the regulatory environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified and documented relevant security and privacy principles, and that these principles have been incorporated into the system development life cycle. They will also look for evidence that the principles are applied consistently and are regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. For example, assessors may examine the organization's documentation of its security and privacy principles, and the procedures for incorporating these principles into the system development life cycle. They may also interview personnel involved in the system development process, to verify that the principles are being applied consistently. Finally, they may test the system to verify that the principles have been effectively implemented.

title: External System Services
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization maintains control over and remains aware of the risks associated with using external system services. This includes managing potential vulnerabilities and threats that could arise from third-party providers or external systems.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and implement measures to manage risks associated with the employment of external system services. This includes defining the security controls to be used with the services, and ensuring that the providers of those services meet the same security requirements as the organization itself.
implementation_guidance: Identify all external system services that are being used or are planned to be used
Define the security requirements for each of these services, based on the organization's risk tolerance and the sensitivity of the data being processed, stored, or transmitted
Establish a formal process for approving and monitoring the use of these services
Ensure that contracts with service providers include the necessary security requirements and that these requirements are met
Regularly review and update the security requirements and the list of approved services as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all external system services, defined appropriate security requirements for these services, and established a process for approving and monitoring their use. They will also check that contracts with service providers include the necessary security requirements.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Developer Configuration Management
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that changes to the system and software are managed in a controlled manner. This is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized changes that could introduce vulnerabilities or disrupt system operations.
description: This control requires the organization to obtain and review configuration management plans from the developers. The plans should describe the configuration management process, including how changes will be controlled and monitored.
implementation_guidance: Identify Configuration Items:** Identify the configuration items (CIs) that need to be managed. These could be software components, system configurations, or documentation
Obtain Configuration Management Plan:** Obtain the configuration management plan from the developers. This plan should describe how changes to the CIs will be managed

Review the Plan:** Review the configuration management plan to ensure it adequately describes the configuration management process. The plan should include details on how changes will be controlled, how the configuration status will be monitored, and how configuration audits will be conducted

Monitor Compliance:** Monitor the developers' compliance with the configuration management plan. This could involve reviewing change logs, conducting configuration audits, or checking the status of CIs
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has obtained and reviewed the configuration management plan from the developers. They will also look for evidence that the organization is monitoring the developers' compliance with the plan.

title: Developer Testing and Evaluation
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the system developers conduct thorough testing and evaluation of the system during its development phase to identify and fix any security flaws or vulnerabilities. This is crucial for maintaining the security and integrity of the system.
description: This control requires system developers to create and implement a comprehensive testing and evaluation plan. The plan should include security control assessments, functional testing, and other relevant evaluations to ensure the system meets all security requirements before it is deployed.
implementation_guidance: Develop a comprehensive testing and evaluation plan that includes security control assessments, functional testing, and other relevant evaluations
Implement the testing and evaluation plan during the system development phase
Document all testing and evaluation results, including any identified vulnerabilities and their remediation actions
Review and update the testing and evaluation plan as necessary, especially when changes are made to the system or its environment
Ensure that all testing and evaluation activities are conducted by qualified personnel
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a comprehensive testing and evaluation plan has been developed and implemented. They will also look for documentation of the testing and evaluation results, including any identified vulnerabilities and their remediation actions.

title: Trustworthiness
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization only acquires information systems, components, or services from trustworthy sources that meet the organization's security requirements. This is important to prevent the introduction of malicious code or hidden functions that could compromise the security of the organization's information systems.
description: This control requires the organization to establish and implement procedures to ensure that the information systems, components, or services it acquires are trustworthy and meet its security requirements.
implementation_guidance: Develop and document procedures for determining the trustworthiness of suppliers. This could include checking their reputation, references, and past performance

Establish criteria for evaluating the trustworthiness of information systems, components, or services. This could include their security features, the robustness of their design, and their compliance with security standards

Implement the procedures and criteria in the acquisition process. This could involve conducting assessments of suppliers and their products or services, and rejecting those that do not meet the trustworthiness criteria
Monitor and review the effectiveness of the procedures and criteria, and make adjustments as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has procedures in place for determining the trustworthiness of suppliers, that it has criteria for evaluating the trustworthiness of information systems, components, or services, that it is implementing these procedures and criteria in its acquisition process, and that it is monitoring and reviewing their effectiveness.
assessment_methods: Compliance with this control can be verified by examining the organization's procedures and criteria, interviewing personnel involved in the acquisition process, and testing the application of the procedures and criteria in a sample of acquisitions.

title: Criticality Analysis
purpose: The purpose of this control is to identify and prioritize the critical components of the information system, ensuring that the most crucial elements are adequately protected. This is important for security and compliance as it helps organizations focus their resources on protecting the most vital parts of their system.
description: This control requires the organization to conduct a criticality analysis that includes defining mission essential functions, identifying critical system components, and prioritizing these components based on their importance to the mission.
implementation_guidance: Define Mission Essential Functions:** Identify the functions that are crucial for the organization's mission and operations
Identify Critical System Components:** Determine the system components that are essential to perform these mission-critical functions

Prioritize Critical Components:** Rank these components based on their importance to the mission. This could be based on factors like the impact of their failure, their vulnerability to threats, or their role in the system
Document the Analysis:** Document the results of the criticality analysis in the System Security Plan (SSP)
Review and Update:** Regularly review and update the criticality analysis to reflect changes in the system or the organization's mission
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has conducted a thorough criticality analysis, identified and prioritized critical system components, and documented this analysis in the SSP. They will also check that the organization regularly reviews and updates this analysis.

title: Tamper Resistance and Detection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's systems and services are resistant to tampering and can detect any attempts at tampering. This is crucial for maintaining the integrity of the system and its data, and for ensuring that unauthorized changes are not made.
description: This control requires the organization to employ tamper-resistant and tamper-detecting technologies to protect against unauthorized physical alterations, modifications, or damage to its systems and services.
implementation_guidance: Identify and document all systems and services that require tamper resistance and detection

Determine the appropriate tamper-resistant and tamper-detecting technologies for each system or service. This could include physical locks, seals, or tamper-evident packaging for hardware, and checksums or digital signatures for software
Implement the chosen technologies, ensuring that they are properly configured and tested
Document the implementation, including the technologies used, the systems or services they protect, and the configuration settings
Train relevant personnel on the use of these technologies and the procedures for responding to tampering alerts
Regularly review and update the tamper resistance and detection measures as needed
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that tamper-resistant and tamper-detecting technologies have been implemented and are being properly used. They will also check that the organization has procedures in place for responding to tampering alerts.

title: Component Authenticity
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure the authenticity of system components to prevent the introduction of malicious or counterfeit components into the system. This is important for security and compliance as unverified components can introduce vulnerabilities or compromise the system's integrity.
description: This control requires organizations to employ mechanisms to verify the authenticity of system components before integrating them into the system. This includes both hardware and software components.
implementation_guidance: Develop a policy that requires the verification of all system components before integration. This policy should include the process for verifying the authenticity of components, the roles and responsibilities of staff, and the actions to be taken if a component fails verification
Train staff on the policy and the process for verifying component authenticity

Implement mechanisms to verify the authenticity of components. This could include checking certificates of authenticity, verifying serial numbers with manufacturers, or using trusted third-party verification services
Document the verification process for each component, including the verification method used and the results
Regularly review and update the policy and verification mechanisms to ensure they remain effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a policy for verifying component authenticity and that this policy is being followed. They will also look for documentation of the verification process for each component.

title: Development Process, Standards, and Tools
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization establishes and follows a formal, documented process for system development that includes the use of appropriate standards and tools. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to ensure that systems are developed in a secure and consistent manner, reducing the risk of vulnerabilities and inconsistencies.
description: This control requires the organization to establish and follow a formal, documented system development process that includes the use of appropriate standards and tools. The process should include security considerations and be updated as necessary to address evolving security requirements and technologies.
implementation_guidance: Establish a Formal Development Process:** The organization should establish a formal, documented process for system development. This process should include all stages of development, from initial planning and design to testing and deployment

Incorporate Security Considerations:** The development process should include security considerations at all stages. This could include the use of secure coding practices, security testing, and the incorporation of security features in the design of the system

Use Appropriate Standards and Tools:** The organization should use appropriate standards and tools in the development process. This could include the use of industry-standard development methodologies and tools, as well as the use of security-specific tools such as static code analysis tools
Update the Process as Necessary:** The organization should regularly review and update the development process to address evolving security requirements and technologies
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a formal, documented system development process in place, that this process includes security considerations, and that appropriate standards and tools are used. They will also look for evidence that the process is regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Developer-provided Training
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's personnel are adequately trained by the developers of the system, service, or component to effectively implement and manage it. This is important for security and compliance as it ensures that the personnel are aware of the security features and functionalities of the system and can use it in a secure manner.
description: This control requires the organization to obtain training from developers on the correct and secure use of the system, service, or component. The training should cover the security features, use, and maintenance of the system.
implementation_guidance: Identify the personnel who will be using or managing the system, service, or component
Coordinate with the developers to provide training to the identified personnel. The training should cover the security features, use, and maintenance of the system
Document the training provided, including the topics covered, the personnel trained, and the date of the training
Regularly review and update the training as necessary, especially when there are changes to the system or its security features
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has obtained appropriate training from the developers. They will also check that the training covers the necessary topics and that the relevant personnel have received the training.

title: Developer Security and Privacy Architecture and Design
purpose: This control is designed to ensure that the security and privacy aspects are considered and integrated during the system development process. It helps to prevent potential vulnerabilities and privacy breaches in the early stages of development, thereby enhancing the overall security posture of the system.
description: SA-17 requires that the developer of the system, system component, or system service explicitly defines, documents, and incorporates security and privacy controls into the system architecture and design. This includes the use of a layered defense approach and the application of principles of least privilege and separation of duties.
implementation_guidance: Define and Document:** Start by defining the security and privacy requirements of the system. Document these requirements in a clear and comprehensive manner
Incorporate into Design:** Incorporate the defined security and privacy controls into the system's architecture and design. This should be done in the early stages of the system development process
Use Layered Defense:** Apply a layered defense approach to the system's security design. This involves using multiple security measures to protect the system and its data

Apply Security Principles:** Apply the principles of least privilege and separation of duties in the system design. This means that users should only have the minimum levels of access necessary to perform their tasks, and responsibilities should be divided among multiple individuals to prevent fraud and error
Review and Update:** Regularly review and update the system's security and privacy architecture and design to ensure that it remains effective against evolving threats
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the developer has defined, documented, and incorporated security and privacy controls into the system's architecture and design. They will also check that a layered defense approach has been used and that the principles of least privilege and separation of duties have been applied.
assessment_methods: Compliance with this control can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. The assessor may examine the system's documentation to verify that security and privacy controls have been defined and incorporated into the design. They may also interview the developer to understand the process used to incorporate these controls. Finally, they may test the system to verify that the controls are functioning as intended.

title: Customized Development of Critical Components
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization develops custom components of the system in a secure manner, thereby reducing the risk of vulnerabilities that could be exploited by malicious entities. This control is important for security and compliance as it helps to maintain the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of the system and its data.
description: This control requires the organization to apply security engineering principles from the earliest stages of the system development life cycle. It involves the development of critical components in a controlled and secure environment, following a documented methodology that includes security considerations.
implementation_guidance: Identify the critical components of the system that will be developed in-house
Develop a documented methodology that includes security considerations for the development of these critical components
Apply security engineering principles throughout the development process, from the initial conceptualization of the component to its final deployment
Ensure that the development environment is secure and controlled to prevent unauthorized access or tampering
Regularly review and update the development methodology and security controls as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified its critical components, developed a secure methodology for their development, and applied security engineering principles throughout the development process. They will also check that the development environment is secure and controlled.

title: Developer Screening
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that individuals who are developing, maintaining, or operating systems on behalf of an organization are trustworthy and meet established personnel criteria. This is important to prevent potential security breaches or malicious activities from within the organization.
description: This control requires organizations to screen developers to ensure they meet established personnel qualification criteria. The screening process should be consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and policies.
implementation_guidance: Establish Criteria:** Define the criteria for personnel qualifications based on the sensitivity of the system they will be working on. This could include education, experience, certifications, or security clearances

Develop Screening Process:** Develop a process for screening developers that includes checks against the established criteria. This could include background checks, reference checks, and verification of qualifications
Implement Screening Process:** Implement the screening process for all developers. This should be done before they are granted access to the system
Document Screening:** Document the results of the screening process for each developer. This documentation should be maintained as part of the personnel records
Review and Update:** Regularly review and update the screening process and criteria to ensure they remain relevant and effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a defined and implemented screening process for developers. They will also look for documentation that shows the screening process has been followed and the results for each developer.

title: Software Usage Restrictions
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization establishes and enforces software usage restrictions and user responsibilities to mitigate the risk of malicious software introduction and propagation. It is important for security and compliance as it helps in preventing unauthorized software from running, which could potentially compromise the system.
description: This control requires the organization to document and enforce software usage restrictions and supervision for software that is either externally provided or internally developed. It also requires the organization to define software allowed to execute within the system.
implementation_guidance: Document Software Usage Restrictions:** Develop a policy that outlines the restrictions on software usage. This policy should include the types of software that are allowed and those that are prohibited

Enforce Software Usage Restrictions:** Implement mechanisms to enforce the software usage restrictions. This could be through technical controls like application whitelisting or administrative controls like user training
