Define User Responsibilities:** Clearly define the responsibilities of users regarding software usage. This should include the consequences of non-compliance
Monitor Compliance:** Regularly monitor and review software usage to ensure compliance with the policy. Take corrective action where necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence of a documented software usage policy, enforcement mechanisms, defined user responsibilities, and a process for monitoring compliance.

title: Unsupported System Components
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization does not use any system components that are no longer supported by the developer, manufacturer, or vendor. Unsupported components can pose a significant security risk as they may not receive necessary security updates or patches, leaving them vulnerable to exploitation.
description: This control requires organizations to replace information system components when support for those components is no longer available from the developer, vendor, or manufacturer. It also requires the organization to provide justification and documentation for the continued use of unsupported system components.
implementation_guidance: Inventory:** Maintain an up-to-date inventory of all system components
Monitor Support Status:** Regularly monitor the support status of all system components. This can be achieved by subscribing to vendor notifications or using automated tools
Plan for Replacement:** When a component is nearing the end of its support life, plan for its replacement. This includes budgeting for the replacement and planning for any downtime
Replace Unsupported Components:** Replace components as soon as support ends. If this is not possible, document the reasons and plan for mitigating any risks
Document:** Document all instances of unsupported system components, including the justification for their continued use and the plan for their replacement
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization is aware of the support status of all system components, has plans in place for replacing unsupported components, and has documented any instances of unsupported components.

title: User-installed Software
purpose: The purpose of this control is to limit the risk of malicious software installation and unauthorized system changes by restricting the ability of users to install software on organizational information systems.
description: This control requires organizations to establish policies and procedures that restrict the installation of software by users. It aims to prevent the introduction of unvetted software that could potentially compromise the system's security.
implementation_guidance: Develop and document a policy that clearly defines the rules and conditions under which users can install software on their systems
Implement technical controls, such as administrative privileges and software whitelisting, to enforce the policy
Provide training to users about the risks associated with installing unauthorized software and the consequences of policy violations
Regularly review and update the policy to ensure it remains relevant and effective in the face of evolving threats and changing organizational needs
Monitor system activities to detect and respond to any unauthorized software installations
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a well-defined policy on user-installed software, that the policy is effectively communicated to users, and that technical controls are in place to enforce the policy. They will also check for evidence of regular policy reviews and updates, as well as monitoring activities.

title: Specialization
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization uses specialized systems, components, or services in the information system to provide increased protection. It is important for security and compliance as it helps to minimize the risk of security breaches by using specialized systems that are designed to handle specific tasks securely.
description: This control requires the organization to use specialized systems, components, or services in the information system to provide increased protection. It also requires the organization to document the use of such systems, components, or services in the system security plan.
implementation_guidance: Identify the specialized systems, components, or services that can be used in the information system to provide increased protection
Evaluate the security features of these specialized systems, components, or services and ensure they meet the organization's security requirements
Implement the selected specialized systems, components, or services in the information system
Document the use of these specialized systems, components, or services in the system security plan
Regularly review and update the system security plan to reflect changes in the use of specialized systems, components, or services
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified, evaluated, and implemented specialized systems, components, or services in the information system. They will also look for documentation of the use of these systems, components, or services in the system security plan.

title: Policy and Procedures
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that organizations establish and maintain policies and procedures to protect information at rest and in transit. These policies and procedures provide a framework for implementing security controls and managing risk.
description: This control requires organizations to develop, document, and disseminate system and communication protection policies and procedures. It ensures that the organization has a consistent approach to protect its information systems and data.
implementation_guidance: Develop Policies and Procedures:** Start by developing comprehensive policies and procedures that address system and communication protection. These should align with the organization's overall security strategy and regulatory requirements
Document Policies and Procedures:** Document these policies and procedures in a format that is easily accessible and understandable to all relevant personnel
Disseminate Policies and Procedures:** Distribute these policies and procedures to all relevant personnel. This could be done through email, internal portals, or staff meetings
Train Staff:** Conduct training sessions to ensure that all relevant personnel understand and can effectively implement these policies and procedures

Review and Update Policies and Procedures:** Regularly review and update these policies and procedures to ensure they remain effective and relevant. This should be done at least annually or whenever significant changes occur in the organization or its environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has developed, documented, and disseminated system and communication protection policies and procedures. They will also check that these policies and procedures are being effectively implemented and regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Separation of System and User Functionality
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources. It ensures that system functionality is separated from user functionality, thereby reducing the risk of users gaining unauthorized access to system-level functions.
description: This control requires the system to separate user functionality from system functionality, preventing users from executing system-level functions. It also requires the system to provide a clear distinction between these functionalities.
implementation_guidance: Identify System and User Functions:** Start by identifying all system-level functions and user-level functions within your system
Implement Access Controls:** Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can execute system-level functions

Separate User and System Functions:** Ensure that user interfaces do not provide access to system-level functions. This can be achieved by using different interfaces for system and user functions or by implementing strong access controls within a shared interface
Test the Separation:** Regularly test the separation of system and user functionality to ensure that users cannot gain unauthorized access to system-level functions
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that system and user functions are clearly separated and that users cannot gain unauthorized access to system-level functions. They will also look for evidence that the organization regularly tests this separation.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. The assessor may examine system documentation and access controls, interview system administrators and users, and test the system to verify that users cannot execute system-level functions.

title: Security Function Isolation
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that security functions are isolated from non-security functions. This is important to prevent potential interference and tampering with the security functions by non-security functions, thereby maintaining the integrity and effectiveness of the security system.
description: This control requires the system to isolate security functions from non-security functions by implementing security domains, using physical or logical isolation techniques. This is to prevent potential compromise of the security functions by non-security functions.
implementation_guidance: Identify all security functions within the system
Identify all non-security functions within the system

Implement physical or logical isolation techniques to separate security functions from non-security functions. This could be achieved through the use of separate servers, virtualization, separate process spaces, or other isolation techniques
Document the implemented isolation techniques and the rationale behind their selection
Regularly review and update the isolation techniques as necessary to ensure continued effectiveness
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that security functions have been identified and are isolated from non-security functions. They will also look for documentation detailing the implemented isolation techniques and the rationale behind their selection.

title: Information in Shared System Resources
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources. It is crucial for security and compliance as it helps to maintain the confidentiality and integrity of system data.
description: This control requires the system to isolate or protect information processed, stored, or transmitted by the system that is shared by multiple users using shared system resources.
implementation_guidance: Identify all shared system resources. This could include memory, storage, network bandwidth, processing power, etc
Implement technical controls to prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via these shared resources. This could include access controls, encryption, or other isolation techniques
Document the controls in the System Security Plan (SSP), including how they are implemented and how they protect the shared resources
Regularly review and update the controls as necessary to ensure they continue to effectively protect the shared resources
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that shared system resources have been identified and that appropriate controls have been implemented to prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer. They will also look for evidence that these controls are documented in the SSP and are regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Denial-of-service Protection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the availability of an organization's information system by preventing or limiting the effects of Denial-of-Service (DoS) attacks. These attacks can disrupt operations and services, making it crucial to have measures in place to mitigate them.
description: This control requires the organization to protect its information system from DoS attacks. This includes being able to anticipate, withstand, and recover from such attacks, ensuring the system remains available to users.
implementation_guidance: Identify Potential Threats:** Understand the different types of DoS attacks and how they can affect your system
Implement Protective Measures:** Use firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and traffic analysis solutions to detect and prevent DoS attacks
Establish Incident Response Plan:** Develop a plan to respond to DoS attacks, including steps to isolate affected systems and restore services
Regularly Update and Patch Systems:** Keep all systems and software up-to-date to protect against known vulnerabilities that could be exploited in a DoS attack
Monitor and Analyze Network Traffic:** Regularly monitor network traffic to identify unusual activity that could indicate a DoS attack
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented measures to protect against DoS attacks, has a response plan in place, and regularly monitors and updates its systems.

title: Resource Availability
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the necessary system resources are available to authorized users when they need them. This is crucial for maintaining the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of the system and its data.
description: This control requires organizations to allocate sufficient system resources to protect against denial of service (DoS) attacks. It also requires organizations to manage the availability of system resources to meet business needs, service level agreements, and information security requirements.
implementation_guidance: Identify Critical Resources:** Identify the system resources that are critical for your organization's operations
Define Resource Requirements:** Define the necessary resource requirements to ensure the availability of these critical resources
Implement Protective Measures:** Implement measures to protect these resources from DoS attacks. This could include rate-limiting, IP filtering, or deploying DoS protection appliances
Monitor Resource Usage:** Regularly monitor the usage of these resources to ensure they are not being overused or misused

Manage Resource Allocation:** Manage the allocation of these resources to ensure they are available when needed. This could involve load balancing, resource pooling, or implementing a resource reservation system
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified its critical resources, defined their resource requirements, implemented protective measures against DoS attacks, and is actively managing and monitoring resource usage and allocation.

title: Boundary Protection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to monitor and control communications at the external boundary of the system and at key internal boundaries within the system. This is important to prevent unauthorized and harmful traffic from entering or leaving the system, thereby enhancing security and compliance.
description: This control requires the organization to monitor and control communications at the external boundary of the system and at key internal boundaries within the system, implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks, and connect to external networks or information systems only through managed interfaces consisting of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security architecture.
implementation_guidance: Identify the external boundaries of the system and key internal boundaries within the system
Implement measures to monitor and control communications at these boundaries
Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components and ensure they are physically or logically separated from internal networks
Ensure that connections to external networks or information systems are made only through managed interfaces consisting of boundary protection devices
Arrange these devices in accordance with an organizational security architecture
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified the system's external and key internal boundaries, implemented measures to monitor and control communications at these boundaries, implemented subnetworks for publicly accessible system components, and ensured that connections to external networks or information systems are made only through managed interfaces.

title: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information transmitted over networks. It is crucial for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized disclosure, modification, or destruction of information during transmission.
description: This control requires organizations to implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of information and to detect changes to information during transmission unless otherwise protected by alternative physical safeguards.
implementation_guidance: Identify all types of information transmitted within and outside the organization
Determine the level of sensitivity and risk associated with each type of information

Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of the information during transmission. This could include encryption technologies or secure protocols like HTTPS, SSL, or TLS
If cryptographic mechanisms are not feasible, consider alternative physical safeguards such as secure cabling or protected distribution systems
Document the chosen mechanisms and safeguards in the System Security Plan (SSP)
Regularly review and update the mechanisms and safeguards to ensure they remain effective against current threats
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified sensitive information, implemented appropriate cryptographic mechanisms or physical safeguards, and documented these in the SSP. They will also check that these mechanisms and safeguards are reviewed and updated regularly.

title: Network Disconnect
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources. This is crucial for security and compliance as it helps protect the integrity and confidentiality of the system's data.
description: This control requires the system to terminate the network connection associated with a communications session at the end of the session or after a defined period of inactivity.
implementation_guidance: Define a policy that specifies the conditions under which network connections should be terminated. This could be at the end of a session or after a certain period of inactivity
Implement system configurations or tools that can automatically disconnect network sessions based on the defined policy
Regularly review and update the policy and system configurations to ensure they remain effective and relevant
Train staff to understand the importance of disconnecting from the network when their session is finished or inactive
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a policy for network disconnect and that this policy is being enforced. They will also check that the system is configured to automatically disconnect network sessions under the conditions specified in the policy.

title: Trusted Path
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that a secure, trusted path exists between the user and the system, preventing unauthorized access or tampering during the communication process. This is crucial for maintaining the integrity and confidentiality of the data being transmitted.
description: This control requires the system to establish and implement a trusted path for certain functions, such as user login and system administration, to prevent unauthorized access, modification, or diversion of information.
implementation_guidance: Identify the critical functions of the system that require a trusted path, such as user authentication, system administration, and privileged operations

Design and implement a trusted path mechanism that ensures secure communication between the user and the system for these identified functions. This could involve using secure protocols, encryption, or other security measures
Document the trusted path mechanism in the System Security Plan (SSP), including the functions it covers and the security measures used
Regularly review and update the trusted path mechanism to ensure it remains effective against emerging threats and vulnerabilities
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that a trusted path mechanism has been implemented for critical functions, and that it effectively prevents unauthorized access, modification, or diversion of information. They will also check that this mechanism is documented in the SSP and regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure the secure generation, distribution, storage, and ultimate destruction of cryptographic keys. It is crucial for maintaining the confidentiality and integrity of information by preventing unauthorized access to or alteration of data.
description: This control requires organizations to manage cryptographic keys in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards. It includes the establishment of key management procedures and responsibilities, key lifecycle management, and protection of keys against unauthorized disclosure.
implementation_guidance: Establish Key Management Procedures:** Define and document the procedures for cryptographic key management. This should include key generation, distribution, storage, recovery, archival, and destruction
Assign Responsibilities:** Assign key management roles and responsibilities to specific individuals or teams. This should include key custodians, system administrators, and security officers
Implement Key Lifecycle Management:** Ensure that cryptographic keys are managed throughout their lifecycle. This includes key generation, distribution, storage, usage, rotation, and destruction
Protect Keys:** Implement measures to protect cryptographic keys against unauthorized disclosure. This could include encryption, secure storage, and access controls
Comply with Regulations:** Ensure that key management practices comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and standards
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence of established key management procedures, assigned responsibilities, implemented key lifecycle management, measures to protect keys, and compliance with regulations.

title: Public Access Protections
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of information and information systems from unauthorized and unauthenticated access originating from public networks. It is crucial for security and compliance to prevent potential threats and vulnerabilities that could compromise the system.
description: This control requires organizations to implement security safeguards to protect publicly accessible system components from unauthorized access and potential harm. This includes the application of necessary security controls to public-facing web applications, servers, and other system components.
implementation_guidance: Identify all system components that are publicly accessible. This includes web servers, email servers, DNS servers, etc
Evaluate the current security measures in place for these components
Implement additional security controls as necessary. This may include firewalls, intrusion detection systems, secure coding practices, regular patching, and more
Regularly monitor and audit the security of these components to ensure ongoing protection
Document all implemented security measures in the System Security Plan (SSP)
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all publicly accessible system components and has implemented appropriate security measures to protect them. They will also look for evidence of regular monitoring and auditing of these components.

title: Cryptographic Protection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity of information during transmission and storage. It protects against unauthorized disclosure, alteration, or destruction of information.
description: This control requires the organization to implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of information and to protect the integrity of information during transmission and storage.
implementation_guidance: Identify the information that requires cryptographic protection. This could be sensitive data like personally identifiable information (PII), financial data, or proprietary information

Determine the appropriate cryptographic mechanisms based on the sensitivity of the information, regulatory requirements, and organizational risk tolerance. This could include symmetric or asymmetric encryption, hash functions, digital signatures, etc
Implement the chosen cryptographic mechanisms. This could involve configuring network devices to use encryption for data in transit, encrypting data at rest using disk encryption, etc
Document the use of cryptographic mechanisms in the System Security Plan (SSP)
Regularly review and update the cryptographic mechanisms as needed, based on changes in threats, technology, or business requirements
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified information requiring cryptographic protection, chosen appropriate cryptographic mechanisms, implemented these mechanisms, and documented their use in the SSP.

title: Voice Over Internet Protocol
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure the security and integrity of Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technologies used within the information system. It is important for security and compliance because VoIP technologies can be vulnerable to various threats including eavesdropping, denial of service, and other cyber attacks.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and implement security measures to protect VoIP systems from potential threats. It includes the protection of information transmitted over VoIP networks, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the information.
implementation_guidance: Identify VoIP Components:** Identify all VoIP components within the information system, including hardware, software, and network connections
Risk Assessment:** Conduct a risk assessment to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities to the VoIP system

Security Measures:** Based on the risk assessment, establish and implement security measures to protect the VoIP system. This may include encryption, authentication, firewall protections, intrusion detection systems, and secure configurations
Security Policies and Procedures:** Develop and implement security policies and procedures for the use and management of VoIP technologies
Training:** Provide training to all users of the VoIP system on the security policies and procedures, and the importance of VoIP security
Monitoring and Review:** Regularly monitor and review the security measures to ensure they are effective and up-to-date
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all VoIP components, conducted a risk assessment, implemented appropriate security measures, developed and implemented security policies and procedures, provided training, and regularly monitors and reviews the security measures.

title: Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized and unintended information sharing/dissemination via collaborative computing devices and applications. It is crucial for maintaining the confidentiality and integrity of the system and its data.
description: This control requires organizations to prevent unauthorized and unintended information sharing/dissemination via collaborative computing devices and applications. It also mandates the use of appropriate safeguards to control the use of such devices and applications.
implementation_guidance: Identify Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications:** Identify all collaborative computing devices and applications within the organization. This includes, but is not limited to, video conferencing systems, shared document editing tools, and instant messaging apps

Establish Policies and Procedures:** Develop and implement policies and procedures that restrict the use of collaborative computing devices and applications based on the organization's risk tolerance and business requirements
Implement Safeguards:** Implement technical safeguards to enforce these policies and procedures. This could include network segmentation, access controls, encryption, and monitoring tools
Train Employees:** Train all employees on the policies, procedures, and proper use of collaborative computing devices and applications
Monitor and Review:** Regularly monitor and review the use of collaborative computing devices and applications to ensure compliance with the policies and procedures
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all collaborative computing devices and applications, implemented appropriate policies and procedures, put in place technical safeguards, trained employees, and is regularly monitoring and reviewing the use of these devices and applications.

title: Transmission of Security and Privacy Attributes
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that security attributes associated with users and objects are consistently transmitted between devices to maintain the security and privacy of the information being processed, stored, or transmitted.
description: This control requires that the information system associates security attributes with information and users, and that these attributes are transmitted to maintain the security and privacy of the information during transmission.
implementation_guidance: Identify the security and privacy attributes associated with users and information that need to be transmitted. These attributes could include access controls, user roles, and privacy settings
Develop a mechanism for associating these attributes with the information and users. This could be a tagging system or a metadata schema
Implement a system that ensures these attributes are transmitted along with the information or user data. This could involve modifying transmission protocols or developing custom solutions
Regularly review and update the security and privacy attributes to ensure they remain relevant and effective
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that security and privacy attributes are identified, associated with information and users, and transmitted consistently. They will also look for evidence that these attributes are regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Public Key Infrastructure Certificates
purpose: This control is crucial for ensuring the integrity, confidentiality, and authenticity of information transmitted over networks. It helps in preventing unauthorized access and data manipulation by using public key infrastructure (PKI) certificates.
description: SC-17 requires organizations to obtain, protect, and make available public key infrastructure (PKI) certificates for system components that require strong authentication, confidentiality, and integrity controls. The control also requires organizations to manage and implement PKI certificates in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.
implementation_guidance: Identify system components that require strong authentication, confidentiality, and integrity controls
Obtain PKI certificates for identified system components from a trusted Certificate Authority (CA)
Implement mechanisms to protect the PKI certificates from unauthorized access and manipulation
Make PKI certificates available to the necessary system components
Establish a process for managing and renewing PKI certificates
Ensure the implementation and management of PKI certificates comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and standards
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that PKI certificates are obtained, protected, and made available for system components requiring strong authentication, confidentiality, and integrity controls. They will also check if the organization manages and implements PKI certificates in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.

title: Mobile Code
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the integrity of systems and data by managing and controlling the execution of mobile code within the information system. Mobile code can introduce vulnerabilities and risks, including unauthorized access, data leakage, and malicious activities.
description: This control requires organizations to establish usage restrictions, configuration/implementation rules, and implementation guidance for mobile code technologies to mitigate potential risk associated with their usage.
implementation_guidance: Identify all mobile code technologies used within the organization

Establish usage restrictions for each identified mobile code technology. This could include prohibiting certain types of mobile code, limiting the execution of mobile code to specific domains or users, or other restrictions as deemed necessary
Develop configuration/implementation rules for each mobile code technology. This could include rules for code signing, sandboxing, or other security measures

Provide implementation guidance to all relevant personnel. This should include information on the usage restrictions and configuration/implementation rules, as well as any procedures for reporting violations or security incidents related to mobile code
Regularly review and update the usage restrictions, configuration/implementation rules, and implementation guidance as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all mobile code technologies in use, established appropriate usage restrictions and configuration/implementation rules, and provided implementation guidance to relevant personnel. They will also look for evidence that these measures are being followed and regularly reviewed.

title: Secure Name/address Resolution Service (authoritative Source)
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's information system provides secure name/address resolution service, and that it only uses authoritative sources. This is important for security and compliance as it prevents unauthorized and malicious entities from manipulating or spoofing the system's name/address resolution process.
description: This control requires the organization's information system to provide secure name/address resolution service. The system must only use information obtained from an authoritative source when performing name/address resolution.
implementation_guidance: Identify the name/address resolution services used by your information system
Implement security measures to protect these services from unauthorized access and manipulation. This could include encryption, access controls, and monitoring
Define and document the authoritative sources for name/address resolution
Configure your system to only use these authoritative sources for name/address resolution
Regularly review and update your system's configuration and the list of authoritative sources as necessary
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization's system provides secure name/address resolution service, and that it only uses information from authoritative sources. They will also check that the organization has implemented appropriate security measures to protect these services.

title: Secure Name/address Resolution Service (recursive or Caching Resolver)
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization's information system provides secure name/address resolution service. This is important for security and compliance as it prevents unauthorized and malicious entities from manipulating or intercepting network communications through DNS spoofing or cache poisoning attacks.
description: This control requires the organization's information system to provide secure name/address resolution service, and to ensure that the service is protected from unauthorized DNS redirection, modification, or other forms of tampering.
implementation_guidance: Identify and document all name/address resolution services used within the organization's information system

Implement security measures to protect these services. This could include DNSSEC (Domain Name System Security Extensions) for DNS services, or other appropriate security measures for different types of services
Regularly monitor and audit the name/address resolution services to detect any unauthorized changes or anomalies
Implement incident response procedures to address any detected anomalies or security incidents related to the name/address resolution services
Regularly review and update the security measures as needed, based on the monitoring and auditing results
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented secure name/address resolution services, and that these services are protected from unauthorized changes or tampering. They will also look for evidence of regular monitoring and auditing, and effective incident response procedures.

title: Transmission Preparation Integrity
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure the integrity of information during preparation for transmission. It is crucial for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized modification, deletion, or addition of data during the transmission preparation process.
description: This control requires organizations to implement security measures that protect the integrity of information as it is being prepared for transmission. This includes ensuring that the information is not altered, deleted, or added to without authorization during this process.
implementation_guidance: Identify the information that will be transmitted and the systems involved in the transmission process

Develop and implement security measures to protect the integrity of the information during the preparation for transmission. This could include cryptographic mechanisms, checksums, or other data integrity controls
Document these security measures in the system security plan
Train relevant personnel on the importance of maintaining the integrity of information during preparation for transmission and how to use the implemented security measures
Regularly review and update the security measures as necessary to address changes in the information, systems, or threats
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented security measures to protect the integrity of information during preparation for transmission. They will also check that these measures are documented in the system security plan and that relevant personnel are trained on them.

title: Architecture and Provisioning for Name/address Resolution Service
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the architecture and provisioning of name/address resolution service is secure, thereby preventing unauthorized access or manipulation of system resources. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to protect the integrity and confidentiality of system data.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and implement secure architecture and provisioning for name/address resolution services. It also requires the use of secure methods in associating the name/address resolution information with respective systems or components.
implementation_guidance: Identify the name/address resolution services in use within the organization
Develop a secure architecture for these services, ensuring that they are isolated from public networks and that access is restricted to authorized personnel only

Implement secure methods for associating name/address resolution information with the respective systems or components. This could include encryption, digital signatures, or other secure authentication methods
Regularly review and update the architecture and provisioning of these services to ensure they remain secure and compliant with the latest standards and regulations
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has a secure architecture in place for name/address resolution services, that secure methods are used for associating name/address resolution information, and that these methods are regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods. The "examine" method may involve reviewing the architecture and provisioning of the name/address resolution services, as well as the methods used for associating name/address resolution information. The "interview" method may involve discussions with relevant personnel to understand how these services are managed and maintained. The "test" method may involve a practical demonstration of the secure methods used for associating name/address resolution information.

title: Session Authenticity
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure the authenticity of communications sessions in an information system. It is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access and manipulation of sessions, thereby protecting the integrity and confidentiality of the system and its data.
description: This control requires the information system to protect the authenticity of communications sessions. It does this by implementing mechanisms that verify the identity of both sender and recipient, or just the sender, depending on the system's requirements.
implementation_guidance: Identify the communication sessions that need to be protected within the information system
Determine the appropriate level of session authenticity required, considering factors such as the sensitivity of the data, the risk level, and the potential impact of a breach

Select and implement mechanisms to verify the identity of the sender and recipient during communication sessions. These mechanisms could include cryptographic methods, digital signatures, or secure tokens
Document the chosen mechanisms and their implementation in the System Security Plan (SSP)
Regularly review and update the mechanisms to ensure they remain effective against evolving threats
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified the communication sessions that need protection, determined the appropriate level of session authenticity, and implemented suitable mechanisms to verify identities. They will also check that these mechanisms are documented in the SSP and are regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Fail in Known State
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that systems fail in a manner that does not compromise the security of the system or its data. This is important for security and compliance because it helps to prevent unauthorized access or damage to the system or data during a system failure.
description: This control requires that the information system fails to a known, secure state that does not compromise security when a failure occurs, and that the system preserves system state information to facilitate system restart and recovery.
implementation_guidance: Identify the potential failure points within the system
Define a known, secure state for each potential failure point
Implement mechanisms to force the system into the defined secure state when a failure is detected
Implement mechanisms to preserve system state information during a failure to facilitate system restart and recovery
Regularly test the system's failure responses to ensure they are functioning as expected
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the system fails to a known, secure state that does not compromise security. They will also look for evidence that system state information is preserved during a failure to facilitate system restart and recovery.

title: Thin Nodes
purpose: The purpose of this control is to minimize the potential attack surface and reduce system vulnerabilities by limiting the functions performed by individual nodes in a network. This is achieved by using thin nodes, which perform minimal functions and have fewer vulnerabilities compared to full-function nodes.
description: This control requires that the organization employs thin nodes to limit the functions that can be performed on the system. This includes limiting the use of protocols, ports, and services to only those required for the system to perform its intended function.
implementation_guidance: Identify the necessary functions that each node in the network needs to perform
Configure each node to only perform the identified necessary functions
Disable or remove any unnecessary protocols, ports, and services from each node
Regularly review and update the configuration of each node to ensure that only necessary functions are enabled
Implement a process for monitoring and managing changes to the configuration of each node
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented thin nodes, that each node is configured to only perform necessary functions, and that unnecessary protocols, ports, and services have been disabled or removed. They will also look for evidence of a process for regularly reviewing and updating node configurations, and for monitoring and managing changes to these configurations.

title: Decoys
purpose: The purpose of this control is to confuse potential attackers and divert their activities away from actual system resources, thereby protecting the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of the system.
description: This control requires the organization to employ a deceptive environment, such as decoy systems, services, or information, to mislead potential attackers. The decoys should be designed to mimic the organization's actual systems to effectively divert and confuse the attackers.
implementation_guidance: Identify the critical system resources that need to be protected
Design and deploy decoy systems, services, or information that closely mimic the actual resources
Ensure the decoys are indistinguishable from the real systems to the potential attackers
Regularly monitor and analyze the interactions with the decoys to identify potential threats and attack patterns
Update the decoys as necessary to reflect changes in the actual systems
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented decoy systems, services, or information. They will also evaluate the effectiveness of the decoys in mimicking the actual systems and their ability to divert potential attacks.

title: Platform-independent Applications
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that applications are platform-independent to the maximum extent possible. This is important for security and compliance because it reduces the risk of system vulnerabilities that are specific to certain platforms. It also increases the flexibility and portability of applications, which can be beneficial for business continuity and disaster recovery.
description: This control requires organizations to design and implement applications that are platform-independent. This means that the applications should be able to run on different types of hardware, operating systems, and software environments without requiring significant modifications.
implementation_guidance: Identify Applications:** Start by identifying all the applications that are used within your organization

Assess Platform Dependence:** For each application, assess the extent to which it is dependent on a specific platform. This could involve reviewing the application's documentation, consulting with the application's developers, or conducting tests

Implement Platform Independence:** For applications that are highly platform-dependent, consider ways to make them more platform-independent. This could involve re-designing the application, re-coding it, or replacing it with a more platform-independent alternative
Test Platform Independence:** After making changes, test the application on different platforms to confirm that it is now platform-independent
Document:** Document your findings, actions, and test results for each application
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified its applications, assessed their platform dependence, made efforts to implement platform independence, tested the results, and documented the process.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods. The "examine" method could involve reviewing the organization's documentation and test results. The "interview" method could involve speaking with staff members who were involved in the process. The "test" method could involve independently testing the applications on different platforms.

title: Protection of Information at Rest
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized access, modification, and deletion of information at rest. This includes data stored in databases, file systems, and other storage structures. It is crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data.
description: This control requires organizations to implement mechanisms for protecting the confidentiality and integrity of information at rest. This may include cryptographic mechanisms, access controls, or physical security measures.
implementation_guidance: Identify all information at rest that needs protection. This includes data in databases, file systems, and other storage structures
Determine the appropriate level of protection based on the sensitivity and value of the data
Implement mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of the data. This may include encryption, access controls, or physical security measures
Regularly review and update the protection mechanisms to ensure they remain effective against emerging threats
Document the implemented mechanisms in the System Security Plan (SSP)
assessment_objectives: Assessors will verify that the organization has identified all information at rest that needs protection, implemented appropriate protection mechanisms, and documented these mechanisms in the SSP. They will also check that the protection mechanisms are regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Heterogeneity
purpose: The purpose of this control is to reduce the risk of vulnerabilities spreading across an organization's systems. By ensuring heterogeneity, or diversity, in the system components, a vulnerability in one component is less likely to affect others.
description: This control requires organizations to design their systems with a diverse set of components. This includes using different operating systems, applications, and network devices to prevent a single point of failure or vulnerability from compromising the entire system.
implementation_guidance: Identify critical system components:** Start by identifying the critical components of your system. These could be servers, databases, network devices, or any other components that are crucial for your operations
Evaluate current diversity:** Assess the current level of diversity in your system components. Are you relying heavily on one type of operating system, application, or network device?

Identify alternatives:** Research alternative components that could be used to increase the diversity of your system. Consider factors such as compatibility, cost, and security when evaluating alternatives

Implement changes:** Gradually implement changes to increase the diversity of your system components. This could involve installing a new operating system on some servers, switching to a different database software, or using a variety of network devices
Monitor and adjust:** Regularly monitor your system for vulnerabilities and adjust your approach as needed. Remember, the goal is to prevent a single vulnerability from affecting your entire system
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented a diverse set of system components. They will also evaluate whether the organization regularly monitors and adjusts its approach to maintain system diversity.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of examination, interview, and testing methods. For example, assessors might examine system documentation to verify the use of diverse components, interview IT staff to understand the organization's approach to system diversity, and conduct tests to identify any single points of vulnerability.

title: Concealment and Misdirection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect information systems from unauthorized access and potential attacks by concealing or misdirecting activities that could reveal system vulnerabilities. This is important for security and compliance as it reduces the risk of system compromise and data breaches.
description: This control requires organizations to implement measures that conceal or misdirect adversarial activities. These measures can include obscuring system details, changing system responses, or redirecting malicious activities to decoy systems.
implementation_guidance: Identify system details and responses that could potentially reveal system vulnerabilities if observed by an adversary
Develop strategies to conceal these details and responses. This could involve changing system responses to give false information or redirecting adversarial activities to decoy systems
Implement these strategies in the system. This could involve changes to system configuration or the use of additional security tools
Regularly review and update these strategies as the system and threat landscape evolve
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified potential system vulnerabilities that could be revealed through adversarial observation, developed and implemented strategies to conceal these vulnerabilities, and regularly reviews and updates these strategies.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods. The "examine" method can be used to review system configurations and security tools to verify the implementation of concealment and misdirection strategies. The "interview" method can be used to discuss with system administrators and security personnel about the strategies developed and how they are implemented and maintained. The "test" method can be used to simulate adversarial activities and observe whether the system responses are concealed or misdirected as intended.

title: Covert Channel Analysis
purpose: The purpose of this control is to identify and manage covert channels to prevent unauthorized data leakage. Covert channels can be used to bypass security mechanisms and leak sensitive information, hence it is crucial to analyze and mitigate them.
description: This control requires the organization to conduct a covert channel analysis to identify potential data leakage paths. The organization must document the covert channels, rate their risk levels, and apply appropriate mitigation measures.
implementation_guidance: Identify Potential Covert Channels:** Start by identifying potential covert channels in your system. These could be hidden processes, unauthorized network connections, or unusual system behavior

Conduct Covert Channel Analysis:** Use specialized tools and techniques to analyze the identified covert channels. This could involve network traffic analysis, process monitoring, and system behavior analysis
Document Findings:** Document all identified covert channels, their potential impact, and the data they could potentially leak
Risk Assessment:** Rate the risk level of each identified covert channel based on its potential impact and the sensitivity of the data it could leak

Mitigation Measures:** Apply appropriate mitigation measures to manage the identified risks. This could involve system configuration changes, application of security patches, or implementation of additional security controls
Review and Update:** Regularly review and update the covert channel analysis to account for system changes and emerging threats
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has conducted a covert channel analysis, documented the findings, rated the risk levels, and applied appropriate mitigation measures. They will also check that the analysis is regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: System Partitioning
purpose: The purpose of this control is to isolate system components or subsystems to reduce the potential harm from a security breach. It helps to limit the impact of a security event by preventing it from spreading across the entire system.
description: This control requires the organization to partition system components into separate physical or logical domains, or both, with security controls applied to control the flow of information between those partitions.
implementation_guidance: Identify and categorize system components based on their functionality, sensitivity of the data they process, and their exposure to risks
Design and implement partitions to isolate these components. This could be achieved through physical separation, network segmentation, or use of virtualization technologies
Apply appropriate security controls to each partition to control the flow of information between them. This could include firewalls, access control lists, or encryption
Regularly review and update the partitioning scheme to reflect changes in system components or risk exposure
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has effectively partitioned its system components and applied appropriate security controls to each partition. They will also check that the partitioning scheme is regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Non-modifiable Executable Programs
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized changes to executable programs, which could potentially compromise the integrity of the system, lead to unauthorized access, or result in other security incidents.
description: This control requires that the organization implements security measures to ensure that executable programs cannot be modified by unauthorized personnel. This includes the use of access controls, cryptographic mechanisms, or other methods as appropriate.
implementation_guidance: Identify all executable programs within the system that should be protected from modification
Implement access controls to restrict who can modify these programs. This could include user permissions, role-based access control, or other methods
Use cryptographic mechanisms to protect the integrity of the executable programs. This could include digital signatures, checksums, or other methods
Regularly review and update these controls to ensure they remain effective as the system and threat landscape evolve
Document all processes and controls in the System Security Plan (SSP)
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all executable programs that need to be protected, implemented appropriate access controls and cryptographic mechanisms, and regularly reviews and updates these controls. They will also check that these processes are documented in the SSP.

title: External Malicious Code Identification
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the integrity of the information system by identifying and blocking malicious code from external sources. This is crucial for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access, data breaches, and potential system damage.
description: This control requires the organization to implement mechanisms to identify and block malicious code from external sources. This includes code in emails, websites, and other data files that are transmitted over the organization's networks.
implementation_guidance: Identify Potential Threats:** Understand the types of malicious code that could potentially harm your system. This includes viruses, worms, trojans, and other forms of malware
Implement Security Measures:** Install and maintain up-to-date antivirus software and intrusion detection systems. These tools will help identify and block malicious code
Monitor Network Traffic:** Regularly monitor network traffic to detect any unusual activity that could indicate the presence of malicious code
Educate Employees:** Train employees to recognize potential threats, such as phishing emails, and to avoid clicking on suspicious links or downloading unverified files
Regular Updates and Patches:** Ensure that all systems and software are regularly updated and patched to protect against known vulnerabilities that could be exploited by malicious code
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented mechanisms to identify and block malicious code. They will also check that these mechanisms are regularly updated and that employees are trained to recognize potential threats.

title: Distributed Processing and Storage
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization securely distributes, processes, and stores information across a wide range of resources. This is important for security and compliance as it helps prevent unauthorized access, alteration, or destruction of data.
description: This control requires the organization to implement security measures that protect information when it is processed, transmitted, and stored in a distributed environment. This includes ensuring that the distributed architecture is secure and that data is protected during transmission and at rest.
implementation_guidance: Identify all distributed processing and storage systems within the organization
Develop and implement a security plan for each system that includes measures to protect data during transmission and at rest
Implement security controls such as encryption, access controls, and secure network protocols to protect data
Regularly review and update the security plan and controls to address changes in the distributed environment and emerging threats
Train staff on the security measures and their responsibilities in protecting data in the distributed environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all distributed processing and storage systems, implemented a security plan for each, and regularly reviews and updates these plans. They will also look for evidence of security controls such as encryption and access controls, and that staff are trained on their responsibilities.

title: Out-of-band Channels
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the integrity and confidentiality of transmitted information by providing an alternative communication path or channel that is separate from the primary communication path. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to prevent unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information during transmission.
description: This control requires organizations to establish and use out-of-band channels for high-security level communications. The out-of-band channels should be physically or logically separated from the primary network to prevent unauthorized access or disclosure of information.
implementation_guidance: Identify the types of information that require high-security level communications
Determine the appropriate out-of-band channels for transmitting such information. This could be a separate network, a dedicated line, or a secure messaging system
Establish the out-of-band channels ensuring they are physically or logically separated from the primary network
Implement policies and procedures for using the out-of-band channels. This should include when and how to use them, and who has access
Train staff on the policies and procedures to ensure they understand the importance of using out-of-band channels for high-security level communications
Regularly review and update the out-of-band channels as necessary to maintain their security and effectiveness
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified the types of information that require high-security level communications, established appropriate out-of-band channels, and implemented policies and procedures for their use. They will also check that staff have been trained on these policies and procedures.
assessment_methods: Compliance will be verified using the following methods:

title: Operations Security
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the organization's operations related to its information systems from potential threats and vulnerabilities. It ensures that the organization's operations are conducted in a secure manner, reducing the risk of unauthorized access, alteration, or destruction of information.
description: This control requires organizations to implement safeguards to protect their information systems during the execution of operational processes. It involves the use of secure operating procedures, protection of information at rest and in transit, and the prevention of unauthorized changes to software, firmware, and information.
implementation_guidance: Identify Operational Processes:** Identify all operational processes that involve the use of information systems

Develop Secure Operating Procedures:** Develop and document secure operating procedures for each identified process. These procedures should detail how to securely execute each process to prevent unauthorized access, alteration, or destruction of information

Implement Security Measures:** Implement security measures to protect information at rest and in transit during the execution of operational processes. This could involve the use of encryption, secure networks, and secure storage solutions

Prevent Unauthorized Changes:** Implement measures to prevent unauthorized changes to software, firmware, and information. This could involve the use of access controls, change management procedures, and integrity checks
Train Staff:** Train all staff involved in operational processes on the secure operating procedures and the importance of operations security
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that secure operating procedures have been developed and implemented, that security measures are in place to protect information at rest and in transit, and that measures are in place to prevent unauthorized changes. They will also look for evidence that staff have been trained on these procedures and measures.

title: Process Isolation
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that individual system processes are separated from each other in order to prevent any malicious or erroneous activities from affecting other processes. This is important for security and compliance as it helps to limit the potential impact of a security breach.
description: This control requires the organization to implement process isolation measures to prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources. It ensures that each process runs in its own protected space to prevent interference and data leakage between processes.
implementation_guidance: Identify all system processes that require isolation. This could be based on the sensitivity of the data they handle or their criticality to system operations
Implement isolation measures such as running processes in separate memory spaces, using different user accounts for different processes, or employing virtualization technologies
Regularly review and update process isolation measures to ensure they remain effective as the system evolves
Document all process isolation measures in the System Security Plan (SSP), including the rationale for their implementation and any exceptions
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that process isolation measures have been implemented and are being managed effectively. They will also check that these measures are documented in the SSP.

title: Wireless Link Protection
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the integrity and confidentiality of information transmitted over wireless links. It is important for security and compliance because wireless links can be more vulnerable to interception and unauthorized access than wired connections.
description: This control requires organizations to implement security measures to protect information transmitted over wireless links. These measures should prevent unauthorized access, ensure the integrity of the data, and maintain the confidentiality of the information.
implementation_guidance: Identify all wireless links within your organization's information system
Evaluate the security risks associated with each wireless link
Implement security measures to protect the information transmitted over each wireless link. These measures may include encryption, authentication protocols, and intrusion detection systems
Regularly review and update these security measures to respond to new threats and vulnerabilities
Document all implemented security measures in your System Security Plan (SSP)
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all wireless links, evaluated the associated security risks, implemented appropriate security measures, and documented these measures in the SSP. They will also check that these measures are regularly reviewed and updated.

title: Port and I/O Device Access
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized and potentially malicious access to system resources through physical ports and I/O devices. It is crucial for security and compliance as it helps to protect the system from physical attacks, data leakage, and unauthorized device connections.
description: This control requires the organization to manage the access of information system ports and I/O devices, allowing only authorized connections. It involves the use of technical and procedural controls to restrict, monitor, and log access to system ports and devices.
implementation_guidance: Identify and Document:** Identify all physical ports and I/O devices on the system and document their purpose and normal use

Develop Policies and Procedures:** Develop and implement policies and procedures for managing access to these ports and devices. This should include the process for authorizing and de-authorizing access
Implement Technical Controls:** Implement technical controls to enforce these policies. This could include disabling unused ports, using port control software, or physically securing ports
Monitor and Log Access:** Monitor and log all access to system ports and devices. This will help to detect any unauthorized access or unusual activity
Review and Update:** Regularly review and update the policies, procedures, and controls as necessary, based on the monitoring and logging data and any changes in the system or threat environment
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified all system ports and I/O devices, implemented appropriate policies and procedures for managing access, enforced these policies with technical controls, and is monitoring and logging access.

title: Sensor Capability and Data
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the organization has the ability to monitor and analyze system behavior, traffic patterns, and user behavior to detect and respond to potential security incidents. This control is crucial for maintaining the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of the system and its data.
description: This control requires the organization to implement sensors at various points within the system to collect security-related information. The organization must also analyze and correlate the collected data to detect potential security incidents.
implementation_guidance: Identify key points within the system where sensors can be placed to collect meaningful security-related information. This could include network entry and exit points, servers, databases, and user endpoints
Determine the types of sensors needed. This could include intrusion detection systems, firewalls, log monitors, and user behavior analytics tools
Implement the chosen sensors at the identified points within the system
Establish procedures for analyzing and correlating the collected data. This could involve using security information and event management (SIEM) systems or other analytics tools
Regularly review and update the sensor placement, types, and analysis procedures to ensure they remain effective as the system and threat landscape evolve
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that sensors have been implemented at appropriate points within the system, that the sensors are collecting relevant security-related information, and that the organization is effectively analyzing and correlating the collected data to detect potential security incidents.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Transmission Confidentiality
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the confidentiality of information transmitted over networks. This is crucial for security and compliance as it prevents unauthorized individuals from intercepting and accessing sensitive data during transmission.
description: This control requires organizations to implement security measures that protect the confidentiality of information transmitted over networks. This includes both internal and external networks and applies to all forms of transmission mediums.
implementation_guidance: Identify sensitive data:** Determine what data is sensitive and requires protection during transmission. This could include personal data, financial data, proprietary information, etc

Choose appropriate encryption methods:** Implement strong encryption methods for data transmission. This could include protocols like Secure Sockets Layer (SSL), Transport Layer Security (TLS), or Internet Protocol Security (IPSec)
Implement secure transmission protocols:** Use secure transmission protocols that include encryption, such as HTTPS for web traffic
Train staff:** Ensure all staff are trained on the importance of transmission confidentiality and how to use secure transmission methods
Monitor and update:** Regularly monitor the effectiveness of your transmission confidentiality measures and update them as necessary to respond to new threats or changes in your organization's needs
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has identified sensitive data, implemented appropriate encryption methods, uses secure transmission protocols, has trained staff on these measures, and regularly monitors and updates these measures.

title: Usage Restrictions
purpose: The purpose of this control is to prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources. It is important for security and compliance as it helps to prevent data leakage, unauthorized data access, and potential breaches.
description: This control requires organizations to enforce restrictions on the use of shared system resources by various types of users and processes. It also mandates the implementation of usage restrictions for functions, ports, protocols, and services in accordance with the risk management strategy.
implementation_guidance: Identify shared system resources and understand their usage patterns
Define usage restrictions for each shared resource based on the sensitivity of the data it handles and the risk associated with its misuse
Implement technical controls to enforce these usage restrictions. This could involve configuring system settings, installing security software, or using other technical measures
Document the usage restrictions and the measures taken to enforce them in the System Security Plan (SSP)
Regularly review and update the usage restrictions and their enforcement measures to ensure they remain effective and relevant
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that usage restrictions have been defined and are being enforced. They will also check that these restrictions are documented in the SSP and are regularly reviewed and updated.
assessment_methods: Compliance can be verified through a combination of methods:

title: Detonation Chambers
purpose: The purpose of this control is to protect the system and its data from potential threats and vulnerabilities that could be introduced by untested or unverified code. It ensures that any code, software, or executable is tested in a controlled and isolated environment before being introduced into the system.
description: This control requires organizations to implement a controlled and isolated environment, known as a detonation chamber, to execute and observe the behavior of unverified or untested code. This helps in identifying any potential threats or vulnerabilities before the code is introduced into the system.
implementation_guidance: Identify the need:** Understand the types of code, software, or executables that your organization uses and the potential risks associated with them
Design the chamber:** Design a controlled and isolated environment that can effectively test and observe the behavior of the code
Implement the chamber:** Develop and implement the detonation chamber in your system
Test the chamber:** Test the chamber with different types of code to ensure it is working effectively
Monitor and update:** Regularly monitor the chamber and update it as necessary to ensure it continues to effectively identify potential threats and vulnerabilities
assessment_objectives: Assessors will look for evidence that the organization has implemented a detonation chamber, that it is being used to test and observe the behavior of unverified or untested code, and that it is effectively identifying potential threats and vulnerabilities.
assessment_methods: Compliance will be verified through a combination of methods:

title: System Time Synchronization
purpose: The purpose of this control is to ensure that the system's internal clocks are synchronized with an authoritative time source. This is crucial for security and compliance as it ensures accurate time-stamping of events, logs, and transactions, which is essential for incident response, forensics, and maintaining the integrity of the system.
